At CARIAD, we're bundling and further expanding the Volkswagen Group's software expertise. We’re uniting over 6,500 global experts to build a scalable technology stack, including a software platform, unified electronic architecture and reliable connection to the automotive cloud. Our CARIDIANS are developing vehicle functions such as driver assistance systems, a next-generation infotainment platform, power electronics and charging technology, and digital services in and around the vehicle.

Our software can already be found in Volkswagen ID. models and will soon power Audi and Porsche vehicles with the E3 1.2 platform in 2024.

It's no easy task, but with experts like you, we can shape the future of mobility. Join us at CARIAD and be part of this exciting journey!

YOUR TEAM
Our interdisciplinary team "engineering cross functions" jointly works on running and refining existing on-premises and cloud backend solutions, as well as implementing new and innovative functions and services. Delivering outstanding customer satisfaction is our primary objective. Our operations model is based on a DevOps / System of systems culture.

We are looking for self-motivated, self-reliant, and flexible new colleagues with a pioneering and innovative spirit to join our team.

WHAT YOU WILL DO

Lead the analysis and track the problems in the Mobile Online Services backend solutions
Coordinate different stakeholders involved in problem management, e.g., DevOps teams, brand representatives, management and other support units
Support Operations transition & DevOps transformation in the scope of Mobile Online Services, implementation of best practices
Enable Operations, partners and DevOps teams to support upcoming platforms E3 1.2 and E3 2.0 E2E solution and services
Identify improvement potential in the areas of software, monitoring, incident handling and processes as well as taking necessary steps to implement improvements
Be responsible for Quality Insurance and Governance of IT Service Management processes through KPI tracking
Participate in different management boards and organize review meetings


WHO YOU ARE

Successfully completed studies in the field of computer science or comparable studies or qualification
Several years IT technical experience or very good technical affinity (want to have dirty hands)
Excellent technical understanding and motivation to dig into the architectural concepts of our solutions (ITIL is not just a buzzword)
Organized, structured skills and able to deal with complex systems
Broad experience in IT Operations and in handling sensitive data and IT security issues
Fluent English language skills (verbal and written), German is a plus


NICE TO KNOW 

Remote work options
Temporary work from abroad in selected countries
Flextime / optional working hours
Company pension plan
Annual professional development
Sabbatical option up to 6 months
30 days paid + 10 days unpaid leave
Possibility for VW Group car leasing

Leidenschaft für technologischen Fortschritt ausleben? Dabei sein, wenn Innovationen Wirklichkeit werden? Bei FERCHAU suchen wir Menschen mit dem gleichen Anspruch! Wir realisieren spannende Projekte für namhafte Anbieter und Entwickler von IT-Lösungen und überzeugen täglich mit fundierter Expertise und fachlichem Know-how.
  
Das ist zukünftig dein Job
• Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen extrahieren, transformieren und laden (ETL)
• Datenpipelines und -systeme entwerfen, implementieren und warten, die eine hohe Skalierbarkeit, Zuverlässigkeit und Leistung gewährleisten
• Datenqualität und -integrität sicherstellen und Datenbereinigung und -bereicherung durchführen
• Datenmodelle und -schemata erstellen und optimieren
• Datenanalyse und -visualisierung durchführen, um Muster, Trends und Anomalien zu erkennen und zu interpretieren
• Datenberichte und -dashboards erstellen und präsentieren, die aussagekräftige Metriken und Erkenntnisse liefern
• Künstliche Intelligenz (KI) und maschinelles Lernen (ML) anwenden, um prädiktive und präskriptive Modelle zu entwickeln und zu validieren, die Geschäftsentscheidungen unterstützen
• Mit Datenwissenschaftlern, Datenarchitekten, Produktmanagern und anderen Stakeholdern zusammenarbeiten, um Datenanforderungen zu verstehen und zu erfüllen
• Neue Datenquellen und -technologien erforschen und bewerten, um die Datenfähigkeiten zu verbessern und zu erweitern
• Best Practices und Standards für Datenmanagement, -sicherheit und -ethik einhalten und fördern

Das sind deine Perspektiven für die Zukunft
• Unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag
• Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
• Zuschuss für Bildschirmarbeitsplatzbrillen
• Satte Rabatte mit Einkaufsvergünstigungen, z. B. bei Reisen, Elektronik oder Autos

• Mehr als der BAP: Wir bieten Sonderurlaub, Kindergartenzuschuss, Jubiläumszuwendungen u. v. m.
• Echter Teamspirit und Leidenschaft für das, was wir tun
  
Unsere Erwartungen an dich
• Ein Bachelor-Abschluss oder höher in Informatik, Mathematik, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich
• Mindestens drei Jahre Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse, dem Datenengineering oder einem ähnlichen Bereich
• Umfassende Kenntnisse und Erfahrung in der Programmierung mit Python, SQL, Java oder anderen Sprachen
• Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit verschiedenen Datenbanken, Datenplattformen und Datenwerkzeugen, wie z. B. MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Hadoop, Kafka, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Tableau, Power BI etc.
• Erfahrung in der Anwendung von KI- und ML-Techniken, wie z. B. Regression, Klassifikation, Clustering, Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Deep Learning etc.
• Starke analytische und problemlösende Fähigkeiten
• Hohe Aufmerksamkeit für Details und Genauigkeit
• Fähigkeit, selbstständig und im Team zu arbeiten
• Fähigkeit, sich schnell an neue Datenanforderungen und -technologien anzupassen
• Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

About The Role

Zalando’s Customer Relationship Management (CRM) department is looking for a Principal Data Engineer to help us scale our CRM Data Platform. In this pivotal role, you will be a major contributor to Zalando's mission of establishing a robust and trustworthy experimentation infrastructure, central to our data-driven decision-making process. Your expertise will be key in developing and managing comprehensive data engineering systems and metric definitions, crucial for analyzing experimental results and supporting the use of both internal and third-party systems.

As a Principal Data Engineer, you'll play a significant part in crafting data-driven systems that reasonate with millions and convert intent into long-term customer relation. Your domain will be the whole spectrum of helping to drive customer activation, engagement, retention, and lifetime. You will be at the center of fostering a culture of continual innovation and growth, ensuring every product change is rigorously tested and underpinned by accurate, high-quality data. Your contribution is crucial in supporting our organization's commitment to expanding Zalando’s CRM culture, ensuring accurate, high-quality data supports all informed decision-making.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)



 You will work closely with other engineers, data analysts and data scientists to understand the data requirements, design and build data workflows, and ensure that they are efficient, performant, and scalable. 
 You will take ownership of the architecture, design, development, deployment, and operations of the data workflows you will build and ensure that all workflows adhere to best practices in terms of data governance, data security, and data quality assurance. 
 You will leverage your in-depth knowledge to mentor and support colleagues, and share your knowledge across the CRM Data Platform. 
 You will document workflow designs, configurations, and customizations to ensure knowledge transfer and best practice sharing within the team. 
 You will enable accurate and comprehensive metric definitions and aggregations essential for interpreting customer lifecycle results. 
 You will help us promote a culture of data-driven CRM across the organization by ensuring that decision-making is supported by precise, high-quality metrics. 


What We’re Looking For


 High degree of proficiency in software design, operational excellence, and analytical problem-solving. 
 Expertise in running data processing pipelines using distributed data processing frameworks like Apache Spark. Databricks experience is a plus. 
 Experience with near-real-time data ingestion and structured streaming (e.g., SparkStreaming) to create insights and analytics applications. 
 If you think you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every single requirement. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles! 
 Expert level knowledge in SQL and solid programming skills. Java and/or Scala is a plus. 
 Hands-on experience with the AWS ecosystem and workflow tools like Airflow. GCP experience is a plus. 
 Familiarity with Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) and proficiency with bringing and maintaining ML models in production, understanding and applying ML workflows, concepts, tools, algorithms, libraries and platforms to increase automation is a plus. 



OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.


 Employee shares program 
 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners 
 2 paid volunteering days a year 
 Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration 
 Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year 
 27 days of vacation a year to start 
 Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement) 
 Family services, including counseling and support 
 Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass) 
 Mental health support and coaching available 
 Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

I am currently looking for a Data engineer for a leading Pharmaceutical company based in Germany. 

The goal is to extend the data pipelines for the recommendation engine MIA (“Meine Intelligente Assistenz”). 

In the upcoming year, the engine will be prepared for the usage of further Business Unit and will be enriched by further capabilities. 
Within this scope additional data engineering is required.

This project includes the following deliverables:
- Consult the MIA Scrum team in regards to data needs required for additional Business Unit roll out
- Conduct Requirements Analysis – identify adequate data in MSD data landscape for this purpose 
- Extend AWS Redshift views and tables 
- Extend Feature Store by applying SQL and Python Code
- Extend Data Validation Repository by using Great 

Expectation Library
- Adapt AWS Redshift Views/ Tables, FEAST and Data Validation Repository if changes in upstream layers occur
- Deploy changes to test and production environment iteratively in release cycles
- Optimization of existing SQL scripts to resolve redundancies
- Handover to internal data provisioning team

The freelancer should fulfill the following profile, it is required that the candidate has multiple years of experience in
- developing and optimizing SQL-Views and Tables in AWS Redshift
- developing Feature Stores by developing/ optimizing SQL and Python code in AWS environment
- setting up data validations repository similar to Great 

Expectation Library
- working in a Scrum Environment 
- working for a Data Science product
- independent backlog refinement capabilities for own scope based on non-technical requirements 
- communication and data analysis skills to understand the data needs of the Data Scientists and identify the appropriate data based on collaboration with SMEs
- English language, German is a plus

Following technology stack skills are required:
- Programming Languages: Python, SQL
- AWS services: Redshift, S3, Stepfunctions, Sagemaker
- Version control and collaboration: Git, Github 
- CI/CD: Jenkins
- Development environments: Visual studio code, SQL Workbench, dbeaver

Senior Data Engineer - CRM


THE ROLE & THE TEAM

Zalando's Customer Relationship Management (CRM) department is at the forefront of innovation, dedicated to building and maintaining our in-house CRM Platform. This platform is designed to enhance the meaning, relevancy, and engagement of our customers' journey across various communication channels..

As a Senior Data Engineer you will be a key player in expanding and maintaining our diverse portfolio of services. Your expertise will not only contribute to the ongoing success of our internally crafted systems but also play a pivotal role in shaping the strategic evolution of our platform.

INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be the starting point for fashion - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion/our-employee-resource-groups

WHY YOU SHOULD BE INTERESTED


You will ship consistently working, testable, maintainable, readable code/data to production in small and safe iterations. The solutions are performant, scalable and fulfill the set SLOs of the product.
You will develop, monitor, and operate data integration pipelines, deployed as applications on a PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS/GCP), processing hundreds of millions of records to provide high-quality datasets for production, analytical and machine learning use-cases (i.e. customer-level KPI reporting, automation around A/B testing and other causal inference methods, algorithmic message steering).
You will mentor team members and enable them to drive their development goals. 
You will take on the challenge of scaling the systems to process millions of events and requests per day.
You will actively shape the architecture of the Communication Platform and ensure sustainability.
You will make a positive impact on our engineering culture, encouraging knowledge sharing and driving technical discussions within the team


WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF YOU


.. have professional development experience with Scala, Python and Java coding
.. are passionate to write high quality and tested code with proper coverage.
.. have data engineering and integration experience to utilize multiple data sources for production and reporting systems.
.. have solid experience with data engineering technologies such as Spark, Apache Flink, Presto(Trino).. 
.. built up solid knowledge of relational databases, data modeling and solid experience in doing data analysis with SQL.
.. became familiar with DevOps practices and technologies (Docker, AWS, Kubernetes, as well as CI/CD) with keen attention to meaningful logging, monitoring and overall operational excellence.
.. are able to collaborate closely with product management with attention to shaping a great customer experience.
.. carry a mentorship mindset to support team members in their development journey.
.. own good verbal and written communication skills in English and able to present the thoughts in a clear and structured manner.
.. gained knowledge about Spring Boot Microservices, PostgreSQL, processing requests and messages on a high scale would be a plus.

job_title: Senior Data Engineer - Demand Personal Relevance (all genders)
job_desc:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


Lounge by Zalando is the fastest growing part of Zalando, now turning over billions of euros each year. That said, there is so much untapped potential with respect to personalization and recommendation.

You will be the senior data engineer, leading others to build a large scale recommender system . We are the largest online fashion retailer in Europe, as such we need an exceptional engineer who can write Machine Learning pipelines in Spark at a global scale. You will own everything from batch / stream preprocessing, model training, and model / feature distribution to the real time recommender system.

You will have full autonomy to direct architectural decisions, and help to implement state of the art ML recommender algorithms. There are very few roles which offer this unique synthesis of scale and ML complexity.

INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN 

At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)



 Provide critical data infrastructures like large-scale ETL processes, DWHs, stream processing and batch processing pipelines, large-scale high-throughput/low-latency data stores, data governance mechanisms and so on 
 Improve the pace of innovation by building and improving ML infrastructures such as training/evaluation frameworks, experimentation frameworks 
 Collaborate with brilliant Product Managers, Data Scientists, Engineers and Analysts across Zalando to create positive customer impact together 
 Help define our team's objective. Continuously improve the self-organization of the team. 
 Mentor and grow junior and mid-level members of the team 



WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



 You have 6+ years of experience in large-scale data engineering using open source technologies 
 You have solid experience with large-scale batch processing and/or stream processing (e.g. Spark, Hadoop, Flink, Storm, Apache Beam, Kafka, Airflow, Oozie etc.) 
 You are passionate about topics like data democratisation, data governance, privacy, data quality assurance 
 You are proficient in at least one of Python, Scala, Java 
 You have Excellent knowledge of distributed databases, especially high-throughput/low-latency data stores like DynamoDB, Cassandra, Aerospike, Redis etc. is a strong plus 


OUR OFFER

Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.


 Employee shares program 
 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners 
 Two paid volunteering days a year 
 In a hybrid working model with 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration 
 Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year 
 27 days of vacation a year to start 
 Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement) 
 Family services, including counseling and support 
 Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass) 
 Mental health support and coaching are available 
 Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review 


Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

LIGHTHOUSE FOR TALENT

At Trade Republic, we are on a mission to empower everyone to create wealth with easy, safe and free access to the financial system. With over four million customers we are the largest savings platforms in Europe, with users holding over €35 billion on our platform.

We are seen as the go-to-destination for top talent from across the globe. Everyday we strive to make Trade Republic a great environment to do the best work of your life, surrounded by exceptional, caring and passionate colleagues. In addition to learning and growing with a world-class team, you will build a destination for millions of people across Europe to create wealth.



ABOUT THE ROLE

 The Risk Management Tech team is a unit focusing on building models for reporting, analysis and prediction of financial and risk metrics. You will model the Bank's processes into financial concepts such as liquidity, capital and risks - create new understandings and measures.

Projects range from improving data warehouse architecture, building data marts from raw sources, using machine learning techniques to simulate the future, creating testing capabilities on our models, defining and ensuring conventions and best practices or educating stakeholders on how to use our tech stack.

As an Analytics Engineer in the Risk Management Tech team you will own, build, and improve core data models end-to-end. You will work on data warehouse architecture and research solutions that improve our infrastructure to provide clean, lean and accurate datasets.

Please note that the position is based in Berlin, Germany.


WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:

Designing and implementing data products to power financial reporting, risk controlling and other regulatory aspects of running a bank.
Owning your data and decision models end-to-end, from ingestion in our data lake to consumption in a data warehouse or machine learning model.
Understanding how the European regulatory landscape effects data management from a financial, risk and capital markets perspective.
Interacting with stakeholders from Finance, Risk and Treasury to continuously optimise and evolve your models.
Creating dashboards or other visualisations of the output from your modelsDefining data quality rules, standards, and metrics.



WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR:

We are aware that everyone has their individual strengths and weaknesses. The one thing where we don’t compromise is joy for our work and dedication to our shared mission. If you feel you are not ticking all the boxes below, but have a good general feeling about most of them, we would be very happy to talk!

At least 4 years of data or engineering experience with an analytical mindset.
You have built finance, capital, treasury models before - and speaks both lingos from the business and technology side.
You have a strong background in financial/capital markets/risk topics - that you acquired either from business school or by working, preferably both.
Exceptional interpersonal and communication skillsSkilled in prioritisation and effort estimationKnack for research and passion for industry best practices.
Solid understanding of relational databases and pipelining principles.
Experience across all stages of the data pipeline: ingestion, transformations, mart creation
Experience with our tech stack is a bonus: S3/Snowflake/Airflow/Python/DBT/Looker/Metabase



WHY YOU SHOULD APPLY NOW

At Trade Republic you will get to do the best work of your career. We are a destination for people who are exceptional at what they do. Every day, we strive to build a world-class team and provide the space for people to do their best. We have a relentless ambition of raising the bar and expect the best from ourselves. Through our dedicated people-first management approach and transparent career paths, you will have the opportunity to develop and grow your career like never before. And because you are surrounded by a diverse team of high performers, you will be learning every day.


You will play an important role in fixing one of the largest challenges we face - closing the pension gap and democratizing wealth. Trade Republic is a place where your job, your career and your passions intersect. If this gets you fired up, just like it does for all of us at Trade Republic, then reach out!

Trade Republic embraces diversity and strives for equal opportunity for everyone. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, characteristics, perspectives and skills. We encourage applicants of diverse gender, age, sexuality, religion, ethnicity, disability status and parental status to apply to our roles, or those from other intersecting minority groups not listed. The more diverse and inclusive we are as a team, the greater our work will be. If we can support you on DEI related questions during the interview process, please reach out to talentacquisition@traderepublic.com.

Die IGEFA SE & Co. KG ist ein Familienunternehmen mit 28 Standorten in Deutschland sowie 4 weiteren Gesellschaften in Dänemark, Polen, den Niederlanden und Österreich. Unser wertvollstes Kapital sind unsere knapp 3.000 Mitarbeiter, die den Erfolg unseres Unternehmens erst möglich machen.
Die IGEFA E-Commerce GmbH & Co. KG ist innerhalb der IGEFA SE für den Betrieb und die Weiterentwicklung der igefa Onlineshops für den B2C- und B2B-Bereich zuständig.
Für unser Team Berlin-Mitte suchen wir eine*n talentierte*n und erfahrene*n Software Engineer ERP (m/w/d), die*der sich in unserem dynamischen E-Commerce-Team hinter unserem neuen Onlineshop levejo.de engagieren möchte.
Deine Hauptaufgabe besteht darin, innovative Lösungen im Bereich der ERP-Entwicklung zu finden und aktiv an der Optimierung dieser kritischen Prozesse mitzuwirken. Als Mitglied unseres agilen Teams erhältst Du die Möglichkeit, maßgeblich zur Weiterentwicklung unserer E-Commerce-Plattform im Bereich ERP beizutragen.
 Deine Aufgaben
Du verantwortest gemeinsam mit Deinem Team den ERP-Prozess und die nahtlose Verknüpfung zu externen Systemen, wie beispielsweise dem Logistiksystem
Du entwickelst innovative Softwarelösungen, wobei Du Typescript und weitere relevante Technologien einsetzt
Dabei pflegst Du einen kontinuierlichen Austausch mit den benachbarten Teams, um Synergien zu schaffen und eine ganzheitliche Lösung zu gewährleisten
Dein tiefgehendes Cloud-Know-how, insbesondere im Umgang mit AWS, wird für die Skalierung und Verfügbarkeit unserer ERP-Anwendungen entscheidend sein
Im Team entwickelst und pflegst Du die Architektur, um sicherzustellen, dass sie den aktuellen Best Practices und unseren Anforderungen gerecht wird
Als Teil des agilen Teams trägst Du dazu bei, DevOps-Praktiken zu implementieren, einschließlich kontinuierlicher Integration und kontinuierlichem Deployment (CI/CD), um eine effiziente Bereitstellung von Softwareänderungen sicherzustellen

Dafür bringst du mit
Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium oder eine Ausbildung im Bereich Informatik
Deine Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse sind fließend und unverzichtbar, da wir englischsprachige Kollegen im Team haben
Von Vorteil ist Deine Erfahrung in der Entwicklung mit ERP-Systemen, was Dich zu einem wertvollen Teammitglied macht
Du hast Erfahrung in der Verknüpfung von verschiedenen externen Systemen und im Aufbau von lose gekoppelten Architekturen
Von Vorteil ist auch Deine umfassende Erfahrung in der Architektur von Softwarelösungen und Du hast die Fähigkeit, die Architektur kontinuierlich weiterzuentwickeln
Die Beherrschung der Programmiersprache Typescript ist für diese Position von Vorteil
Du bringst DevOps-Kenntnisse mit und bist im Einsatz von kontinuierlicher Integration und kontinuierlicher Deployments z.B. GitHub Actions erfahren
Lösungsorientiertes Denken und Handeln sind für Dich selbstverständlich
Teamfähigkeit und Kommunikationsstärke zeichnen Dich aus
Du bist bereit, kontinuierlich dazuzulernen und Dich in neuen Technologien sowie den neuesten Entwicklungen weiterzuentwickeln

Wir bieten dir
Ein tolles Team, was darauf brennt, mit Dir gemeinsam unseren neuen Onlineshop levejo.de für unsere Kunden zu etablieren und die Weiterentwicklung des Unternehmens aktiv voranzutreiben
Interessante und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeiten in einem agilen und zugleich stabilen Umfeld
Startup-Feeling mit einem Familienunternehmen als starken Partner im Rücken für eine langfristige Beschäftigung
Ein attraktives Gehaltspaket sowie eine Unfallversicherung
Flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung (mit Kernzeit) und Möglichkeit zum mobilen Arbeiten
30 Tage Jahresurlaub für eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsangebote am firmeneigenen igefa-Campus und spannende Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten in einer zukunftsorientierten Organisation
Ein auf Deine Position ausgerichtetes, begleitetes Onboarding in Form von Einarbeitungstagen und einem individuellen Einarbeitungsplan
Helle und moderne Büro- und Kreativräume in Berlin-Mitte mit Blick auf den Fernsehturm inkl. Snackbar, Obst und kostenfreien Getränken (Kaffee, Tee, Wasser)
Ein eigenes JobRad und eine Vielzahl von Mitarbeiterangeboten über Corporate Benefits

About The Team

We are currently looking for a Senior Analytics Engineer to enhance the capabilities of the Global Finance Analytics Team and contribute to SumUp's strategic objectives. The Finance Analytics team focuses on constructing financial KPIs and consolidating merchant funnel steps across various markets and products and contribute to shape the global SumUp strategy with actionable insights.

Your involvement in this experienced data team will make a substantial impact on our business, allowing you to introduce best practices to SumUp and serve as a role model for other domains.

What you'll do:

Develop comprehensive data models by merging data sources from diverse sources, including operational databases (Kafka/PostgreSQL), third-party platforms (Salesforce, SAP), and other domains
Ensure seamless alignment of business logic and Key Performance Indicator (KPI) definitions with various stakeholders across the organization, encompassing data producers (e.g., software developers) to data consumers (e.g., FP&A)
Provide expertise and guidance to Data Analysts on the effective utilization of dbt and the creation of efficient marts and reporting models
Contribute to the design of our in-house self-service analytics stack (Snowflake, dbt) in coordination with the data platform team
Collaborate with the dbt guild to define and implement best practices for multi-repository and model-sharing within the organization
Refine and optimize domain data operations processes, including Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) and Pull Request (PR) review mechanisms

You'll be a great fit for this role if you have:

5+ years of professional work experience in technology, startups, data warehousing, or analytics, with at least 2 years of hands-on experience with dbt
A passion for dbt and a strong focus on structure, scalability, and best practices, including documentation, conventions, and refactoring
Proficiency in Python, Airflow, and cloud environments such as AWS, along with Git
Expertise in cloud data warehousing, ideally with Snowflake
Contributed to implementing a collaborative approach for an effective data mesh organization using dbt core and in-house development
Dealt with commercial and financial data, demonstrating experience in designing, building, and managing complex data models with downstream data mart dependencies
Experience in analyzing business requirements across various functional areas and translating them into actionable data products

Nice to have: 

Experience with fintech data (billing, revenue, payment).
Experience with Data Mesh and multi-repository architecture

Why you should join SumUp:

🌍 Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally on large-scale fintech products used by millions of businesses worldwide, from our Berlin office. This involves an office-first setup

🌈 Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: Be part of a workplace that values and promotes diversity, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's perspectives are respected and embraced

📚 A dedicated annual L&D budget of €2,000 for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education

🚀 Enrolment onto our VSOP program: You will own a stake in SumUp’s future success

💶 A corporate pension scheme where we match up to 20% of your contributions

🔄 30 Days Sabbatical: Enjoy the unique opportunity to take a well-deserved break with our 30 days sabbatical benefit after completing 3 years of employment with SumUp

🔗 Referral Bonus: Earn additional rewards by referring talented individuals to join the SumUp team.

🚵🏾‍♂️ Numerous other benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, relocation assistance, subsidised office lunches

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by Company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

About us:

SumUp is a leading financial technology company, founded in 2012 with the goal of empowering small businesses around the globe. We’re the financial partner of choice for more than 4 million merchants in over 35 markets. We collectively build, plan and fine-tune the technology that drives SumUp and empowers small businesses around the world.

We believe in the everyday hero. Those who have the courage to follow their passion and who have the strength and determination to realise their dreams. Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their business. With a founders mentality and a 'team-first attitude' our diverse teams across Europe, South America, and the United States work together to ensure that small business owners can be successful doing what they love.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don’t tick every box, it’s ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

Are you skilled in the art of transforming raw information into strategic insights? Do you see yourself paving the path for a Data driven mindset transformation? Here at SoSafe we might have the right position for you. Get ready to have a huge impact, drive the heart of our data architecture and shape the future of our analytics infrastructure. Be part of one of the fastest growing Tech Start-Ups and become a Cyber-Security-Hero with us! Help us build the product that creates the Human Firewall within organizations.

Your mission


Provide technical guidance and mentorship to more junior team members, fostering their growth and development in Data engineering 
Lead and take full accountability for the design, development, and deployment of Data engineering solutions to solve complex business problems, encompassing the architectural definition and end-to-end data lifecycle journey from ingestion through to end-user reporting
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data analysts, software engineers, and business stakeholders, to understand requirements and translate them into scalable and performant Data solutions 
Provide streamlined and self-service processes and interfaces to integrate and extend the data pipeline capabilities enabling autonomy in all product teams 
Drive the implementation of best practices, standards, and efficient processes to ensure the reliability, scalability, and accuracy of Data models and systems 
Build and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources 
Monitor and optimize the performance of data pipelines and data processing systems 
Lead and contribute to research and development projects, driving innovation and influencing the path of Data engineering within the organization 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, and business stakeholders, to understand requirements and translate them into scalable and performant Data solutions 
Communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, presenting complex Data concepts and findings in a clear and concise manner 
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in Data, identifying and evaluating new frameworks and technologies that can push further our Data capabilities, and ultimately deciding which ones we should use 
Bootstrapping a data engineering team at an early stage in the team's evolution


Your profile


5+ years of experience in designing, developing, optimizing, and maintaining end-to-end Data solutions in real-world applications 
Familiar with stacks using technologies such as Python, AWS (DMS, Redshift), Java, Spark, Kafka, and SQL; and proficiency with Data libraries and frameworks 
You are curious about and motivated by the latest data engineering technologies, best practises, techniques and future trends in data, AI/ML, and analytics
Solid understanding of up-keeping and growing a data architecture by envisioning the company needs while pushing the state of the art in building scalable data platforms 
Solid understanding of Data concepts for ingesting, storing, serving data 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to approach complex problems in a structured and systematic manner 
The ability to deal directly with business functions and interpret their thoughts into successful data & analytics solutions 
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, enabling effective collaboration, stakeholder management, and mentorship 
Proven leadership abilities, with experience in leading Data projects, guiding teams, and driving technical excellence 
Fluent in English and optionally German 
You are a team player and open-minded for after-work socialising

At SoSafe, you'll be part of a cybersecurity team that thrives on innovation, safeguarding organizations against evolving threats and making the digital world a safer place. About us
 Expatrio aims is to be the best solution for international students in Germany. With a digital platform approach (an all-in-one app) at the interface of Fintech, Govtech, and Edtech, we are accompanying tens of thousands of students on their entire journey from study preparation and visa application to arriving and living in Germany. Always focusing on the most convenient experience for our users, we are aggregating all the needed services and products in one single place and offer bespoke solutions for everyone.
 
 Does the position sound interesting to you? Then we would be very happy to receive your application.
 
 Your Expatrio team
 
 JOIN EXPATRIO
 Expatrio is an ambitious Berlin-based start-up in the field of Fintech and Edtech and currently has a vacancy for the position as
 
 Analytics Engineer (f/m/x)
 
 Our goal is to make the way to and in Germany as easy as possible for international students. If you want to support us in this goal, then you are exactly right with us!
 
 YOUR ROLE 
Building robust data infrastructure for scalability and efficiency: You are responsible for developing and maintaining our data infrastructure and architecture, including data lake and data warehouse. Your focus is on ensuring scalability and efficiency to support our growing needs effectively.
Crafting comprehensive data models aligned with long-term business goals: Your role involves capturing and translating complex business flows into comprehensive data models. You keep long-term business objectives in mind to ensure that our data models align with our overarching strategic goals.
Empowering data-driven decision making through operational metrics: You are tasked with developing and implementing strategies to make key operational metrics readily available to each business area. By enabling data-driven decision making, you help drive the business forward towards success.
Implementing cost-effective and efficient solutions: You seek and implement the simplest yet most reliable solutions, demonstrating a strong understanding of cost-effectiveness and efficiency.
Ensuring data infrastructure reliability and integrity: Your focus lies on prioritizing the reliability and monitoring of our data infrastructure. Ensuring data integrity and availability is essential to support informed decision making and maintain operational excellence.
Leveraging data for compelling business insights: Your responsibility involves developing insightful analysis, visualizations, and dashboards that drive the business forward. By using data to tell compelling stories, you enable stakeholders to make informed decisions and seize opportunities for growth.
 
 YOUR PROFILE 
Experiences: With over 3 years of experience indata engineering and analytics engineering, you have a proven track record ofdelivering reliable data solutions at scale. Additionally, You have accumulatedmore than 3 years of hands-on experience with AWS Cloud, utilizing data services such asGlue, Athena, DMS, andRedshift. Furthermore, your expertise includesproven experience with DevOps techniques, encompassingCICD, multiple environments, and infrastructure as code. You demonstrate a strong understanding of best practices and emerging trends.
Skills: You possess strong analytical skills, demonstrating the ability to translate data into actionable insights. Moreover, proficiency indata visualization tools and techniques is a fundamental aspect of your skill set.
Communication: Your communication skills are excellent, allowing you to effectively convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Additionally, excellent English oral and written communication skills are a must. We primarily communicate in English.
A plus: An AWS certification would be a significant asset to your profile.
 
 WHY EXPATRIO? 
Hybrid working model: We are a hybrid company (within Germany) and offer the option of working remotely within Germany but you are also welcome to work in our wonderful office space in the heart of Berlin (close to U Rosenthaler Platz).
Work setup:We provide you with a complete remote office set-up. This includes a height-adjustable desk, chair, subsidy for using your internet in the remote office and a laptop (Apple or Windows).
Workation:Do you love working from your home country, enjoying the sun by the sea or simply going skiing in winter after work? YES, we love that too. With us, you have the opportunity of working from abroad.
Flexible work: Working according to an unflexible work plan? We don’t think that’s timely anymore! With us, you have the opportunity to work flexible.
Personal development: At Expatrio you will also receive a budget to constantly develop yourself and your skills.
Team events:We love having company parties! From Halloween parties to off-site events, department events, and our quarterly meetings, there’s always something fun going on. It’s never boring, so don’t miss out! ;)
Benefits: Do you like to go shopping, do sports or just do your weekly grocery shopping? With us, you get a monthly subsidy to choose from a variety of perks & benefits (Urban Sports Club, Adidas, REWE etc.).
Vacation: In addition to your contractual vacation entitlement, we also grant 3 extra days of vacation for your own Birthday, X-Mas Eve and New Year’s Eve.
Company culture: What else can we tell you? All in all we are a super international, diverse, and intrinsically motivated team and have an autonomous and progressive work environment with fast decision-making processes. This is not just an empty phrase. This is the way we live it at Expatrio, as it also has a strong impact on our company values.

job_title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Connected Network (all genders)
job_desc:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

In Zalando ZEOS (B2B Logistics), we aim to provide our partners with a profitable fulfillment experience, not only within Zalando but across multiple European marketplaces. To do this, Machine Learning, Operations Research, and Data-driven solutions play a pivotal role. We need Machine Learning Engineers who are excited to leverage Zalando’s large amounts of data and modern technology landscape to build and deploy innovative and impactful scientific and data-driven products in the B2B Logistics space.

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer within the B2B Logistics Applied Science and Data Engineering team, you will be working with Applied Scientists, Data Engineers, Software Engineers, and Product Managers responsible for bringing new ML and OR solutions into the ZEOS partner platform. The forecasting and inventory optimization models you deploy will generate key insights for our partners enabling them to make data-driven decisions about their stock and optimize logistics operations for Zalando and our partners. You will have a key role in defining ZEOS’ Applied Science strategy and helping leadership to identify new opportunities and use cases. Above all, your work will change the way our partners experience logistics services.

WHY YOU SHOULD BE INTERESTED…


 You will be joining a growing team of Applied Scientists and Data Engineers spearheading Applied Science within the ZEOS department. We trust your entrepreneurial capabilities. 
 Responsible for the team’s end-to-end MLOps, and production of machine learning services, including workflow automation and orchestration 
 Tackle challenges for developing algorithms and running them efficiently on resource-constrained platforms 
 Raise the bar in MLOps and help us build long-term sustainable Machine Learning and Applied Science solutions for our partners by introducing best practices for model testing, experimentation, versioning, serving, retraining, monitoring, and alerting 
 Design, implement, and maintain forecasting and inventory optimization solutions that will help our partners make informed decisions about their stock, their growth options, and their monetization opportunities. 
 Define and implement experiment tracking and model monitoring setups to measure our models’ and solutions’ performance and enable their evolution over time. 


WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF…


 Educational background in Software Engineering, Information Technology, or equivalent field. 
 6+ years of experience building software in the industry. 3+ of those years working in the context of Machine Learning or Applied Science projects. You balance technical acumen with business understanding and excel in collaborating with applied scientists and product stakeholders to identify the right balance between MLOps excellence and time-to-market. 
 Experience owning end-to-end Machine Learning or Applied Science projects, with proven experience deploying and maintaining Machine Learning or Operation Research models in production environments. 
 Comfortable using Python and experienced with Machine Learning as well as software development lifecycle. 
 A true team player who thrives in a cross-functional group encompassing multiple different areas of expertise. 
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a detail-oriented and self-starter mindset. You value a diverse and fast-paced business environment and hence balance your passion for data, machine learning, and software engineering with pragmatism to drive results and impact. 


TECHNOLOGIES YOU WILL USE

These are technologies that you can expect to work with and learn about, you don’t need to have experience with all of them, however, it’s a plus if you have experience with these or similar technologies.


 Python 
 SQL 
 Scientific and HPC Libraries
 pytorch 
 numpy 
 scipy 
 numba 
 ortools 
 … 
 GPU Processing 
 Spark 
 Databricks 
 AWS Sagemaker 
 AWS Cloudformation 
 AWS Step Functions 
 AWS API Gateway 
 AWS Lambda 
 AWS S3 
 Docker 
 Kubernetes 
 Nakadi (Kafka) 
 Experiment Tracking 
Weights & Biases / MLFlow / In-house alternatives
 Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, Continuous Testing 
ABOUT ZALANDO


It’s the perfect time to join Zalando’s journey, from being a pioneer in the world of e-commerce, to becoming the Starting Point for Fashion in Europe. We connect customers, brands, and partners across 25 markets.

Help us drive digital and sustainable solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 49 million active customers.

Our values https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-founding-mindset

do.More - our sustainability strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/domore-our-sustainability-strategy

Follow us on Instagram instagram.com/insidezalando

Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

job_title: Cloud Engineer (Azure) - Up to €80k - Exciting Saas Company - German speaking
job_desc:
Fast Growing Fintech is urgently looking for an experienced Cloud Engineer who has worked on Azure projects. You will be working with the latest technology at an exciting stage of the companies history.

Job Responsibilities:
Actively research technological trends, advancements, innovations, and security standards.
Conduct feasibility studies and develop a concept for deploying our products via an Azure-based cloud solution.
Define and implement processes outlined in the concept across the board.
Introduce and ensure best practice processes in the realms of DevOps and DevSecOps.
Serve as a knowledge repository and provide technical expertise in Azure architecture for other project stakeholders.
Your Profile:
Professional qualification in Information Technology, Business Informatics, or equivalent.
Preferably, experience with cloud-based IT architectures.
Graduates (m/f/d) with relevant theoretical background are also welcome.
Desirable, but not mandatory: Azure certifications such as Azure Solutions Architect or similar.
Preferably hands-on experience in CI/CD, DevOps, container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes), and databases (Oracle, MS SQL).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively to achieve team goals.
Very good German language skills (C1) and good English language skills.


Please send your updated CV to mschmidt@optimussearch.com

Wenn es darum geht, zukünftig Millionen Fahrgäste und tausende Züge auch digital auf den Weg zu bringen, braucht es die besten IT-Expert:innen. Über 10.000 haben wir schon, aber längst nicht genug. Als Projektleiter:in, Berater:in, Entwickler:in oder IT-Architekt:in ist jetzt die spannendste Zeit einzusteigen und in einem starken Team wegweisende Lösungen und Großprojekte in den Bereichen Mobilität, Infrastruktur und Logistik umzusetzen.

Das Team Cloud Billing Convertables stellt die Abrechung aller Cloudkosten innerhalb des DB Konzerns fachlich und technisch sicher. Das Team macht Kostenoptimierungen sichtbar und bietet entsprechende Beratung für seine Kunden:innen

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir dich als Senior Cloud Engineer:in (w/m/d) für die DB Systel GmbH am Standort Berlin, Erfurt oder Frankfurt (Main).

Dies ist ein "Wo du Willst-Job": In Abstimmung mit deiner Führungskraft kannst du deinen Arbeitsort innerhalb Deutschlands selbst disponieren und zwischen mobilem Arbeiten und Arbeiten im Büro wählen.

Deine Aufgaben:

Dein Knowhow setzt du gekonnt ein und verantwortest die eigenständige Konzeption der Software- und Systemarchitektur
Als unser:e Senior Cloud Engineer:in liegt die Zuständigkeit für die Entwicklung und den Betrieb der notwendigen Komponenten aus der Architektur in deiner Hand
Zusätzlich gehört in dein Arbeitsgebiet die Sicherstellung des Betriebs der Services und Team-Infrastruktur
Deine Aufgaben umfassen außerdem Sicherstellung des Wissenstransfers sowie einer einheitlichen Dokumentation des Services


Dein Profil:

Basis deines Werdegangs bildet ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium. Alternativ bringst du eine erfolgreich abgeschlossene IT-Berufsausbildung mit
In deiner beruflichen Vergangenheit hast du dir fundierte Kenntnisse im Bereich der Serviceentwicklung- & Betrieb mit Fokus AWS aneignen können
Du verfügst über ausgeprägte Erfahrung als Entwickler:in in einer Hochsprache wie CDK Typescipt, Java, Phyton oder ähnliches
Dir sind Begriffe wie AWS, AWS CDK, GIT Pipeline, SQL (Oracle), Frontendentwicklung (HTML, Javascript, CSS), Docker, ECS, Kubernetes und AWS redshift bekannt
Deine Begeisterung für unsere agile Arbeitsweise, gute Kommunikationsskills sowie fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab


Benefits:

Wir fördern flexible, individuelle Arbeitszeitmodelle und unterstützen, wo es betrieblich möglich ist, durch moderne Arbeitsformen wie Homeoffice oder mobiles Arbeiten.
Du profitierst von Vergünstigungen in den Bereichen Shopping, Freizeitwelt, Reisen und Bahnangebote. Die monatlich wechselnden Angebote beinhalten z.B. Mobilfunkverträge, Versicherungen, Stromtarife, Vergünstigungen bei Hotelketten, Mode und Lifestyle.
Du schaffst Großes und bekommst nicht weniger zurück: ein marktübliches Gehaltspaket mit in der Regel unbefristeten Arbeitsverträgen und Beschäftigungssicherung sowie vielfältige Nebenleistungen und eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge.


Chancengleichheit und selbstbestimmte Teilhabe Schwerbehinderter und Gleichgestellter sowie eine respektvolle Zusammenarbeit sind innerhalb des DB Konzerns fest verankerte Grundsätze. Deshalb werden schwerbehinderte und gleichgestellte Bewerber:innen bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer – System Analysis Reactive (all genders)
job_desc:
Your Mission
As a Software Engineer in the System Analysis Team, you will have a system-wide impact by hunting the sneakiest cross-domain issues and finding solutions in the joint debug sessions both on a test bench and in a car. You will be working with different systems and technologies, maintaining the heat-map of problematic areas and ensuring state of the art technical implementations in coordination with other teams and system architects.

Sneak preview of your future tasks
2-3 years in automotive background
Deeper knowledge of in-car communication including CAN and SOME/IP
Basic knowledge about AUTOSAR classic/adaptive
Fluency in car diagnostics with off-the-shelf tools
Experience running samples in test environment (car / bench)
Deeper knowledge about Linux configuration including systemd
Basic knowledge about QNX configuration
Fluency in using QNX / Linux commands for analyzing the system
Coding experience in Python, C, C++

Your Profile
Education
Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Communication Technology or a comparable qualification

Personal skills
Quick understanding of complex systems
Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Excellent organizational, time management, prioritization and multi-tasking skills
Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
Personal initiative, commitment, perseverance and resilience
Well-developed communication and teamwork skills
Aspiration to engineering excellence

Language skills
Proficient in English, German is a plus!

Why us?
An international, interdisciplinary innovation hub, which is part of the Mercedes-Benz Group AG
Be part of a new generation Mercedes-Benz Operating System (MB.OS) and work in with internal colleagues to deliver the best software
Agile working methods and open feedback culture
Flexible working hours
Mobility, Healthcare budget & Personal development budget
Berlin transportation ticket (BVG)
Relocation support
Company pension after the probation period
In our close collaboration with “inklupreneur.de” we support people with disabilities and welcome everyone

Interested?
We look forward to receiving your complete application, including CV (in English) and relevant references with the following information:
 • Job title and reference number
• Salary expectations
• Earliest start date
 You don't bring everything with you? Don't worry, MBition is proud of our diverse workforce and passionate about having MBitioneers from all backgrounds and perspectives. MBition is and always will be an equal opportunity employer. We are looking for employees who convince us above all with their personality and passionately motivated to join the team!
You are welcome to contact our representative for severely disabled employees, Anna Schade (anna.schade@mercedes-benz.com), who will support you in the further application process.

About us
At MBition, we are bringing digital luxury to mobility users around the world. To accomplish this, we are redefining how software is developed within the automotive field as part of an international Mercedes-Benz software development network. As a 100% subsidiary of Mercedes-Benz Group AG, we develop and integrate the next generation of Mercedes-Benz in-car infotainment systems that are based on the Mercedes-Benz Operating System (MBOS). In addition, we are responsible for the Mercedes me companion app, we provide seamless & connected mobility experiences and we contribute to Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) platform development. With offices in Berlin and Sofia, we are aiming to bring new generation of innovative infotainment systems across the globe.

job_title: Referentin / Referenten (m/w/d) als Daten- und KI‑Expert, Data Scientist oder Data Engineer
company_name: German Federal Ministry of Digital and Transport
job_desc:
Wir, das Bundesministerium für Digitales und Verkehr (BMDV) sind der Taktgeber für Digitalisierung und klimafreundliche Mobilität als wesentliche Grundlagen für unsere moderne Gesellschaft. Die Digitalisierung bietet unzählige Chancen, das Leben einfacher zu machen und den Mobilitätsanforderungen der Zukunft zu begegnen. Mobilität muss für alle bezahlbar und zugleich klimafreundlich sein. Sie muss alle Regionen des Landes in der Zukunft verlässlich vernetzen. Die Unterstützung digitaler Zukunftstechnologien und ihrer infrastrukturellen Voraussetzungen ist eine unserer Kernaufgaben. Die Planung, Schaffung und der Erhalt moderner Breitbandnetze sowie einer leistungsfähigen und modernen Verkehrsinfrastruktur bilden das Fundament für unsere Aufgabenerfüllung.

Das Bundesministerium für Digitales und Verkehr (BMDV) ist Teil eines 357.582 km² großen Karrierenetzwerks, bestehend aus über 40 Behörden mit rund 24.000 Beschäftigten. Mehr unter https://www.damit-alles-läuft.de

Das Bundesministerium für Digitales und Verkehr (BMDV) sucht für das Referat Z 35 (Datenlabor) der Zentralabteilung zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt, unbefristet, eine/einen
Referentin / Referenten (m/w/d) als Daten- und KI‑Expert, Data Scientist oder Data Engineer

Der Dienstort ist Berlin oder Bonn.
Referenzcode der Ausschreibung 20240494_9346

Dafür brauchen wir Sie:
Konzeptionelle Entwicklung sowie Programmierung und Betreuung von Datenanwendungen
Konzeption und Umsetzung von Projekten für die innovative Datennutzung
Schnelle und agile Entwicklung von Datenanalysen und Visualisierungen für datengetriebene Entscheidungen mit Erstellung von Dashboards zur Datenvisualisierung
Entwicklung von Datenmodellen zur Informationsgewinnung unter Nutzung von statistischen Verfahren und modernen Data-Science-Methoden, wie z. B. Maschine Learning oder Text Mining
Zusammenarbeit mit den Fachabteilungen des BMDV, den Behörden im Geschäftsbereich und externen Dienstleistern im Zusammenhang mit Projekten des Datenlabors
Entwicklung von innovativen technischen Ansätzen für Datenmanagement und Datenanalysen sowie Dashboard-Design
Bedarfserhebung und Beratung im Themenbereich Datennutzung
Projektmanagement mit innovativen Methoden und gutem Stakeholdermanagement und Fortschrittscontrolling

Ihr Profil:

Das sollten Sie unbedingt mitbringen:
Abgeschlossene wissenschaftliche Hochschulausbildung mit der Fachrichtung Mathematik, Statistik, (Wirtschafts‑)Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder als Data Scientist, Data Engineer oder vergleichbare Hochschulstudiengänge mit datenbezogener, empirischer oder digitaler Ausrichtung (Master, Magister bzw. Diplom/Universität)

Das wäre wünschenswert:
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen Datenaufbereitung, Datenanalyse und Datenvisualisierung
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, auch in ungewohnten Situationen und unter Berücksichtigung von Beteiligten fehlerfreie und nützliche Arbeitsergebnisse zu liefern
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, Arbeitsaufträge auch in einem größeren Verantwortungsbereich termingerecht zu erledigen
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, Sachverhalte auch gegenüber wenig vertrauten Adressaten zielgruppenadäquat zu vermitteln
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, auch in unsicheren Situationen und mit Personengruppen konstruktiv, verlässlich sowie unterstützend zusammenzuarbeiten
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, vertraute, aber auch komplexe Sachverhalte zu erfassen und sich durch Abwägen einer Vielzahl zusammenhängender Faktoren ein Urteil zu bilden
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, unter einer kurz-/mittelfristigen Perspektive, auch Verantwortung für die übertragenen Aufgaben innerhalb eines größeren Arbeitsbereiches zu übernehmen
Im Rahmen der Fachkenntnisse sind wichtig:
Eine höhere Programmiersprache (z. B. R oder Python)
Erfahrung mit klassischer Statistiksoftware und modernen Analyse‑/Visualisierungstools (z. B. Tableau, Power BI o. ä.)
ausgeprägte mathematisch-analytische Fähigkeiten, ein Gespür für quantitative Zusammenhänge und Freude an der Arbeit mit Daten
Kenntnisse bzw. praktische Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Anbindung von Schnittstellen (APIs), WebScraping, maschinelles Lernen und/oder künstliche Intelligenz, Datenaufbereitung, Datenanalyse und Datenvisualisierung, zusätzliche Erfahrung in Softwareentwicklung ist wünschenswert
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, auch wenig vertraute Inhalte unter Einsatz von Gestattungstechniken und vor einer Gruppe begeisternd zu präsentieren
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, auch Zusammenhänge und Abhängigkeiten eines größeren Verantwortungsbereiches und angrenzender Bereiche zu erkennen und zu berücksichtigen

Das bieten wir Ihnen:
Die Vergütung erfolgt nach Entgeltgruppe 14 TVöD.

Eine Verbeamtung ist bei Erfüllung der persönlichen Voraussetzungen möglich.

Beamtinnen und Beamte werden in ihrem bisherigen Amt (maximal Besoldungsgruppe A 14) nach einer vorangehenden Abordnung versetzt.

Beamtinnen und Beamte können im BMDV bei Vorliegen der Voraussetzungen die Besoldungsgruppe A 15 BBesO erreichen.

Im BMDV wird eine Zulage für oberste Bundesbehörden gezahlt. Die Zulage beträgt bei Vollbeschäftigten bis zu 330,00 Euro.

Das Bundesministerium für Digitales und Verkehr versteht sich als familienfreundlicher Arbeitgeber und wurde entsprechend zertifiziert. Weitere Informationen finden Sie unter www.berufundfamilie.de

Unseren Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern stehen Kindertagesplätze im Rahmen eines Kooperationsvertrages mit einem überregionalen freigemeinnützigen Träger von Krippen, Kindergärten und Horten in Berlin, Potsdam und Nordrhein-Westfalen sowohl dienststellennah Belegplätze in einer Kindertagesstätte in Berlin und zwei Kindertagesstätten in Bonn zur Verfügung.

Die Behörde unterstützt die Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie. Wir bieten unseren Beschäftigten individuelle Arbeitszeitabsprachen sowie Teil- und Gleitzeit, um die Vereinbarkeit von Berufs- und Familieninteressen zu berücksichtigen. Es gibt die Möglichkeit des mobilen Arbeitens. Bei Betreuungsengpässen steht ein Eltern-Kind-Arbeitszimmer zur Verfügung. Wir fördern aktiv die Gesundheit der Beschäftigten durch das Angebot an Sport- und Gesundheitsmaßnahmen. Die Aus-, Fort- und Weiterbildung, auch während einer Elternzeit, erfolgt angepasst an den individuell festgestellten Bedarf.

Das BMDV hat im Jahr 2020 die Urkunde der Charta der Vielfalt unterzeichnet und fördert aktiv Unterschiedlichkeiten und gestaltet Vielfalt in der Behörde.

Besondere Hinweise:
Von Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern des BDMV wird eine ausgeprägte Antidiskriminierungs- und Gleichstellungsorientierung erwartet.

Die Stelle ist grundsätzlich zur Besetzung mit Teilzeitbeschäftigten geeignet.

Bewerbungen von Frauen sind ausdrücklich erwünscht. Bei gleicher Qualifikation werden Frauen nach Maßgabe des § 8 Bundesgleichstellungsgesetz (BGleiG) bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

Schwerbehinderte Menschen werden bei gleicher fachlicher Eignung bevorzugt eingestellt. Es wird nur ein Mindestmaß an körperlicher Eignung verlangt.

Wir begrüßen die Bewerbung von Menschen aller Nationalitäten. Die Auswahl erfolgt durch eine Kommission.

Zur Durchführung eines Leistungsvergleichs werden für die Tarifbeschäftigten des BMDV und seines Geschäftsbereichs vom Personalreferat des BMDV Leistungseinschätzungen, die sich verfahrensmäßig an den jeweils im Geschäftsbereich geltenden Richtlinien für die beamtenrechtliche Beurteilung orientieren, eingeholt. Die Tarifbeschäftigten erklären mit ihrer Bewerbung ihr Einverständnis zur Durchführung dieser Maßnahme.

Fühlen Sie sich angesprochen?
Dann bewerben Sie sich bitte bis zum 26.03.2024 über das Elektronische Bewerbungsverfahren (EBV) auf der Einstiegsseite: https://www.bav.bund.de/Einstieg-EBV

Wählen Sie dort „Bewerbung mittels Referenzcode“ aus und geben Sie bitte im Verlauf Ihrer Bewerbung den Referenzcode 20240494_9335 ein. Die Benutzerdokumentation finden Sie über den o. g. Link.

Bitte laden Sie im weiteren Verlauf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (Lebenslauf, Motivationsschreiben, Arbeitszeugnisse/dienstliche Beurteilung, Uni‑Diplom/Masterurkunde, ‑zeugnis und Staatsprüfungen [Zeugnisse, Urkunden]) als Anlage in Ihr Kandidatenprofil hoch.

Zusätzlich pflegen Sie bitte in Ihrem Kandidatenprofil unter „Ausbildung/Abschlüsse“ Ihren Studienabschluss und unter „Berufserfahrung“ Ihre letzten 3 Arbeitgeber ein.

Bei ausländischen Bildungsabschlüssen bitten wir um Übersendung entsprechender Nachweise über die Gleichwertigkeit mit einem deutschen Abschluss. Nähere Informationen hierzu entnehmen Sie bitte der Internetseite der Zentralstelle für ausländisches Bildungswesen (ZAB) unter https://kmk.org/zab oder unter dem Infoportal zu ausländischen Bildungsabschlüssen https://anabin.kmk.org/anabin.html. Bei der Zeugnisbewertung ggf. anfallende Gebühren können nicht erstattet werden.

Arbeitnehmerinnen und Arbeitnehmer werden gebeten, ein Zeugnis ihres letzten Arbeitgebers ihren Bewerbungsunterlagen beizufügen.

Beamtinnen und Beamte werden gebeten, ihre aktuelle dienstliche Beurteilung beizufügen.
Wir bitten Sie zu beachten, dass fehlende erbetene Bewerbungsunterlagen dazu führen können, dass wir Ihre Bewerbung im weiteren Verfahren nicht berücksichtigen.

Ansprechpersonen:
Für Fragen im Zusammenhang mit dem Elektronischen Bewerbungsverfahren steht Ihnen die Bundesanstalt für Verwaltungsdienstleistungen unter der Rufnummer 04941 602‑240 zur Verfügung.

Folgende Ansprechpersonen stehen Ihnen im BMDV zur Verfügung:

für fachliche Fragen: Frau Dr. Grass, verena.grass@bmdv.bund.de, Tel.: 030 18300‑7828
für organisatorische Fragen: Herr Klebe, maximilian.klebe@bmdv.bund.de

https://bmdv.bund.de
https://www.bav.bund.de

As a leading expert for Digital Platform Building and Customer Experience Innovation, NETCONOMY is shaping the digital leadership of its clients. We help brands to build flexible and scalable digital platforms, with top-notch technologies by SAP, Google Cloud and Microsoft Azure. NETCONOMY has 20 years of experience and employs close to 500 professionals across Europe. By introducing and driving innovation initiatives around customer experience, we support clients on the road of expanding their core business in the digital world.

Over the past 20 years, NETCONOMY has grown from a startup to a 500-people team working across 10 European locations. We believe in the power of agile and cross-functional collaboration, bringing together people from various backgrounds to create outstanding digital solutions.

YOUR JOB

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a crucial role in driving innovation and implementing cutting-edge machine learning solutions. Join our dynamic team and contribute to the development of intelligent systems that solve complex problems and enhance our business capabilities.

Your Job’s Key Responsibilities Are

Designing and implementing machine learning models, solutions, and pipelines to address business challenges and opportunities
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand requirements, providing technical expertise, and delivering scalable and robust solutions
Conducting research and evaluation of emerging machine learning techniques
Working independently on Proof of Concepts (PoC) to validate and showcase the feasibility of proposed solutions
Conducting direct client communication to understand their needs and tailor machine learning solutions accordingly

Your Skills

Essential Skills:

3+ years of experience in core machine learning work in the industry
Extensive knowledge of Cloud AI offerings on one of the Hyperscalers (GCP, AWS or Azure), including ready to use AI services, AutoML approaches, and custom model development
Proficiency in Generative AI/LLMs, with expertise in prompt engineering, embeddings, LangChain, vector databases, grounding, and other relevant concepts
Demonstrated ability to work independently on PoCs
Strong and assertive communication skills
Proven experience in research and evaluation of machine learning technologies

Beneficial Skills

Extensive knowledge of Cloud (Gen)AI offerings on GCP
Knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes
Familiarity with CI/CD processes
A/B testing expertise
Experience with implementing robust strategies for monitoring and maintaining machine learning models in a production environment
Passion for keeping up with industry trends and advancements in machine learning

OUR OFFER

While we’re one company, each location has unique aspects and benefits. Here’s a glimpse of what to expect:

Flexible Working Models: Early bird or night owl? Thanks to our flexible working models, you start your work day when and where it fits you best.
Career Development & Onboarding: Start your journey in NETCONOMY with a structured onboarding and mentoring phase, and continue with individual training opportunities. Our training department, NETCADEMY, will find the best solution for you!
Company Summit: Exchange professional and personal experiences at our annual in-house conference! One of the highlights of our company Summit is the vibrant networking environment it cultivates.
Social Events: Join your colleagues and build new connections at our social events like pizza & games evenings, hiking, and Christmas party, and celebrate milestones together. It’s on us!
Snacks and Wellbeing: Fuel your productivity and taste buds with our monthly meal allowance and discounts at partner restaurants.
Mobility Support: Choose eco-friendly transportation! As we take our responsibility for the environment seriously, we support your climate-friendly transportation costs.

Join us as an Algorithm Engineer (m/f/d) in our Routing Team on a shared journey that matters!

The Routing team is building MOIA's routing engine which constitutes an essential part of MOIA's business model. The system helps us to safely guide our ever-growing fleet(s) of (soon-to-be autonomous) vehicles through cities and predict accurate travel times for our customers. To enable efficient routing, the team also maintains a MOIA-customized map that serves as a key ingredient for the routing engine but also finds application in various geospatial use cases and simulations inside MOIA. 

What you will do
You and your team build and maintain a software system to provide travel times and routes for our vehicle fleet. The travel times directly influence the assignment of customers to vehicles and yield ETAs for our customers. Hence, high accuracy is mandatory and monitoring and improving it is your daily business 
In other scenarios, only approximate travel times are required but at a high volume. You will actively participate in developing state-of-the-art routing algorithms and data structures that support fast travel time queries and continuously monitor and improve the quality of the system. 
To reach these targets jointly, you become part of a highly specialized team comprising software engineers with different areas of expertise such as routing algorithms, high-performance computing, geospatial computation, and geospatial data analysis

What will help you to fulfill your role 
Solid professional experience in developing highly efficient applications in Rust
Having deep experience in developing and designing software for microservice-based environments. Familiarity with Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS-managed services for deployments is a plus
Be ready to live and breathe DevOps and believe in automated testing, infrastructure as code, and continuous deployment
An understanding of the complexity of algorithms and the desire to dig deep and squeeze the last bit of performance out of our systems
You enjoy tweaking and optimizing running systems, working with our data analysis experts who help drive improvements in accuracy of ETAs and other metrics
Strong interest in working with geospatial data (maps, routes, GPS traces), routing algorithms and routing APIs. Previous experience in this area is beneficial, but not mandatory
You enjoy collaborating and sharing knowledge with colleagues, also in a remote-first setting

We encourage you to apply even if your profile does not meet all the requirements for the role since we are looking for a diverse range of experiences, skills, and interests. We are certain that there will be something for everyone because we are working on such a variety of tasks and embrace individual growth at MOIA.

In case you have questions regarding your application, you can approach the recruiter Ben directly.

Our benefits in a nutshell
Competitive salary (including bonus) 
Hybrid work setup, flexible working hours, and possibility of flexible work arrangements depending on your needs (parenting, care work, volunteering, etc.) 
Budget and monthly expense allowance for home office setup 
Possibility of remote work from outside of Germany for up to 6 weeks per year from over 40 different countries - Connect work & travel!
Public transport ticket (fully subsidized) for commuting and traveling throughout Germany and discount on MOIA rides
Subsidized fitness club membership or bike leasing 
Learning environment with continuous learning days, job rotation, trainings and workshops, coaching, conferences, books, and language classes 
Mental health support, 1:1 sessions with external professionals and mental unload workshops 
30 vacation days, sabbatical and unpaid leave option 
Relocation support with service provider (visa, administration, etc.) 
Dog-friendly offices (at our Hamburg location) 
For student & internship positions, we have an adjusted set of benefits. You can find them here. 
Be who you are!
We are a member of Charta der Vielfalt and are dedicated to actively fostering a workplace that celebrates and promotes diversity in various aspects such as age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or cognitive ability, and ethnicity. At MOIA, we embrace a culture where people are accepted, respected, valued, appreciated, and included.
In our commitment to promoting diversity and inclusivity, we regularly provide unconscious bias training to all our employees. Furthermore, we continuously strive to enhance our hiring process by ensuring a diverse hiring panel.
To reinforce an unbiased screening process, we kindly ask you not to include your picture, age, address, or any other details that are unrelated to your qualifications and suitability for the role.
Our Future Work model
Since we love to collaborate, it is clear to us that we don't want to become a fully remote company, but we also don't need to spend every day of the week in the office to do a great job.
Our current hybrid work approach focuses on adapting to different needs, including increased flexibility that works best for the teams and the individuals with as much self-determination as possible.
Get more insights on how we work on our blog to find out more about our hiring process or follow us on Instagram for a look inside MOIA. 
Who we are
At MOIA GmbH, our team of more than 350 employees develops the technical products for our on-demand ridepooling service in the form of an end-to-end integrated product, from hub, fleet, and driver management to passenger and B2B solutions. At the same time, we want to make the vision of an autonomously driving mobility service a reality and plan to bring the first autonomous MOIA ridepooling vehicle to the streets by 2025. 
At our offices in Berlin and Hamburg, international teams of developers, engineers, designers, and strategists work on a shared mission. As a tech company, more than half of our employees are developers. We pursue value-driven development based on our product values of comfort, reliability, safety, and privacy. 
We aspire to be a leading company in the fields of rethinking mobility and improving urban transportation by making it more relaxed, more affordable and an entirely positive experience for everyone. 
MOIA gets things moving. On a shared journey – towards an easier, smarter, and more meaningful future.

job_title: System Engineer ADAS in the area of Parking and Maneuvering (all genders)
job_desc:
Übersicht 

Expleo ist der zuverlässige Partner für ganzheitliche, integrierte Ingenieurs- und Qualitätsdienstleistungen, ergänzt durch Managementberatung für die digitale Transformation. Durch die Kombination von branchenspezifischem Know-how und technischer Expertise sorgen wir für die ausgewogene Balance zwischen Kreativität und Zuverlässigkeit, die Unternehmen brauchen, um den technologischen Wandel bestmöglich zu nutzen.

Sie tragen dazu bei, den Traum vom autonomen Fahren umzusetzen und arbeiten in der fahrzeugnahen, Prototypen- und Serienentwicklung, speziell in der Systementwicklung unserer ADAS-Projekte namhafter OEMs und Zulieferer. Entwickeln Sie mit uns die Fahrfunktionen der Zukunft als Systemingenieur (m/w/d) am Standort Berlin.

 Aufgaben 

 Konzeption und Systemarchitektur für hochautomatisierte Fahr- und Parkfunktionen 
 Erstellung der Funktions- und Systemspezifikation auf Basis der Kundenanforderungen
