job_title: (Senior) Software Engineer - Intelligent Data Collector - ADAS domain compute platform (m/f/d)
job_desc:
At CARIAD, we're bundling and further expanding the Volkswagen Group's software expertise. We’re uniting over 6,500 global experts to build a scalable technology stack, including a software platform, unified electronic architecture and reliable connection to the automotive cloud. Our CARIDIANS are developing vehicle functions such as driver assistance systems, a next-generation infotainment platform, power electronics and charging technology, and digital services in and around the vehicle.

Our software can already be found in Volkswagen ID. models and will soon power Audi and Porsche vehicles with the E3 1.2 platform in 2024.

It's no easy task, but with experts like you, we can shape the future of mobility. Join us at CARIAD and be part of this exciting journey!

YOUR TEAM
We are building the central ADAS compute platform for automated driving and parking systems and all safety technology. With our solutions for the largest vehicle fleet on the market, we make mobility safer and more comfortable.

We work as a team to define and establish a reliable, robust and secure system and software architecture using the latest technologies in hardware, software and tools. We are working with various stakeholders within Cariad and all VW brands as we develop the software framework and next-generation ecosystems and enable autonomous driving (Level 3&4).

You will become a part of our international and highly motivated team in the area of autonomous driving platform & services. Together with you, we are shaping the future in the automotive sector.

#AutonomousDriving #HardwareDevelopment

WHAT YOU WILL DO

Develop and operate efficient, scalable and reliable data management and processing solutions for an embedded high-performance ECU
Setup the system and software architecture for an internal data pipeline
Implement the SW module (based on AUTOSAR classic / adaptive)
Optimize on board data storage and processing the data to the cloud
Contribute to a highly automated data pipeline supporting the development and testing processes of ADAS & AD systems from perception to fusion until applications
Work in an agile development team with test engineers, data scientists and back-end software developers


WHO YOU ARE

Successfully completed studies in the field of computer science, electrical engineering, mathematics, physics or a related field
Experience in software development including big data
Good Knowledge regarding communication via Ethernet and PCIe
Experience in containerization with Docker and Kubernetes as well as knowledge of database systems
Experience in processing and analysis of vehicle bus and image data
Excellent programming skills in Python and C++ (or other object-oriented programming languages beneficial)
Fluent English language skills (oral and written), German language skills are a plus


NICE TO KNOW 

Remote work options
Temporary work from abroad in selected countries
Flextime / optional working hours
Company pension plan
Annual professional development
Sabbatical option up to 6 months
30 days paid + 10 days unpaid leave
Possibility for VW Group car leasing

Data Engineer - Berlin, Germany - Hybrid

About the Client:

Our client operates in a dynamic industry, spearheading innovative digital strategies for a sector that impacts the environment, people's wellness, and long-term profitability. They are committed to uncovering latent data potential within building structures and data repositories. Through a secure, centralized platform anchored by a dynamic Digital Building Twin, the client empowers its clientele with unparalleled data-driven insights, harnessing the power of machine learning and AI to drive informed decisions for a more sustainable future.


Responsibilities:
• Leading the formulation and execution of the future data engineering and data management strategy.
• Providing guidance and oversight for the development of ETL pipelines, data architectures, and innovative data products.
• Designing and implementing advanced automated data quality frameworks that demonstrate intelligence.
• Orchestrating and supervising the automation and monitoring of data ingestion and storage from a range of global and heterogeneous data sources.
• Extending the central data model to accommodate incoming data and align with market best practices.
• Collaborating seamlessly with cross-functional teams, including Product Owners, Domain Experts, Tech Leads, Data Scientists, and Data Analysts, to deliver high-value data products to clients.


Desired Qualifications:
• An advanced degree (MSc, PhD) in a relevant technology field.
• A minimum of 3 years' hands-on experience in data engineering, analytics engineering, or ETL/ELT development.
• Proficiency with prominent components of the Big Data ecosystem such as Spark, Airflow, Kafka, and Flink.
• Expertise in Python programming
• Robust knowledge of SQL and familiarity with a variety of data architecture paradigms.
• Experience in data modelling practices and utilization of data quality tools.
• Understanding of microservices and related technologies, including Kubernetes, Docker, and REST APIs.
• Practical familiarity with the Azure data stack, encompassing Azure Data Lake, Databricks, and Data Factory, among others.
• Experience with column-oriented databases and Data Warehouses like ClickHouse, Snowflake, BigQuery, or Redshift.

Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams in Berlin oder Essen suchen wir Dich als

Senior Analytics Engineer (m/w/d) 

DEINE AUFGABEN

Du bist mitverantwortlich für die strategische Ausrichtung, Weiterentwicklung und Etablierung der Marketing-Automation-Prozesse für digitale und persönliche Interaktionsformate mit unseren Usern und Lesern
Du bist Developer in einem crossfunktionalen Team und transformierst Daten aus unseren Touchpoints, um Customer-Fragestellungen zu analysieren und neue Lösungen für eine intelligente und datengetriebene Kundeninteraktion umzusetzen
Dein Fokus ist die Bereitstellung einer sauberen und aktuellen Datenbasis als Grundlage für die Bildung von Kundensegmenten für automatisierte und anlassbezogene Marketingkampagnen
Du wirst Experte für unsere Data-Plattform und unterstützt mit deinem Fachwissen die operativen Marktbereiche in der Marktbearbeitung und fungierst als Schnittstelle zwischen Tech und Business
Du bist zuständig für Analyse & Reporting der einzelnen Customer-Touchpoints und entwickelst maßgeblich CRM-KPIs und Reportings weiter
Die Analyse und Gestaltung von Datengenerierung, -anreicherung und -nutzung - mit Blick auf Compliance und DSGVO-Anforderungen - runden Dein Aufgabengebiet ab


DEIN PROFIL

Du bringst ein abgeschlossenes Studium oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung im Bereich Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Wirtschaftsmathematik mit
Du hegst eine Leidenschaft für Daten und beherrschst SQL auf fortgeschrittenem Niveau – Zusätzlich kannst Du anwendbare Kenntnisse in Data Modelling, SCDs, Google Cloud, Big Query, Dataform und dbt vorweisen
Du begeisterst uns mit Deinen sehr guten konzeptionellen und analytischen Fähigkeiten sowie mit Deinem lösungsorientierten, selbständigen und gewissenhaften Arbeitsstil
Idealerweise sind Dir die Strukturen und Prozesse in einem Medienunternehmen oder vergleichbarem Umfeld bekannt 


Deine Benefits

Innovation trifft Tradition: Du gestaltest die digitale Transformation unserer Mediengruppe mit 
Top ausgestattet: Ob in Berlin oder Essen - In unserer zentral gelegenen Location erwartet Dich ein modern und voll ausgestatteter Arbeitsplatz
Entwickle Dich mit uns: Wir ermöglichen Dir die Teilnahme an individuellen Coachings, Workshops oder (Online)-Trainings im Rahmen unserer FUNKE Akademie
Flexibel arbeiten: Wir leben ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell, weil uns Deine Work-Life-Balance wichtig ist
Teamwork: Dich erwarten ein dynamisches Team, eine offene Feedbackkultur, kurze Kommunikationswege und ein herzliches Miteinander
Corporate Benefits: Wir bieten Dir ein Benefit-Portal mit attraktiven Rabatten und Abos
Halte Dich fit und gesund: Profitiere von unseren Kooperationen mit verschiedensten Fitnessstudios und lasse Dich für Deine mentale und körperliche Gesundheit individuell beraten


Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt? Dann gestalte mit uns die Zukunft und sende uns Deine Bewerbung an Jennifer Korreck.

Als Mitarbeitende bei der DB Systel GmbH gestaltest du aktiv die Digitalisierung der Deutschen Bahn und formst entscheidend die Zukunft des Konzerns mit. Wir sind ein interdisziplinär aufgestelltes Team und führen selbstorganisiert und agil Beratung auf Basis der Digitalisierungsstrategien durch. Dabei setzen wir unsere Vorhaben mit ganzheitlichem Blick auf die Organisation und das IT-Management um. Unsere geschäftsübergreifende, neutrale und produktunabhängige Beratung und Unterstützung zeichnen uns aus.

Das Team BIX berät unsere Konzern - Partner:innen dabei, ihre Daten in einem SAP Business Warehouse oder einer SAP HANA Datenbank zu organisieren, entwickelt maßgeschneiderte Analytics-Lösungen im SAP-Umfeld und übernimmt die Wartung und Betriebsführung dieser Anwendungen. Mit unseren BI Lösungen leisten wir einen aktiven Beitrag zu Digitalisierung und zur Starken Schiene. Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir dich als SAP BI & Analytics Developer:in (w/m/d) für die DB Systel GmbH am Standort Berlin oder Frankfurt (Main).

Dies ist ein "Wo du Willst-Job": In Abstimmung mit deiner Führungskraft kannst du deinen Arbeitsort innerhalb Deutschlands selbst disponieren und zwischen mobilem Arbeiten und Arbeiten im Büro wählen.

Deine Aufgaben:

Du wirst als Teammitglied in einer führenden Schlüsselrolle für unsere Partner:innen besonders schwierige und übergreifende Anwendungen im sehr komplexen SAP-BI & Analyticsumfeld auf Basis der SAP BW on HANA Systeme konzipieren und entwickeln
Dabei erarbeitest du hauptverantwortlich als Senior-SAP-Entwickler:in schwierige und übergreifende Ideen aus und treibst die Digitalisierung mit neuen Lösungen voran
Du wirst Aufgaben verantworten, welche Standards für künftige Entwicklungen und komplexe Architekturen zum Ergebnis haben
Schwerpunkt der Erwartungen an dich ist die Entwicklung integrierter Lösungen im komplexen Systemumfeld mittels weitreichender technologischer und fachlicher Neuentwicklung
Es ist unerlässlich, dass du in deiner Verantwortung die Entwicklung deiner übergreifenden System- und Softwarelösungen mit einer Vielzahl von internen und externen Beteiligten führend koordinierst
Du wirst auf Augenhöhe unser internes und externes Management beraten und Entscheidungen auf der Ebene herbeiführen und dich als intern und extern absolut anerkannter Experte etablieren
Deine Programmiererfahrung wird uns helfen, unsere komplexen Anwendungen weiterzuentwickeln und auch ganze neue Impulse zu setzen


Dein Profil:

Basis deines Werdegangs bildet ein abgeschlossenes Fach- / Hochschulstudium vorzugsweise mit IT-Schwerpunkt oder eine erfolgreich abgeschlossene IT-bezogene Berufsausbildung mit einschlägiger Berufserfahrung in den genannten Bereichen
Du hast fundierte Erfahrung mit komplexen Anwendungen auf SAP BW on HANA oder BW4/HANA gesammelt
Du bringst Kenntnisse und Interesse an den neuesten Technologien wie z.B.DSP, Analytics Cloud und BTP mit
Idealerweise hast du bereits einer dieser Zertifizierungen erlangt: SAP Certified Application Associate, SAP Certified Application Specialist oder SAP Certified Application Professional
Im Umgang mit ABAP/OO und SQL kennst du dich bestens aus. Auch ABAP CDS und Web Dynpro gehört zu deinem Steckenpferd
Abgerundet wird dein Profil durch verhandlungssicher Deutschkenntnisse


Benefits:

Wir unterstützen Dich bei der Suche nach Kitaplätzen oder Ferienbetreuung für Deine Kinder. Außerdem kannst Du Auszeiten für die Pflege von Angehörigen oder Sabbaticals nehmen. Je nach Job ist eine flexible Gestaltung von Arbeitszeit/-ort möglich.
Du erhältst bis zu 16 Freifahrten innerhalb Deutschlands pro Jahr und weitere Fahrvergünstigungen für Deine Freunde und Familie.
Wir fördern flexible, individuelle Arbeitszeitmodelle und unterstützen, wo es betrieblich möglich ist, durch moderne Arbeitsformen wie Homeoffice oder mobiles Arbeiten.


Chancengleichheit und selbstbestimmte Teilhabe Schwerbehinderter und Gleichgestellter sowie eine respektvolle Zusammenarbeit sind innerhalb des DB Konzerns fest verankerte Grundsätze. Deshalb werden schwerbehinderte und gleichgestellte Bewerber:innen bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

Who We Are

Verkada is the largest cloud-based B2B physical security platform company in the world. Only Verkada offers six product lines — video security cameras, access control, environmental sensors, alarms, workplace and intercoms — integrated with a single cloud-based software platform.

Designed with simplicity and scalability in mind, Verkada gives organizations the real-time insight to know what could impact the safety and comfort of people throughout their physical environment, while empowering them to take immediate action to minimize security risks, workplace frustrations and costly inefficiencies.

Founded in 2016 with more than $460M in funding raised to date, Verkada has expanded rapidly with 16 offices across three continents, 1,700+ full-time employees and 20,000+ customers across 70+ countries.

Verkada is seeking an Enterprise Field Solutions Engineer in Germany with expert experience in Cloud Security, IoT Systems, Networking, Linux systems, Security Surveillance and Access Control. This individual will partner directly with their territory account executives to expand the Verkada footprint upmarket into Fortune 500 companies. Responsibilities include directly interfacing with customers/partners throughout the sales process, overcoming technical objections, assisting customers in designing deployments with Verkada Products and providing technical assistance to territory account reps. The ideal candidate will be highly motivated, able to learn quickly and work independently while making impactful results for the company remotely.

Responsibilities

Be the subject matter authority on the full Verkada suite of products and offerings and articulate the value added benefits to customers throughout the sales process. 
Act as a trusted advisor for Verkada Customers and overcome objections while securing the technical win for Verkada. 
Effectively present the Verkada solution to all levels of customer, from C-level executives to loss prevention managers and directors of IT. 
Work directly with your Account Managers to develop territory strategy for Verkada. 
Design Verkada solutions that range from: Network Security recommendations/bandwidth requirements, choosing proper Verkada products for Physical Security and deployment. Cloud Security RFP's/Documents, LTE deployments. 
Stay up to date on the security and IoT industry by attending and presenting at strategic conferences and providing thought leadership within the market
Be a Product Technical Evangelist in training/educating partners, customers, and internal employees on the latest Verkada product offerings. 
Write White Papers and Knowledge Base articles about Verkada Products, features, and integrations. 
25% Travel may be required

Requirements

5+ years of experience as a Sales Engineer, with a proven track record of working with Fortune 500 companies. 
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, Information and Computer Technology, Networking, IT Security from an accredited university. 
A Strong background in Networking: Experience with HTTPS/SSL, VLANs, TCP/IP, DNS, NAT devices, DHCP servers, Firewalls and software systems. 
Outstanding written and verbal English communication skills in order to clearly and efficiently articulate technical matters with customers and partners. 
Industry certifications (ideally): AWS, CCNA, CCDA, CCNP, MCSE, CEH, Security+, A+, Network+, Microsoft Azure, CISSP, CSP. 
Experience working with API's, Python, and other coding languages and although not essential is a plus. 
Experience working with Linux systems (ideal not a requirement). 
Previous startup experience (ideal not a requirement). 

Verkada Is An Equal Opportunity Employer

As an equal opportunity employer, Verkada is committed to providing employment opportunities to all individuals. All applicants for positions at Verkada will be treated without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.

job_title: Senior Data Engineer & Databricks Specialist (all genders)
job_desc:
At flaconi, we believe that diversity fuels creativity, innovation and growth. It thrives in all its forms of beauty. Our team is a mosaic of individuals from different backgrounds, cultures and life journeys, all united by a shared passion for beauty. Our commitment is grounded in our core values, particularly #trustinpeople. We hold ourselves accountable for creating an environment where every employee feels honestly valued, heard and empowered to contribute their unique perspectives to foster belonging.

We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer & Databricks specialist (all genders) to join our Data & Analytics department at flaconi. You will be part of our Data Engineering team of 8 people and play a prominent role in driving the transition to a data lakehouse architecture powered by Databricks. What can you expect in this role? Innovative projects in a cloud environment with a modern tech stack and room for exploring new technologies. In addition, an attractive business setup from e-commerce that includes many (also unstructured) data sources and use cases. Together with the team, you follow the ‘You build it, you run it’ mindset: You participate in the full development process, from design, through implementation and testing, to code reviews and deployment.


Your role
You drive the transformation from a classic data warehouse approach to a data Lakehouse on Databricks; ensure that the data platform can scale with the company, handling increasing data volumes while maintaining optimal performance, flexibility and reliability
To achieve this, you design and maintain the data architecture, including data models, schemas, and integrations
You build and maintain scalable, high-performance data pipelines, ensuring efficient and reliable data processing. This includes: supporting the business needs to include new data points or ingest new sources whenever needed, and implementing automation for data pipeline monitoring, error handling, and performance optimization
You develop and optimize our ETL processes from our various and numerous sources. You implement data quality checks and validation processes to ensure accuracy and completeness of the data
You proactively monitor data infrastructure performance, troubleshoot issues, ensure proper communication flows to the end users of the data products
You document processes, procedures, and configurations to ensure knowledge sharing


Your profile
Several years of experience with the Databricks platform, including proficiency in designing solutions leveraging a diverse assortment of data sources, and a solid understanding of data governance and the Unity Catalog
Proficiency in Python programming and experience with data processing frameworks - Scala is a plus
Solid knowledge of SQL and hands-on experience with relational databases incuding. data modelling
Strong understanding of cloud computing platforms and related services (AWS)
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Good written and verbal English

What we offer you
Full transparency: For this role, we have a salary band between 75000€ and 95000€ gross per year. The salary that we will offer you will always be within this span and is based on the skills that you show during the recruitment process.
Our employees matter to us: We offer you a permanent contract and will cover the costs for your BVG or Deutschland ticket.
Work-life balance: 29 vacation days, flexible working hours, up to three days of working from home a week and in specific cases the option to work 100 % remotely; the possibility of a paid sabbatical.
flaconi Academy: Actively shape your own career path by taking advantage of our internal and external training opportunities.
We care about your well being: We want to support you also during difficult times. For this, we offer you and your close relatives counseling sessions with mental health professionals.
flaconi Fitness: a wide range of sports options & discounts on memberships.
Family first: Our “emergency-daycare” is there for you in out-of-the-ordinary situations to look after your child on site at our office.
Thinking about tomorrow together: flaconi subsidizes your savings contribution to the company pension scheme with an additional 20%.
A comfortable working space with everything you need: High end technical equipment, fruits and drinks, no dress code and dogs are welcome in our office!
Other perks: Great discounts in our online shop as well with our partner companies, cool team events & company parties!

Introduction Sentence

More than one billion daily events are produced across our products such as Joyn. Collecting and processing that data is the fundamental prerequisite to getting the insights we need to improve our products. The Data Tech team develops and provides the services to support P7S1 in these regards. If you love to work in that space, we are your team.

In this position, you work within our hybrid model “Highly Remote”. You can work mostly remote within Germany. You can find all information here.

The contractually agreed place of work will be Unterföhring near Munich or Berlin. Possible travel costs to the place of work will not be reimbursed.

What You Can Expect In This Role

You design, build, and configure advanced Data Pipelines to transfer our first party data to various first- & third-party consumers, both batch-wise and in a real time streaming fashion 
Also, you assist our Data Scientist in creating Data Products from our Data 
You collaborate with our Data Engineers, Product Managers, Sales Experts, and Analysts to source the ideal data to create new features and enhance our solutions 
We cultivate a "you build it, you run it, you own it" culture, where you are responsible for testing, integrating, and deploying your code automatically using GitLab CI/CD as well as taking care of running our services in production on GCP and/or AWS 
You contribute to developing our Data Collection & Consent Management system 
Participate in technical design and architectural discussions with your and other teams to solve real user and business issues 

Your Essential Experience And Education

You have a passion for software engineering, Data, and Data Analysis 
You are proficient in Python and the ecosystem, experience in Javascript / HTML / Typescript would be a plus 
Snowflake and ETL / ELT are no foreign words for you 
You have experience using Databases, SQL, Data Warehouses, and Cloud Providers such as AWS / Google Cloud Platform 
Besides that, you have first touchpoints with building / automating CI/CD Pipelines and set a high standard for clean code and documentation 

What's in it for you?

Take advantage of our wide range of training and development opportunities at the ProSiebenSat.1 Academy
Benefit from a great flexibility and the possibility of mobile working thanks to our hybrid working model "NWOW" (New Ways of Working) as well as 30 days of vacation per year
Make use of our international mobile working agreement from 25 EU countries and Switzerland - for up to 30 days within twelve months
Benefit from a highly discounted, Germany-wide membership at Urban Sports Club as well as numerous other special discounts of our partners
Receive support in all situations of life, e.g. with our campus-owned daycare center, a childcare allowance or the BUK Family Service with free advice, for example on the topic of care. With our regular "Mental Health Days", we also send a clear signal for more awareness on the topic of mental health in everyday work life
Use our wide range of campus services at our headquarter including a canteen with fair prices, different coffee bars or our massage service
Enjoy an open corporate culture without a dress code
Join our P7S1 employee networks and get engaged in a topic you are passionate about, e.g. PROUD, Greenteam, fempowerment, language buddies

Closure

We are looking forward to your application!

Apply within 5 minutes via our job portal or use the video application option.

Your profile doesn't fit 100%? No worries, apply anyway! We support your professional & personal development on the job.

You can find out more about our application process here.

Please note that we can not accept applications by mail due to data protection reasons.

This Position is available at Seven.One Entertainment Group GmbH.

Company Text

Click here to learn more about the ProSiebenSat.1 Group located in Unterföhring near Munich and our diverse portfolio.

As a signatory of the Diversity Charter, ProSiebenSat.1 is committed to a working environment free of prejudice and actively promotes diversity and equal opportunities among employees.

You have a disability and would like to apply? Then you are very welcome.

We know that we are not entirely accessible yet, but we are working on it. Let's talk about how we can eliminate any barrier together and find an individual solution if needed.

Although we refer to one gender in the text, all genders may be implied.

job_title: BI Engineer - Robotics Continuous Improvement, MSP-CX
job_desc:
Description

Amazon is seeking an experienced Business Intelligence Engineer, to drive a culture of innovation and Continuous Improvement for EU Team of Mechatronics and Sustainable Packaging (MSP). Successful candidates will have strong experience in providing concise analysis of machine and process performance by using statistical and ML based tools to deep dive into the machine metrics.

As a member of the MSP Continuous Improvement team, you will leverage strong data extraction skills to drive worldwide reporting deliverables, engineer ad hoc performance analysis, support business planning and implement ideas for process improvement. The individual must have the ability to communicate effectively across multiple technical and non-technical functions. Successful members of this team collaborate effectively to solve data problems, implement new reporting solutions, and deliver successfully against high operational standards.

The Candidate Will Demonstrate The Following

 Focus on customers and work backwards
 Be highly analytical and detail oriented
 Quickly build credibility and trust with internal customers
 Successful in an ambiguous environment
 Comfortable with tight deadlines and prioritize workload

The role is available in either Spain, Italy, Germany or UK.

Key job responsibilities

 Work in a cross-functional team to deliver on demand projects and requests.
 Creating and optimising performance dashboards across all MSP product portfolio.
 Source, analyze, and formulate quantitative data; perform ad hoc analyses
 Analyzing trends, formulating projections, and evaluating savings initiatives
 Support the development of continuously-evolving automated forecast models and methodologies, owning the quantitative analysis of the performance
 Provide fact-based insights into variances and trends
 Presentation of findings and recommendations to Senior Leaders
 Identify and advocate for technical options related to machine learning, data mining, and other statistical approaches.
 Maintain an understanding of the latest trends in data science and machine learning.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Berlin, BE, DEU

Basic Qualifications

 Experience in analyzing and interpreting data with Redshift, Oracle, NoSQL etc.
 Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
 Experience with data modeling, warehousing and building ETL pipelines
 Experience in Statistical Analysis packages such as R, SAS and Matlab
 Experience using SQL to pull data from a database or data warehouse and scripting experience (Python) to process data for modeling
 Experience with SQL
 Experience in the data/BI space

Preferred Qualifications

 Experience with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift
 Experience in data mining, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

m/w/d


Company - Amazon Development Center Germany GmbH

Job ID: A2536634

job_title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Zalando Marketing Services (all genders)
job_desc:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

We are ambitious and committed to be the starting point of fashion for our customers and partners; therefore we are improving our Applied Science and Engineering backbone for Ads Personalization working backwards from user, content and context understanding.

As a Principal Machine Learning Engineer in ZMS, you will be the tech lead working with other ML engineers to build our real-time recommendation for our Ad Tech platform which includes organic and multimedia ads. If you want to work in a low latency / high volume scenario, this role is for you.

This position is a unique opportunity to have visible impact, and connect with exceptional talents from many different backgrounds you will be part of a talented cross-functional team made up of Applied Scientists, Data Engineers and Software Engineers. Together, and with the support of Product Managers and Designers, you create, design and deliver new features to serve our customers and partners needs.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups

What We'd Love You To Do (and Love Doing)


 Drive the operationalization of solutions deployed in production, and help the team grow and cultivate best practices in software development and MLOps.
 Architect and lead the development of machine learning solutions that can handle low latency, high availability and high volume scenarios.
 Mentor engineers and provide technical guidance across multiple projects simultaneously while managing competing priorities effectively within agreed-upon timelines.
 Apply techniques and create processes to optimise deployed models for better performance, latency, and memory usage.
 Work closely with applied science and engineering teams, product managers and other business stakeholders to bring our state-of-the-art solutions to the customers and to discover and identify new opportunities.



WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF...



You are proactive and initiate and execute process and technical improvements across the department
You can assess the severity/impact of bugs quickly to help set priority and align this with Product and Engineering Management.
You lead and ensure quality on operational artifacts (e.g. post-mortems, run books) for your area of responsibility
Your technical solutions and narratives propose reasoned solutions factoring in all arguments (technical and commercial) and provide clear analysis of the trade-offs and wins in different approaches
Through collaboration across teams and roles as well as your in-depth technical analysis and understanding of the system’s architecture and domain, you inform and enable business decisions that lead to reduction of costs, complexity, paying down technical debt, or unlocking customer value creation



OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.


 Employee shares program 
 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners 
 2 paid volunteering days a year 
 Hybrid working model with 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration 
 Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year 
 25 days of vacation a year 
 Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement) 
 Family services, including counseling and support 
 Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass) 
 Mental health support and coaching available 


Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

job_title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Transaction Risk Management (all genders)
job_desc:
At Zalando, our vision is to be the Starting Point for Fashion. We want to offer a shopping experience that is characterized by trust, for our more than 50 million customers in 25 markets across Europe, and also for our +6,500 partner brands. To maintain this trust, it is vital for us to manage transactional risks that originate from suspicious behaviors on our fashion platform. With 3.3 million shopping items, resulting in hundreds of thousands of orders every single day, we use big data and advanced methods from machine learning to predict and mitigate such risks and ensure trustful relationships with our customers and partners.

As a senior engineer in data and machine learning in our Transaction Risk Management team, you will have the opportunity to join a dynamic and diverse group of product managers, engineers, and applied scientists. As a machine learning team, we are responsible for several predictive services running in Java, Python, AWS, and Kubernetes to safeguard teams across Zalando. As part of our team, you will have the chance to work on cutting edge projects and innovative technologies, raise the technical bar, improve our operational excellence, and shape our ways of working.

What you build and put in production is impacting not only every single Zalando customer on the spot, but also the business performance of Zalando and its partners.


WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED


We are looking for a passionate and proactive senior engineer that has proficiency in both the data and machine learning domain. You will participate in the full development life cycle, end-to-end, from design, implementation and testing, to documentation, delivery, support, and maintenance. Contribute to our growing engineering and science community and encourage knowledge sharing in an agile work environment.

Data Engineering 


 Implement, operate, and continuously improve large-scale data pipelines for batch and real-time processing to enable risk inference and risk assessment 
 Increase the operational excellence of our data pipelines by using best practices for data quality assurance, testing, monitoring, alerting, and cost efficiency 
 Support the development of a feature store, consisting of features for risk inference and risk assessment 
 Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, and dashboards to drive key business decisions 


ML Engineering 


 Deploy, operate, and continuously improve our large-scale machine learning services for detecting transactional risks, including batch and real-time inference, on cloud-based infrastructure 
 Responsible for team’s end-to-end MLOps, productionizing machine learning services, including workflow automation and orchestration 
 Tackle challenges for developing algorithms and running them efficiently on cloud-based infrastructure 
 Increase operational excellence of our machine learning services by introducing best practices for model testing, experimentation, versioning, serving, retraining, monitoring and alerting 


What We’re Looking For


 5+ years of hands-on experience as a software engineer, data engineer, or machine learning engineer that productionized and operated data pipelines, machine learning models for large-scale services in cloud environments (preferably AWS) 
 Proficiency in Python, SQL (expertise in Java and Scala is preferred) 
 Experience in designing, developing, and operating highly-scalable microservices (API design) on a distributed system 
 Knowledge in automated deployment and monitoring through CI/CD pipeline (Docker, Kubernetes, or similar) 
 Experience with data and ML engineering infrastructure and tooling, including data processing runtimes and distributed systems, non-/relational databases, machine learning frameworks and services, and orchestration 
 Work experience with a high level of test automation (unit, component, integration, E2E) and passion for developing clean, well maintainable, and testable code 
 Motivation for continued personal development in discovering new technologies and software services 
 Ability and eagerness to understand the business context where the team operates and the customer problems being solved 
 Good communication skills to translate (even complex) analytical / engineering decisions and outcomes to broader, non-technical audience 



PERKS AT WORK



 Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events 
 Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings 
 Extensive on-boarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts 
 Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available only in selected locations) 


We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

About Zalando

Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, connecting customers, brands and partners across 28 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to about 45 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

job_title: Data Engineer - Customer Fulfillment Business Intelligence (all genders)
job_desc:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

As a Data Engineer in the Customer Fulfillment Business Intelligence (CuFu BI) Team, part of the Business Finance Organization (BFO) at Zalando, you will be responsible for designing and implementing scalable data pipelines that are essential for supporting the expansion of the data warehouse. These pipelines will be crucial in delivering operational data and key performance indicators (KPIs), such as Logistics DOP (Delivery Promise) and Customer Care Contact Rate. Your work will empower Customer Fulfillment stakeholders with actionable insights for decision-making and innovation, resulting in a positive customer experience.

WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)


 As a vital member of the CuFu BI team, you will actively participate in every stage of the development lifecycle. This includes understanding business and technical requirements, formulating detailed technical architectures and documentation, coding, conducting thorough testing, deploying, and taking charge of monitoring, troubleshooting, and resolving any identified bugs. 
 You will collaborate with fellow data engineers, BI/Data analysts, Reporting Engineers, and business stakeholders to design and implement robust data solutions collectively. 
 You will be leveraging and improving a cloud-based (AWS) modern tech stack that includes Redshift Serverless, S3, Exasol, Databricks, Apache Spark, Airflow(MWAA), and Microstrategy for reporting. 
 You will review Technical Designs and build data pipelines that are efficient and reliable at scale and capable of extracting diverse data sets from various sources, including but not limited to flat files, relational databases, AWS S3, and Salesforce. 
 Ensure the quality of our data products - and monitor them accordingly. 
 Adhere to established best practices and guidelines while pushing boundaries for continuous improvement and innovation. 
 You will be part of a community of 150+ Data Engineers across the company that is constantly improving the data landscape at Zalando. 


WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF YOU…


 Have 4+ years of Data Engineering experience. 
 Have an analytical mindset and good coding skills in Python. Ability to write and optimize complex SQL statements, prioritizing clean, readable, and maintainable code.. 
 Are experienced in working with MPP data warehouse, e.g. Redshift, Exasol and Big Query 
 Have experience running data processing pipelines using distributed data processing frameworks like Apache Spark (Databricks is a plus). 
 Have hands-on experience with AWS and orchestration tools like Airflow. 
 Have knowledge of data modelling techniques for Business Intelligence systems (e.g. Star & Snowflake Schema). 
 Are a true team player with a strong customer focus who can work effectively in collaboration or individually towards shared goals. 
 Challenge the status quo, drive innovation, and apply agile best practices. 
 Are familiar with version control systems like Github, CI/CD pipelines, Docker/Kubernetes, or AWS deployment is a plus. 
 Have domain knowledge in Logistics, Warehouse Management Systems (WMS), Customer Care, or E-Commerce is a plus. 
 Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, with an ability to articulate complex technical topics and solutions concisely and simply to a broader, non-technical audience. 


Even if you don't meet every listed qualification, we encourage individuals with a passion for Data Engineering and a strong desire to learn and grow to apply.

Family

About Zalando

Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 25 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 51 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Deine Mission bei advalyze?

Bei advalyze vereinen wir ein Growth Marketing Mindset mit einer tiefen MarTech Expertise, um mit datengetriebenen Lösungen unseren Kunden einen Wettbewerbsvorteil im Markt auszubauen.
Als Senior Marketing Data Engineer (m/w/d) erstellst du mit deinem Team für unsere Kunden die technische Infrastruktur der Datenerfassung und -verarbeitung. Zeitgleich bist du in unseren Projekten der Ansprechpartner für datengetriebene Analysen von digitalen Marketingkampagnen.
Werde Teil eines erfahrenen, multikulturellen und enthusiastischen Teams mit zahlreichen Möglichkeiten, zu lernen und deine berufliche und persönliche Entwicklung zu steigern!

Das erwartet dich:

Du übernimmst das Tracking und Monitoring unserer Kundenprojekte und unterstützt unsere Marketers mit Segmentierungen in unseren DMP, CDP, CRM, DWH und Marketing Automation Systemen
Du bist für den Aufbau unseres eigenen MarTech-Stacks zur Datenanalyse verantwortlich und entwickelst ein Standard-Reporting-Framework mit relevanten KPI’s für unsere Kunden
Du konzipierst und entwickelst unser DWH mit den Daten unserer Zeiterfassung, Finanzen, Sales etc. in Google BigQuery und wertest die Daten für die Businessplanung, People Analytics und das Client Reporting aus
Du bereitest Daten und Reportings mit Hilfe von Visualisierungstools wie Google Data Studio, Looker, Chartio oder Power BI auf und kannst komplexe Zusammenhänge einfach erklären
Du übernimmst das Design und verantwortest die Implementierung und Optimierung von technischen Customer Journeys (z.B. mit Personalisierungen) zur weiteren Leadgenerierung
Du übernimmst die Führung und Weiterentwicklung eines kleinen Teams

Dein Profil:
Idealerweise hast du ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich IT, Wirtschafts- oder Medieninformatik, oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Du bist Experte in der Daten- und Prozessmodellierung und programmierst bereits einige Jahre in Python, SQL und idealerweise auch JavaScript
Du hast 3+ Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data und/oder Analytics eines digitalen Umfelds (z.B. Startup, Agentur, Beratung, digitaler PurePlayer etc.) sammeln können
Du verfügst über solide Kenntnisse im Web Tracking (z.B. Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Snowplow) und der Datenanalyse in einschlägigen Tools wie Google Data Studio oder Power BI
Du hast bereits schon ein kleines Team geleitet oder möchtest gerne die ersten Erfahrungen als Lead sammeln
Du verfügst über ein agiles Mindset, denkst unternehmerisch und inspirierst deine Kolleg:Innen jeden Tag aufs Neue
Du sprichst fließend Deutsch und Englisch

job_title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer for Cloud Automation & Data Preparation - ADAS&AD (m/f/d)
job_desc:
At CARIAD, we're bundling and further expanding the Volkswagen Group's software expertise. We’re uniting over 6,500 global experts to build a scalable technology stack, including a software platform, unified electronic architecture and reliable connection to the automotive cloud. Our CARIDIANS are developing vehicle functions such as driver assistance systems, a next-generation infotainment platform, power electronics and charging technology, and digital services in and around the vehicle.

Our software can already be found in Volkswagen ID. models and will soon power Audi and Porsche vehicles with the E3 1.2 platform in 2024.

It's no easy task, but with experts like you, we can shape the future of mobility. Join us at CARIAD and be part of this exciting journey!

YOUR TEAM
As a member of the Cloud Automation & Data Preparation team, you will have the opportunity to make a significant contribution to the CARIAD environment model, which will be utilized by all ADAS/AD customer functions in our upcoming generation of ADAS/AD software stack. Within this role, you would have a chance to collaborate with a diverse team of engineers in our different locations. Our team is heavily using data driven development principles and as such relies on data coming from our fleets and a high performance toolchain managing that data.

WHAT YOU WILL DO

Oversee both front-end and back-end development, guaranteeing a seamless, efficient, and robust application experience.
Enhance algorithmic efficiency, tooling, and service quality of the platform, continually implementing new features.
Innovate and implement state-of-the-art solutions using your extensive knowledge in Scala web development and proficiency in JavaScript technologies, particularly PaperJS.
Utilize Python and Java skills to improve project versatility and integration capabilities.
Ensure application reliability and efficiency by expertly configuring databases such as Elasticsearch, Redis, and PostgreSQL.
Drive the strategic deployment of applications in a multi-service environment using Docker, Kubernetes, Argo, and Argo Workflows, while adeptly managing versions and debugging clusters.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams and stakeholders in a distributed team setting, ensuring clear communication and effective project execution


WHO YOU ARE

Possess a University Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field.
Specialized expertise in full-stack development, showcasing in-depth knowledge of Scala, including Akka, Akka-http, Akk-astreams, and ScalaJS.
Proficient in JavaScript, with a focus on PaperJS, as well as extensive experience in Python and Java.
Adept in virtualization and deployment technologies using Docker and Kubernetes, with hands-on experience in Argo and Argo Workflows.
Demonstrates a robust understanding of deploying, managing, and debugging within a multi-service environment.
Hands-on experience with databases, including Elasticsearch, Redis, and PostgreSQL, encompassing usage and configuration.
Fluent proficiency in English, German is a plus


NICE TO KNOW 

Remote work options
Temporary work from abroad in selected countries
Flextime / optional working hours
Company pension plan
Annual professional development
Sabbatical option up to 6 months
30 days paid + 10 days unpaid leave
Possibility for VW Group car leasing
If you have further questions about the candidate journey at CARIAD, please contact us: careers@cariad.technology

About Climatiq
We are a fast-growing climate tech startup on a mission to drive climate action through data and insight. Our team consists of entrepreneurs, technologists, and scientists who have come from backgrounds such as Google, MIT, and other leading companies and academic institutions. Together, we are building a tech platform that empowers organizations to take action in tackling the climate crisis. Our powerful carbon calculation engine helps businesses embed emission metrics into any software they already use to accurately calculate and continuously monitor their carbon footprint and drive better decisions.

Our platform is used by thousands of sustainability leaders worldwide, and we are proud to be backed by renowned international VCs and investors in the climate-tech and software sector. We are also a certified B Corp, highlighting our commitment to balancing purpose and profit. We have recently been recognized for our work, having been selected as the winner of the Enterprise and Smart Data category at the prestigious SXSW Interactive Festival. As a remote-first company, our team is spread out across Berlin and other parts of Europe, with a strong focus on collaboration and innovation.

This is an exciting time to join Climatiq. Be part of real, technology-driven endeavor from the beginning. Work with an amazing team and help build something meaningful together with our community.

Job Description
We are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer with a focus on data engineering, semantic analysis and text classification. Reporting to the CTO and working across our Engineering, Science and Data teams, you are passionate about building bleeding edge ML applications which are at the heart of our mission to tackle the climate crisis. We are looking for self-driven engineers who bring fresh ideas and are able to develop a product autonomously in a collaborative environment.

We use the latest technologies, like Rust, TypeScript and Python. We prioritize high scalability and development ergonomics and collaborate using GitHub.

Responsibilities:
Design, build and maintain features using machine learning models, NLP, semantic analysis or other relevant methodologies
Conceptualize and research novel approaches to modeling multilingual semi-structured and hierarchical data, in the context of GHG data
Manage, automate and optimize our existing data workflows, including data ingress, normalization, QA and human-in-the-loop approaches

Required Qualifications:
4+ years of experience in machine learning engineering, architecture, modeling, data pipelines, data extraction and classification and processing
Practical experience with designing, building and maintaining complex machine learning and data processing applications
Attention to detail, ability to work in cross-functional teams and collaborate
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience
Strong communication skills in English

Preferred qualifications:
Genuine interest in climate technology, sustainability, and a carbon-neutral economy
Proactive, passionate and curious about solving big and complex problems
Experience designing and deploying machine learning models using AWS

Additional Information
Location: Berlin or Remote within +/- 2 hours of CET timezone
Starting date: as soon as possible
Hours: full-time, flexible working hours
Competitive salary and benefits, including employee stock options

As a certified B Corp, Climatiq is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome and encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences to apply for roles on our team. Send us your CV and a short cover letter, highlighting your skills and experience, relevant for the advertised role.

job_title: Data Engineer - Demand Offer Data Platform - Markets (All-Genders)
job_desc:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM 

As a Data Engineer in Demand Offer Data Platform you will design, develop, and operate data pipelines that form the single source of truth for information regarding Zalando's business processes (Pricing, Availability, Tracking and Marketing). Critical business decisions are taken based on the data provided by you and your team. Constantly challenging the status quo, you and your team deliver high-performance data processing solutions that are efficient, reliable and scalable.

Most importantly, we value diverse teams, and are looking for smart, skilled team players who love to solve challenging problems for our internal customers.

 WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING) 


 Design, develop and operate reliable data integration pipelines processing huge data volume to provide high-quality curated data products. 
 Leveraging and improving a cloud-based (AWS) tech stack that includes Databricks Spark, Airflow and Python. 
 Making a positive impact on our engineering culture, encouraging knowledge sharing, and driving technical discussions and innovation in our engineering community. 


 WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF YOU HAVE 


 Hands-on experience in implementing ETL pipelines based on a latest tech stack (Databricks Spark, Airflow, AWS) and distributed data platforms. 
 An analytical mindset and solid coding skills in Python and SQL, with focus on clean, readable and maintainable code 
 Knowledge of data modeling techniques for Business Intelligence systems (e.g. Star Schema). 
 Familiarity with cloud-based technologies for application development is preferred (Kubernetes, Docker) 
 Experience of 4+ years in building Data Processing Platforms or Business Intelligence Systems or the willingness to learn. 


 INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN 

At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

Die IHK DIGITAL GmbH ist eine gemeinsame Gesellschaft deutscher Industrie- und Handelskammern sowie der Deutschen Industrie- und Handelskammer (DIHK).

IHK DIGITAL steuert und koordiniert die ganzheitliche Digitalisierung der IHK-Organisation. Mit unserem Demand ermitteln wir den gemeinsamen Bedarf der IHKs, unsere Agentur konzeptioniert und steuert gemeinsame IT-Projekte und betreut von den IHKs gemeinsam genutzte IT-Produkte. Zu unserer Projekt- und Produktwelt gehören aktuell die Umsetzung der Anforderungen aus dem Onlinezugangsgesetz auf Basis einer gemeinsamen IT-Architektur für alle IHKs ebenso wie die Realisierung hoch automatisierter Ende-zu-Ende-Lösungen für die Mitgliedsunternehmen der IHKs, zum Beispiel im Bereich der beruflichen Bildung. Begleitend unterstützen wir auch einzelne IHKs in ihrer digitalen Transformation.

Zur Unterstützung unseres Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen

Data Architekt / Data Engineer (m/w/d)
in Vollzeit.

Welche Aufgaben kommen auf dich zu? 
Aufbau und kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung der Datenmodelle innerhalb eines BI-Tools
Automatisierte Integration sämtlicher Datenflüsse in eine integrierte BI-Lösung
Erweiterung und Verbesserung des Unternehmensberichtswesens – Cloudlösungen, Dashboard, mobile Lösungen, etc.
Fachliche Verantwortung der Datenbanken inkl. Dokumentation
Verantwortlich für Abnahme und Qualitätssicherung von extern vergebenen Entwicklungs- und
Implementierungsaufträgen
Mitarbeit in Daten- und Analyseprojekten
 
Was sollten du mitbringen? 
Ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes (Fach-)Hochschulstudium oder eine mehrjährige gleichwertige Qualifikation im Bereich Informatik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation
Sehr gute Erfahrungen in der Einführung und dem Aufbau von Datenbanken und BI-Lösungen
Du verfügst zusätzlich über ein sehr gutes betriebswirtschaftliches Verständnis
Du besitzt ausgezeichnete Kenntnisse und nachweisbare Erfahrung im Umgang mit Datenbanken
Modellierung von Datenstrukturen und Datenflüssen
Du kannst komplexe Sachverhalte verständlich und adressatengerecht darstellen
Eine hohe Einsatzbereitschaft, eine selbstständige, eigenverantwortliche und vorausschauende Arbeitsweise sowie ein lösungsorientierter Umgang mit Herausforderungen runden dein Profil ab
 
Was wir bieten: 
Du arbeitest in einem selbstorganisierten, agil arbeitenden Team
Ein wertschätzendes Arbeitsumfeld, Experten-Know-how sowie zahlreiche Möglichkeiten für deine fachliche und persönliche Entwicklung
Wir leben von der Mehrperspektivität, Schwarmintelligenz und -kreativität, denn bei uns zählt jede Stimme
Gleitzeit und flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle sowie einen 1:1 Überstundenausgleich
Viele sprechen von „Homeoffice“ – wir von "Mobile Work". Wir arbeiten von zuhause, in den IHK DIGITAL Standorten, in der Zentrale in Berlin-Mitte und von überall in Deutschland oder sogar innerhalb der gesamten EU; da wo wir ideale Bedingungen für unsere Arbeit finden
Monetäre Benefits wie: BVG- und Kindergartenzuschuss, Arbeitgeberfinanzierte Altersvorsorge
 
Werde Teil unseres Teams und entdecke jeden Tag Neues, denn wir bieten dir noch mehr!

Sollten wir dein Interesse geweckt haben, freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung inklusive deiner Gehaltsvorstellung.

job_title: System Architekt / System Engineer Digitale Karte für die Digitale Schiene Deutschland (w/m/d)
job_desc:
Als Treiber:in für innovative Lösungen erhältst du bei der Digitalen Schiene Deutschland eine einzigartige Chance in einem dynamischen Umfeld: Du gestaltest Themen von der Konzeption bis zur Umsetzung und baust zeitgleich einen der zukunftsweisendsten Bereiche in der Geschichte des Schienenverkehrs auf. Du wirkst an einem historisch einmaligen Vorhaben mit und begleitest die Deutsche Bahn in die digitale Zukunft. Jetzt ist die spannendste Zeit einzusteigen!

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir dich als System Architekt / System Engineer Digitale Karte für die Digitale Schiene Deutschland (w/m/d) für die DB Netz AG am Standort Berlin.

Deine Aufgaben:

Du entwickelst die Systemanforderung der „Digital Map“ für den digitalen Bahnbetrieb der Zukunft in einem Team aus Expert:innen und Systemarchitekt:innen
Hierzu designst, modellierst und validierst die funktionalen und technischen Anforderungen im Funktionsbereich „Digital Map / Infrastrukturdatenmanagement“
Du arbeitest dabei in engem Austausch mit Partner:innen für Infrastrukturdatenerstellung, Speicherung sowie Nutzung und bewertest Change-Requests hinsichtlich ihrer Auswirkungen auf die Systemintegration
Anhand von Prototypen und Fallstudien analysierst du Automatisierungslösungen auf den Feldern Infrastrukturdatenerstellung, Speicherung und Nutzung sowie aus benachbarten Funktionsbereichen (z.B. Automatisches Fahren, Leit- und Sicherungstechnik)
Du bewertest unterschiedliche Designparameter hinsichtlich ihrer Auswirkungen auf Performance, Reliability, Availability, Maintainability, Safety und Security
Darüber hinaus stellst du die Integration von Projektspezifikationen im generischen Produkt sicher und arbeitest in Projekten mit europäischen Industrie- und Betreiberpartnerschaften für die Entwicklung von Bahnsystemen der Zukunft


Dein Profil:

Du hast ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in Ingenieurwissenschaften, Informatik oder in einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung
Darüber hinaus hast du mindestens 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Systems Engineering und der Systemmodellierung mit UML/SysML; idealerweise hast du bereits Erfahrung mit Model-Based Systems-Engineering (MBSE) gesammelt und kennst die entsprechenden Tools (z.B. Capella, Enterprise Architect)
Du hast Erfahrung mit dem Engineering von Kartenanwendungen im Verkehrssektor oder bereits fundierte Kenntnisse der Elemente des „Systems Bahn“
Du kannst komplexe Systeme und Abläufe hervorragend erfassen, abstrahieren bzw. strukturieren und bist offen dafür, dich auch in benachbarte Domänen hineinzudenken
Du begeisterst dich für Innovationen und hast ein Gespür dafür, wie diese in Bestandssysteme integriert werden können und du fühlst dich in einem agilen Umfeld wohl
Wenn du darüber hinaus über fließende Englischkenntnisse verfügst, dann bist du bei uns genau richtig, Deutsch ist ein Plus


Benefits:

Du profitierst von Vergünstigungen in den Bereichen Shopping, Freizeitwelt, Reisen und Bahnangebote. Die monatlich wechselnden Angebote beinhalten z.B. Mobilfunkverträge, Versicherungen, Stromtarife, Vergünstigungen bei Hotelketten, Mode und Lifestyle.
Du schaffst Großes und bekommst nicht weniger zurück: ein marktübliches Gehaltspaket mit in der Regel unbefristeten Arbeitsverträgen und Beschäftigungssicherung sowie vielfältige Nebenleistungen und eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge.
Faszinierende Projekte und Aufgaben bei einer der vielfältigsten Arbeitgeberinnen des Landes fordern Dein Können und warten auf Deine Handschrift.


Chancengleichheit und selbstbestimmte Teilhabe Schwerbehinderter und Gleichgestellter sowie eine respektvolle Zusammenarbeit sind innerhalb des DB Konzerns fest verankerte Grundsätze. Deshalb werden schwerbehinderte und gleichgestellte Bewerber:innen bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

Our vision is to become the trusted open source data platform for everyone. We are a Cast of over 400 individuals (‘Crabs’) located across the globe. Why Crabs? Because we believe in thinking sideways. And right now, we’re looking for sideways-thinking Senior Data Engineer.

We want to be the trusted data source data platform for everyone. But there are plenty of people out there who have not yet heard of us. And many of those who don’t yet know what we offer or what we stand for. We are always on the lookout for those who have the creative, research, analytical and strategic skills to succeed. Currently, we are looking for a Senior Data Engineer.

Who We Are

So, how do we become the trusted open source data platform for everyone? By listening closely to our customers and taking action to ensure they achieve their business goals. You see, the software we create is merely a means of delivering value. Our thinking is customer-first. That’s why our customers are at the front and center of all we do. And in the spirit of sideways thinking, we’re by their side as well. Actively helping them solve their challenges. Collaborating. Sharing. And innovating. In other words, it really isn’t just about who we are. It’s about who our customers are – and where they want to be.

Our values 

We want individuals who can embody our values of ownership, courage, and openness.

What does that mean in practice?

We take ownership of the problems we solve. What we do is about improving life for our customers, enabling them to meet their goals. So we own our decisions and mistakes. Sometimes that takes courage. But we don’t falter – we take on challenges with confidence. And right at our heart is openness. We’re always open to new ideas – from wherever and whoever they come.

The role 

We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our central analytics team and support our fast growing data platform. We have more and more people in the company using our data models and we need help to ensure our data is of the highest quality and governed efficiently. You’ll be working closely with analytics engineers and data analysts, while working with our data producers, such as software engineers.

You’re a business savvy data engineer and you care about the business value your solutions deliver.

We’ve got a modern data stack with BigQuery, dbt and Airflow at the center, all hosted in Google Cloud Platform. We use Preset for reporting and Posthog for product analytics. Our extractions are done using Stitch, Supermetrics, Kafka, Flink, Snowplow and custom Docker images in Airflow. Besides that we also send data back to tools like Salesforce, Google Ads and Slack all using Hightouch as our reverse ETL tool. Lastly we use Monte Carlo for data observability.

Overall our platform has been running with exceptional stability, we try to make our platform as low maintenance as possible and need your help in keeping it that way.

Responsibilities

Prioritize high-quality data extraction with robust ingestion pipelines, ensuring accuracy and completeness
Design and implement efficient data orchestration workflows using tools like Airflow, with Docker for container environments
Develop secure access management policies
Manage cloud infrastructure on GCP and the Aiven platform by using Terraform 
Lead data engineering initiatives that deliver tangible business value, ensuring the solutions deployed are effectively utilized and aligned with our strategic goals.
Evaluate and reassess data-related vendors and tools
Contribute to the data strategy and make sure it’s aligned with Aivens goals

Requirements

What we’re looking for

Cloud Infrastructure Expertise: At least 3 years of experience in deploying and managing production-level infrastructure on major cloud platforms (GCP, AWS, Azure)
Advanced Data Engineering Skills: Proficiency in data modeling, SQL, and Python
Production-level experience with Terraform and Docker
Workflow Orchestration Tools: Experience with Airflow, Luigi, or Prefect
Business Insight: Strong understanding of the business value of data engineering processes
Growth mindset - you enjoy learning new things and are comfortable in a fast paced environment

What We Value

Machine Learning: Experience in productionizing machine learning models.

Benefits: 

An agile working environment with short decision paths 
Compensation for open-source contributions made in your free time 
Flexible working hours
Choose the devices and tools that make you work the best 
Participation in employee stock option plan 
Office snacks, soft drinks, treats and fruits 

Please note that benefits and perks may slightly differ depending on location.

job_title: Staff SW Engineer Machine Learning - Edge Acceleration (m/f/d)
job_desc:
At CARIAD, we're bundling and further expanding the Volkswagen Group's software expertise. We’re uniting over 6,500 global experts to build a scalable technology stack, including a software platform, unified electronic architecture and reliable connection to the automotive cloud. Our CARIDIANS are developing vehicle functions such as driver assistance systems, a next-generation infotainment platform, power electronics and charging technology, and digital services in and around the vehicle.

Our software can already be found in Volkswagen ID. models and will soon power Audi and Porsche vehicles with the E3 1.2 platform in 2024.

It's no easy task, but with experts like you, we can shape the future of mobility. Join us at CARIAD and be part of this exciting journey!

YOUR TEAM
‘BigLoop & Advanced Systems’ is a division of CARIAD SE that holds the E2E responsibility for unifying all activities across domains to accelerate VW Group’s shift towards data driven development (D3). The overarching goal is to build one holistic data system, which encompasses existing systems across domains as well as brands within VW Group. We adopt a development practice of DevOps and SRE while constructing the next-gen big-data system of CARIAD SE. Our multi-national team of engineers is leveraging computer vision, big data, simulations, and high-performance computing to design our own software system for CARIAD’s customer features, such as autonomous driving. We invite you to join us as we tackle complex real-life scenarios and develop tomorrow’s software and hardware solutions of future mobility.

The qualified candidate will perform his/her magic and inject his/her entrepreneurial spirit into a new team by actively contributing to the exploration of unchartered territory and integrating the team into a large-scale organization. Therefore, this position is best suited for high achievers who love to champion new ideas and challenge the status-quo.

WHAT YOU WILL DO

Define Edge AI optimized network architecture and deploy end-to-end deep learning solutions for real-time inference in the vehicle
Conduct in-depth analysis of inference performance and other system variables that impact performance
Optimize inference and machine learning tasks in C++ and Python
Implement highly efficient machine learning algorithms on Edge AI embedded hardware
Work with a growing team of backend engineers, cloud architects, embedded engineers and DevOps experts to develop novel inter-continental (automotive) cloud solutions
Identify and mitigate project technology risks and execution risks


WHO YOU ARE

Master of Science in computer science, machine learning, applied mathematics or a similar quantitative area with outstanding grades10+ years of SW / Machine Learning Engineering experience
7+ years of professional experience as an ML/software engineer with strong programming skills in Python and C++
5+ years of experience as a tech lead, significantly contributing in overarching system design and SW architecture matters
5+ year of professional experience of writing and optimizing highly efficient parallel learning and inference code in C++, CUDA or OpenCL
Experience with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow and building deep neural networks in a distributed training environment
Outstanding documentation, profiling and debugging skills
Fluent English language skills (oral and written)


Preferred qualification:

First-author publications in the top-notch journals in the field
Previous experience with high performance computing is a plus
Prior experience with autonomous driving, sensor fusion or computer vision at scale
Experience in working with teams focusing on data analysis and optimizing deep net performance


NICE TO KNOW 

Remote work options
 Temporary work from abroad in selected countries
 Flextime / optional working hours
 Company pension plan
 Annual professional development
 Sabbatical option up to 6 months
 30 days paid + 10 days unpaid leave
 Possibility for VW Group car leasing

Description

The Global Expansion Engineering team is looking for a results-oriented, inventive data center engineer to drive development, implementation and delivery of enterprise data centers through the use of colocation facilities, which meet strict quality and performance levels across the globe.

What We Offer

Amazon offers a fast paced, fun, and exciting work environment. We continue to grow at exponential rates and are looking for individuals that can support our speed to market, enjoy a challenge, and have a desire for professional growth and continuous learning experiences. Amazon’s work environment is unique in every aspect and offers an exceptional opportunity for the right candidate.

Our Global Expansion Engineers (Data Center Project Engineer)

 assist in site planning, development and delivery of data center environments globally, which maintain the highest performance standards and utilize innovation to reduce budgets and increase efficiency.
 design review
 site selection
 technical negotiation
 single point of failure remediation
 infrastructure upgrade
 site acceptance of mission-critical facilities and associated MEP components.
 You may also be required to respond to off hour calls in regard to emergent events and contribute to the resolution of various data center performance impacting infrastructure issues.

Our Engineers are strong leaders who can prioritize well, communicate clearly, and have a consistent track record of delivery.

AWS Infrastructure Services (AIS)

AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.

You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.

About The Team

About AWS

Diverse Experiences

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.

Why AWS?

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.

Mentorship & Career Growth

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

Work/Life Balance

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Berlin, BE, DEU

Basic Qualifications

WE LOVE DATA so please apply with your detailed CV which demonstrates the specific tasks you carry out as part of your current and previous roles!

 Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical/ Electrical engineering or relevant discipline.
 5+ years of experience directly related to a critical infrastructure environment
 In depth understanding of critical infrastructure mechanical and electrical equipment.
 Ability to research new designs, technologies, and construction methods of data center equipment and facilities.
 Ability and willingness to think outside of the box to find creative and innovative solutions to reduce costs with no impact on quality and reliability.

Preferred Qualifications

 Master’s degree in Mechanical/ Electrical Engineering or relevant discipline.
 3-5 years experience directly related to Data Center Infrastructure
 Professional Engineering license.
 Certified Data Center Design Professional (CDCDP).
 Understanding of international code requirements.
 Fundamental knowledge of network design and layout.
 Possess excellent communication skills, attention to detail, and maintain high quality standards.
 Possess leadership and problem solving skills.
 Be a motivated, highly dependable individual.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
