Adjust, an AppLovin (NASDAQ: APP) company, is trusted by marketers around the world to measure and grow their apps across platforms, from mobile to CTV and beyond. Adjust works with companies at every stage of the app marketing journey, from fast-growing digital brands to brick-and-mortar companies launching their first apps. Adjust’s powerful measurement and analytics suite provides visibility, insights and essential tools that drive better results.

Our global team is composed of team members with life experiences, backgrounds, and perspectives that mirror our customers around the world. We seek outstanding candidates who demonstrate a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion through continuous learning and skill-building. We aim to support each other to ensure equitable and inclusive experiences, furthering our goal to create a culture of belonging that values the contributions of all team members.

We're proud to have received several awards in Summer 2022, including G2's Easiest Setup, Easiest Admin, Leader, and Easiest To Do Business With. Our CPO was also honored with a Top Women in Media Award, and we were named the Best Overall Mobile Marketing Solution of 2022. These accolades are a testament to the excellence and innovation of our award-winning company.

Get to know Product / The Department

Our Product Department is a dynamic team of agile, inquisitive, and strategic minds who believe strongly in finding problem driven solutions. We're the vital bridge between business and engineering, serving as the voice both internally and beyond for our Adjust product. We don't just think outside the box; we redefine it. Our mission is to relentlessly pursue features that perfectly align Adjust's vision with our clients' objectives.

Make An Impact/ The Role

As a Machine Learning Lead, you will be leading our data science efforts and are responsible for developing statistical models and algorithms that leverage Adjust’s unique position to deliver value to our clients. With your help, data science becomes a pillar of our value proposition which allows clients to automate, measure and optimize their growth activities.

Empower Your Potential/ Responsibilities

Lead and influence the development of innovative data products from conception to operationalization
Create best-in-class statistical models and algorithms including but not limited to incrementality and marketing mix modeling
Develop processes to monitor implementation outcomes and analyze model performance
Keep yourself up to date and become the main reference point for new research and state-of-the-art models
Guide the team and foster algorithms’ scalability to provide business value 

Bring Your Knowledge/ Experience & Qualifications

5 + years of experience in data science building and deploying machine learning models (XGboost, Light GBM. Random Forest, Time Series forecasting etc. )
Experience with advanced analytics for Marketing including but not limited to marketing budget optimisation, MMM, attribution, bidding automation, A/B testing, lift test or geo test)
Expertise in delivering and maintaining production-level data science projects (from prototyping, to maintaining and improving production-ready solutions)
Familiar with SDLC processes (JIRA, Github, test automation, deployment automation etc)
Able to understand a business problem and translate, structure it into a data science problem
Fluency in Python and familiarity with its scientific stack such as numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, matplotlib
Experience in building architecture proposals in distributed or complex architectural structure (PostgreSQL, Clickhouse, TimescaleDB etc)
Be the representative of your function towards the rest of the organization, so strong communication and presentation skills are needed
Experience mentoring other team members 

Enhance Your Experience / Perks & Benefits

Opportunity to make an impact on the ad-tech industry working for a forward-thinking leader in the space
International, diverse teams with a strong focus on transparency, feedback and fun
Education opportunities for ongoing professional development & continuous learning
Company onboarding program where you’ll learn the ins-and-outs of our product with your fellow newbies
Flexible workplace policy, allowing you to work either from home or our office space 
Generous vacation policy with flexible vacation days
Childcare program (Berlin only), paid parental leave
Additional private health insurance
Company Pension Plan with 40% employer contribution
English & German classes to enhance your collaboration with global colleagues and friends
Discounted Gym Membership with Urban Sports Club
Free annual BVG transportation ticket
Wellbeing support with qualified therapists
WFH program with remote online events (Coffee chats, team events, games, etc.)
Relocation package and visa assistance for you and your family

More details about our company culture and perks can be found on our career page.

Interested? Let's Talk! 

We understand that imposter syndrome may sometimes hinder exceptional candidates from applying. So, don't hold back—apply with confidence! We're excited to hear from you and can't wait to chat!

Equal opportunity employer

Adjust is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We champion a diverse and inclusive culture in all of our offices around the globe. We understand that all candidates are individuals with unique backgrounds and talents. At Adjust, we assess candidates on qualifications, merit and business needs. We do not discriminate based upon race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status or other applicable legally protected characteristics. If you see a position that excites you, please apply! We would love to have you join us in our mission to build a global tech company where we're all proud to belong to.

⚠ Adjust works with applicants through our Careers page and adjust.com email addresses. If you are contacted through other unofficial channels, it may not be legitimate. Confirm the information here and feel free to apply directly below.

Who we are… 
At BuildingMinds, we drive advanced digital strategies for the real estate industry creating a positive impact on the planet, people's wellbeing, and sustainable profitability. 
Our mission is to lift unexploited data treasures that are still hidden in building structures and data silos. A single, centralized, and secure platform with a dynamic Digital Building Twin at its core allows our customers to utilize a new level of data-driven insights, unleash machine learning and AI and make more informed decisions for a better present and a more sustainable future.

We are on the lookout for talented, passionate natural-born disruptors to join our team and become a “NetZero Hero” 
 How we work… 
Being on the forefront of disrupting an entire industry, we offer the freedom to be creative and forward-thinking. As a start-up in Berlin and with the full backing of Schindler, we also have the stability, support and resources of an established world leader in the buildings industry. This enables us to bring together the best of two worlds and to create an utterly unique culture of creativity, accelerated innovation and learning. We value speed, agility and creativity. 

Your role as a Machine Learning Engineer:
Design, manage and scale the DevOps/MLOps infrastructure for our machine learning projects. 
Make sure that successful proof-of-concepts become reliable services in production.
Build CI/CD pipelines for rapid development and seamless deployments. 
Implement continuous monitoring of machine learning models to ensure high quality standards. 

We would like to hear from you if you:
Have a degree in appropriate technology field (computer science, physics, statistics, applied mathematics, etc.) 
Are familiar with microservice and containerization solutions, such as Docker, kubernetes, and REST APIs. 
Are proficient in Python with knowledge of data structures, data modeling, and software architectures. 
Have experience with deploying ML services to production using infrastructure-as-code tools (like Terraform) and data/model orchestration tools (like Airflow and MLFlow). 
Are familiar with the configuration, management and scaling of cloud services (ideally on Azure) 
Bonus: Experience with ML frameworks (scikit-learn, pytorch/keras/tensorflow) and ML algorithms (deep learning, sequence models) 
Have good verbal and written English – German knowledge is a plus. 
Your way of working is characterized by proactivity, self-reliance, and creativity in solving problems.

We offer you:  
A diverse team with people from all over the world, of all ages with a supportive atmosphere and good vibes 
A hybrid Berlin work policy (3 days weekly in the office)
Annual learning budget focusing on people's professional and personal development 
Apple latest technology for your best efficiency 
The opportunity to shape building sustainability 
Competitive compensation and benefits plus a variety of snacks and drinks in the office. 
Unlimited working contract with 30 days of vacation per year 
Free German classes with Goethe Institute

job_title: Senior Applied Scientist - Customer Relationship Management (CRM)
job_desc:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


We are ambitious and committed to be the starting point of fashion for our customers and partners; therefore we are looking for applied scientists with a strong passion for understanding user behaviour and producing great experiences. Come join our team! 

As a Senior Applied Scientist belonging to the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) team, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing our understanding of our customer and crafting highly targeted communication strategies. You will work with talented scientists and engineers to build intelligent experiences across multiple communication channels with our customers. You will be responsible for building data pipelines, developing new personalization and segmentation models as well as running online experiments.

This position is a unique opportunity to have visible impact, and connect with exceptional talents from many different backgrounds you will be part of a talented cross-functional team made up of Applied Scientists, Data Engineers and Software Engineers.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be the starting point for fashion - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.

 do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy  https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion/our-employee-resource-groups

What We'd Love You To Do (and Love Doing)


 Analyse client behaviour and develop targeted communication strategies using advanced customer representation and user embedding techniques 
 Develop engaging user experiences by incorporating AI-driven content personalization and multimodal content generation into existing and new products 
 Cooperate closely with data and software engineers to build efficient data pipelines and solve real-world problems related to data cleaning and preprocessing. 
 Collaborate closely with experienced colleagues within the team, applied science leaders, product managers and business stakeholders. Mentor junior and mid level applied scientists and contribute to our applied science community. 



WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



 A Ph.D./M.Sc., or equivalent experience in Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field. 
 Proven experience in developing, deploying, and managing machine learning models, especially in the realms of personalization, customer behaviour prediction, and multimodal content generation. 
 A deep theoretical understanding of machine learning methodologies, coupled with a track record of practical application, evidenced by publications or significant achievements in either academia or industry. 
 Proficient in Python, PyTorch, and PySpark, or similar frameworks and environments conducive to large-scale data analysis and model training. 
 Exceptional ability to lead data science initiatives, with a knack for articulating complex technical details to a diverse audience, ranging from technical experts to non-technical stakeholders. 



ZALANDO BENEFITS



Career Development



 We offer peer-to-peer performance reviews twice a year 
 Learn and develop through our extensive Zalando training platform 
 Join regular all-hands, team meetings, Q&A-sessions, and quarterly anonymous employee surveys to ask your questions and provide your feedback 
 Support from an international team of experts; mentoring and professional development opportunities 



Wellbeing



 2 days paid leave per year for volunteering 
 Minimum of 27 holiday days per calendar year 
 Online sports courses, wellbeing, and nutrition advice offered by Humanoo personal wellbeing coach app 
 Mental wellbeing support by our Employee Assistance Program and professional consultants to help you find health resources 



Flexibility



 Flexible working hours 
 Relocation assistance available for internationals 
 Home office equipment available for hybrid working, to support you working from home 
 Hybrid working model with 60% remote per week 
 Opportunity to work from abroad for 30 (working) days per calendar year 



Financial



 Access to the employee shares program 
 40% shopping discount on products shipped and sold by Zalando, and 30% discount on Zalando Lounge 
 Discounts from a wide range of external partners 



Family



 Employee parents’ forums and employee resource group 
 Supported transition into and out of parental leave, with a buddy and re-onboarding plan 
 3 fully-paid child sick days per year 
 Free counselling, assistance, and referral service for all matters concerning yourself and your family via the Fürstenberg Institute

As one of our Principal Applied Scientists (AI and Machine Learning), you drive our scientific roadmap to create the next generation of risk management and fraud detection systems and devise new AI-based solutions along the whole value chain of Zalando Payments. You work closely with 10-20 applied scientists across several cross-functional teams and drive research & development initiatives. You raise the bar for scientific work and documentation and co-organize the applied science guild. As part of the leadership team, you work on eye level with our Team Leads, Principal Engineers, and Principal Product Managers.


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)



You act as direct contact for internal and external stakeholders, incl. upper management and translate their requirements into actionable R&D initiatives.
You enjoy finding solutions to (new) complex problems and don’t mind getting your hands dirty (with pen and paper or in your IDE of choice).
Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or similar quantitative fields.
5+ years of industry experience with a strong command of Python, Machine Learning related libraries such as PyTorch, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and big data frameworks such as Spark.
Industry experience within Payments or Fraud detection is desirable. Profound understanding of statistics and machine learning from simple linear models to neural networks (e.g., LSTM, Transformers), including solid theoretical/mathematical foundations and a good experience about what works in practice.
You possess excellent communication skills and you use them to move the teams forward. You can present your ideas with clarity, verbally and in writing and facilitate decision making in a timely manner. 



WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



 You enjoy finding solutions to (new) complex problems and don’t mind getting your hands dirty (with pen and paper or in your IDE of choice). 
 Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or similar quantitative fields. 
 5+ years of industry experience with a strong command of Python, Machine Learning related libraries such as PyTorch, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and big data frameworks such as Spark. 
 Industry experience within Payments or Fraud detection is desirable. 
 Profound understanding of statistics and machine learning from simple linear models to neural networks (e.g., LSTM, Transformers), including solid theoretical/mathematical foundations and a good experience about what works in practice. 
 You possess excellent communication skills and you use them to move the teams forward. You can present your ideas with clarity, verbally and in writing and facilitate decision making in a timely manner. 



INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups


OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.


 Employee shares program 
 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners 
 2 paid volunteering days a year 
 Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration 
 Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year 
 27 days of vacation a year to start 
 Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement) 
 Family services, including counseling and support 
 Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass) 
 Mental health support and coaching available 
 Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review 


Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Are you ready to take the helm of a science team at the forefront of performance marketing innovation? Zalando, Europe's leading fashion platform, is looking for an Head of Data Science to join our Performance Marketing powerhouse, to lead the charge for leading scientific solutions in the field.

About The Role

In this pivotal position, you'll be steering a team dedicated to crafting data-driven strategies that resonate with millions and convert intent into long-term customer value. Your domain will be the Measurement marketing effectiveness, and developing innovative solutions to optimize marketing channel performance, where you'll apply your mastery of machine learning, predictive models, optimisation algorithm, experimentation and causal inference to drive success in our significant marketing investments.


WHO YOU ARE?


Embarking on a journey to redefine the nexus of data science and performance marketing, we are in search of an exceptional leader. Here's who you are in the landscape of our ambitious mission


Scientific Leader You are a visionary with a passion for guiding teams through the frontier of data science in performance marketing. With a Master's or PhD in a quantitative field, your leadership is informed by deep technical knowledge and strategic thinking. 
Leading Leaders Boasting at least 3 years in leading leaders, you are adept at managing diverse teams, and tea leads foster an environment where machine learning, econometrics, and experimentation are leveraged to drive business outcomes. 
Collaboration Champion You excel at fostering synergistic partnerships, working cohesively with product teams, engineers, and marketing professionals, alongside senior and principal scientists, to steer the team towards a shared vision and unified goals. 
Catalyst for Innovation With a track record of empowering teams, you encourage ownership and continuous innovation, translating scientific rigor into tangible solutions that propel the business forward. 
Business Savvy You bring a robust understanding of business operations, particularly within performance marketing, and use this to guide your team through organizational challenges towards clear, department-aligned goals. 



WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED



 Mentor other applied scientists, review and guide their work, help develop roadmaps for the team and be a role model for them 
 Keep the team up-to-date with the latest research in causal inference methods. 
 Provide egoless constructive scientific feedback to peers and coach team members to become great researchers 
 Contribute to and improve team and company processes that ensure high quality research through documentation, peer review, and structured feedback 


What We Are Looking For


 Ph.D. in Quantitative fields, Computer science, Statistics, or other quantitative science fields with an emphasis on computational research methods. Demonstrated experience to manage an industrial research project for at least 5 years. 
 Experience applying advanced causal identification research methods (experimental and/or quasi-experimental designs). 
 Strong general scientific problem solving skills. Thinks strategically, but also stays on top of tactical execution. 
 As a self-starter, you drive results and have the ability to communicate relevant analytical insights from data to both technical and non-technical audiences. 
 Demonstrated ability to mentor other scientists. Strong sense of ownership, urgency and drive. 



Why Join Us?



 You'll be a key player in a department that's a driving force behind Zalando's growth. 
 You'll have access to cutting-edge infrastructure and massive datasets. 
 You will build leading solution to optimize advertising on platform like Google Search and Meta 
 Your work will blend scientific rigor with real-world business impact, celebrated globally. 
 You'll shape the future of marketing as Zalando transforms into The Starting Point for Fashion. 



Perks at Work 



 Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events 
 Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings 
 Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts 
 Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations) 


We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

About Zalando

Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 35+ million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Please note that all the applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.


Ready to Lead, Inspire, and Innovate?


Apply now and join us on this exhilarating journey where your work will not only be seen but felt across the fashion industry and beyond.

As a Principal Applied Scientist for Experimentation you will drive the quality of our Experimentation practice at Zalando. Leveraging recent advances in experimentation science, you develop innovative methods to support high-stake decision making and ensure that those methods become available to the right audience at Zalando through our Experimentation Platform.

For you to excel, you will need to demonstrate a blend of scientific depth and can-do attitude, as there is no shortage of opportunities where you can apply recent advances to practical applications and scale. Our corporate strategy requires us to not only understand traditional A/B experiments in depth but also explore and develop alternative designs and experimentation domains.


WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED



 Bring in your strong scientific experience to develop and deploy advanced experimentation methods at scale 
 Support high stakes experiments and problems in a range of experiment domains and ensure decisions are made from robust insights 
 Set and own the processes to improve the quality of experimentation across Zalando experimentation domains 
 Work closely with applied science leaders, product managers and other business stakeholders to bring our state of the art solutions to customers and to discover and identify new opportunities. 


What We Are Looking For


 PhD in Econometrics, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Operations Research or related field with at least 4 years of industry experience in applied Experimentation or Statistics. 
 Expertise in 2 or more of the following areas
 Advanced experiment designs network experiments, bandit-based experimentation, interleaving, switchback experiments 
 Applied high dimensional statistics, variance reduction techniques 
 Long term, heterogeneous treatment effect estimation 
 Bayesian approaches to A/B testing 
 Experience building and leading Causal Inference products; from the problem analysis and data selection to their production deployment. 
 Deep understanding of the theory behind the state-of-the-art methods in your domain as well as a broad overview of data science best practices in your field 
 Data intuition extensive experience of working with large online datasets, ability to identify appropriate statistical modeling assumptions and approaches. 
 Coding skills in Python and/or R as well as experience with common big data processing and manipulation tools such as Spark and SQL 
 Nice to have experience with Cloud Computing frameworks (e.g., AWS), other programming languages such as Scala 


PERKS AT WORK



 Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events 
 Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings 
 Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts 
 Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations) 



We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.



Zalando SE


Zalando is Europe's leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 35+ million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

job_title: Mitarbeiter (m/w/d) Forschung und Entwicklung für optische Fasersensorik
job_desc:
Die engionic Gruppe ist mit ihren einzelnen Gesellschaften engionic Femto Gratings GmbH, engionic Fiber Optics GmbH und engionic CNC GmbH ein führender Anbieter im Bereich der faseroptischen Sensorik. Wir konzipieren, produzieren und liefern maßgeschneiderte OEM Produkte und Dienstleis-tungen, von kundenspezifischen Entwicklungen in Einzelfertigung bis hin zur großvolumigen Serienproduktion. Die technologischen Schwerpunkte der Gruppe liegen in der Fertigung von Faser Bragg Gittern, faseroptischen Komponenten und Sensoren sowie der Herstellung von CNC-Präzisionsteilen. Mit unseren Technologien und Innovationen entwickeln wir gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden, an unseren Standorten in Berlin und Goslar, wirtschaftliche und moderne Lösungen für die Herausforderungen der Zukunft.

Mitarbeiter (m/w/d) Forschung und Entwicklung für optische Fasersensorik
Standort Berlin, feste Anstellung, Vollzeit

Ihre Aufgaben:
Neu- und Weiterentwicklung unserer Produkte im Bereich Faseroptik und Sensorik
Mitarbeit bei der Weiterentwicklung und Optimierung unserer Fertigungsprozesse
Musterbau und Fertigung von Prototypen
Überführung von Produkten aus der Entwicklungsphase in die Serienfertigung
Konzeption und Aufbau von optischen Messprozessen zur Qualitätssicherung
Erstellung von Produktdokumentationen und technischen Dokumentationen
Projektmanagement, Beantragung und Durchführung öffentlich geförderter Forschungsprojekte

Ihr Profil:
Sie haben ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Physik oder Physikalische Technik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung
Sie zeichnet ein hohes Maß an Selbstorganisation sowie eine pragmatische, lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise aus
Sie haben Freude an technologischen Herausforderungen sowie der Einarbeitung in neue Themenfelder und arbeiten gerne im Team
Sie verfügen über Kenntnisse im Bereich Sensorik, insbesondere faseroptische Sensorik
Sie bringen Erfahrungen aus den Bereichen Messtechnik, Kalibrierung und Prototypenbau mit
Wenn Sie beispielsweise Labview oder Python programmieren können, wäre dies von Vorteil
Sie haben in öffentlich geförderten Forschungsprojekten mitgewirkt

Wie bieten:
Eine unbefristete Stelle in Vollzeit, Teilzeit möglich
Eine spannendes und abwechslungsreiches Aufgabengebiet in einem dynamischen Team und innovativen Umfeld
Eigenverantwortung und Gestaltungsspielraum in Abhängigkeit von Ihren persönlichen Fähigkeiten und Interessen

Werden Sie Teil unserer Unternehmensgruppe und bewerben Sie sich gleich via E-Mail. Sie haben noch Fragen oder brauchen ergänzende Informationen?
Ihr Ansprechpartner ist Herr Dr. Andreas Pohlkötter
Kontaktdaten: +49 53213958709 | pohlkoetter@engionic.de

engionic AG • Ernst-Lau-Straße 8 • 12489 Berlin
Mehr Informationen zum Unternehmen finden Sie unter: www.engionic.de
Mehr Jobs finden Sie hier: www.engionic.de/de/karriere
sector: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals

job_desc:
As a Lead Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in driving our data science strategy, developing advanced analytics solutions, and leading a team of talented data scientists. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business challenges, design and implement data-driven solutions, and leverage your expertise to enhance our decision-making processes.

Responsibilities:
Lead and mentor a team of data scientists, providing guidance on projects and fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment.
Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand business objectives and identify opportunities to leverage data for insights and improvements.
Design, develop, and implement advanced machine learning models and algorithms to solve complex business problems.
Evaluate and integrate new tools and technologies to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the data science team.
Communicate findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through clear and compelling visualizations and presentations.
Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies, recommending innovative solutions to enhance our data science capabilities.

Qualifications:
Master's or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proven experience in a Data Science role with a track record of successful project delivery.
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python or R, with expertise in Machine Learning frameworks and libraries.
Experience leading and managing a team of data scientists.

If this sounds like an opportunity you may be interested in, please apply below and I will be happy to discuss further.

Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.

Product Data Science Group is seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Scientist to join our dynamic team in Berlin at Snowflake. In this role, you will work closely with our Product and Engineering teams to inform Product’s decision making and focus on increasing engineering efficiency efforts.

You will also work on long-running analytical initiatives marked by greater complexity and high levels of autonomy that will yield substantial product enhancements. This is a strategic, high-impact role that will help shape the future of Snowflake products and services.

AS A SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST AT SNOWFLAKE YOU WILL:

Drive high impactful initiatives for the global data application architecture and provide foundation for all critical telemetry and events to track feature adoption and performance of various Snowflake features.
Innovate and build data platforms to store, analyze sleuth through large amounts of data to uncover feature-usage patterns, subtle issues with the system, potential performance enhancements, and areas to improve user experience.
Influence and collaborate closely with Engineers and Product Managers and executives to inform product decision making with data and to identify opportunities to create more value for our customers.
Build framework and foundational high quality data pipelines , inform engineering for relevant instrumentation of telemetry events and architect the right data model for the product. 
Build Streamlit apps and dashboards & analytical framework to help Engineering and Product Managers monitor performance and availability of our system.
Think creatively to find optimal solutions to our complex, often unstructured problems.


OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:

MS/Ph.D. in quantitative discipline (CS, Engineering, Math, Statistics or Data Science)
Expert-level experience working with SQL and relational data (10+ years on a regular basis).
Expert-level experience working with Python, including scikit-learn, numpy, and pandas.
Expert in working with large-scale machine generated data (e.g., log, application, or customer-usage data).
Optimize complex and long running pipelines
Data storytelling, analysis & learnings to business leaders and technical stakeholders. 
The ability to thrive in a dynamic environment. That means being flexible and willing to jump in and do whatever it takes to be successful.
Previous experience on Snowflake and Streamlit is a plus

Im Rahmen einer Personalvermittlung suchen wir eine/n (Senior) Data Scientist (m/w/d), der/die sich mit Leidenschaft und Fachwissen in die Herausforderungen des hochregulierten Medizinprodukte-Umfelds einbringt.

Ihre Aufgaben im Überblick:
Identifizierung und Nutzung der informativsten Features für Machine Learning-Modelle
Entwicklung und Test von Prototypen neuer Algorithmen
Erstellung und Pflege von Datenqualitäts-Workflows
Dokumentation von Metadaten
Entwicklung und Pflege von Software-Tests und Dokumentation
Mentoring von Junioren (m/w/d) im Bereich Data Science und Machine Learning

Ihr Profil:
Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium oder Berufserfahrung im Bereich Medizin oder Life Sciences
Mehrjährige Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics, Data Science, Machine Learning oder angewandte Statistik
Erfahrung im Training, der Evaluation und dem Deployment von NLP Pipelines und erklärbaren Machine Learning-Modellen
Erfahrung mit NLP und LLMs wie BERT, GPT oder ähnlichem zur Extraktion von Informationen aus strukturierten und unstrukturierten Texten
Kompetenz in Python sowie praktische Erfahrung mit PyTorch, TensorFlow oder scikit-learn
Grundlegendes Wissen von SQL- und noSQL-Datenbanken
Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung und Testung in kollaborativen Teams mit Git.
Erfahrung in der Analyse und Verarbeitung großer Datensätze mit Python und/oder Java Libraries.

Wir bieten:
Attraktives Gehaltspaket: Wettbewerbsfähige Vergütung und Zusatzleistungen
Flexible Arbeitszeiten: Möglichkeit zur Anpassung von Arbeitsstunden entsprechend den Bedürfnissen
Home Office Optionen: Gelegenheit, von zu Hause aus zu arbeiten, um eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance zu ermöglichen
Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten: Unterstützung bei der beruflichen Entwicklung durch Schulungen, Workshops und Fortbildungen
Aufstiegsmöglichkeiten: Karriereentwicklung innerhalb des Unternehmens basierend auf Leistung und Fähigkeiten
Teamorientierte Arbeitsumgebung: Zusammenarbeit in einem unterstützenden und motivierten Team
Flexible Urlaubsregelungen: Möglichkeit, Urlaubstage nach Bedarf zu nehmen
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge: Optionen für die private Altersvorsorge und Zusatzleistungen
Gesundheits- und Wellnessprogramme: Unterstützung für die Gesundheit und das Wohlbefinden der Mitarbeiter durch verschiedene Programme
Innovative Arbeitskultur: Ein dynamisches Umfeld, das Kreativität und neue Ideen fördert

Bewerben Sie sich jetzt und tragen maßgeblich zur Digitalisierung und zur Bewältigung des Fachkräftemangels im Gesundheitssystem bei.

* Sämtliche Bezeichnungen in dieser Stellenanzeige richten sich gleichermaßen an alle Geschlechter.

About Index Exchange

Index is a global advertising marketplace enabling media owners to grow their revenue by helping marketers reach consumers across every screen. We’re a proud industry pioneer with nearly 20 years of experience accelerating the evolution of ad technology for the world’s leading experience-makers.

We are all in on video this year. We recently rebuilt our platform from the ground up specifically for this new channel, allowing our customers to transact across every device and screen as efficiently as possible. We’re reimagining streaming TV, and it has become one of the fastest growing areas of our business.

Index is an exciting and fast-paced place to work, and our company is built on our values of change, support, learning and teaching, trust, and intention. You will be able to feed your ambition, lean into trust & transparency, and feel genuine support from your colleagues here.

We pride ourselves on our independence and openness, not only in our technology, but in our teams, too. Our diverse and inclusive culture celebrates how we can leverage our unique differences to help drive Index forward.

We have more than 550 Indexers around the globe dedicated to building a safe and transparent marketplace that provides a trusted experience for consumers, and we’re looking for talented professionals to help take us to the next level.

Are you ready to join the programmatic evolution?

Index Exchange seeks a Product Manager who combines vision with practicality to steer our Machine Learning and Optimization (MLO) initiatives. This key role, based in Europe and serving our global teams and customers, sits at the heart of our organization's complex data landscape.

Every day, our exchange manages billions of ad transactions. This creates an abundance of data and complexity that challenges even the most robust reporting systems and data-driven analysis. As the Product Manager, you'll grapple with crucial problems such as identifying the impressions most likely to be purchased by different buyers, devising solutions for price prediction, and overcoming auction flooring challenges.

Candidates should bring substantial hands-on experience from technical environments, specifically in working with Data Science and Engineering teams to bring Machine Learning (ML) based features to market. A robust foundation in Statistics or Mathematics will support your work in the intricate field of Machine Learning. You'll be trusted to cultivate and expand our team's skill set from day one.

You will find yourself in high-visibility, high-stakes settings, where your capacity to guide projects from concept to completion with minimal supervision and exceptional project management skills will be central to your success.

While prior experience in ad tech – with a solid understanding of programmatic advertising, DSPs, buyers, publishers, etc. – will equip you to hit the ground running, we also welcome candidates with experience in financial markets or pricing, such as airline yield management. Your inclination towards working with big data platforms and launching analytics and reporting products to market will add to your appeal.

Our ideal candidate is someone who flourishes in data-rich environments, communicates superbly, and navigates efficiently across various time zones. If you're a numbers whizz who loves delving into complex technical challenges, and you're keen to create innovative products for our 3,000 publisher clients, this role could be your perfect fit.

What We’re Looking For

Customer & Partnership Focused Mindset: You love speaking with customers from world-leading publishers to advertisers and agencies and you’re excited to help them grow their revenue and build a thriving digital ads marketplace. The challenges you’ll face require entrepreneurial thinking and a sense for how to align incentives to grow the pie towards an open ecosystem rather than walled gardens. 
Product Sense: We think of Product as the engine that drives our company’s growth. You have solid product intuition. You’ve taken multiple great ideas from conception to market launch to bottom-line business impact. Having lived (and learned) through a few failures is good too. 
Collaborative Leadership: You’re a natural leader who can rally people across Engineering, UX, Marketing, and Sales and Services into a high-functioning delivery team. You are well-organized and delivery-oriented. You can work with Project Management to herd cats and guide an Agile team through delivery against a stack ranked set of priorities. 
Technical Curiosity: You thrive on figuring out complex systems and marketplaces, identifying opportunities to simplify and improve them, and working with Engineering to make it a reality. You love working at Internet scale, and you understand how even small adjustments can have a massive impact when applied across billions of users and transactions. 
Data-centric Mindset: You make significant decisions based on real data, and you use it to convince others that you’re right, because how else would you do it? You’re great at analysis and visualization, and you not only pronounce SQL the right way but you know how to use it. 

Here’s What You’ll Be Doing

Working with commercial teams and customers (publishers, DSPs, agencies) to understand their needs, and decide which ones we should address. 
Analyzing experiments and model improvements to test the viability of various hypothesis 
Creating product roadmaps to set both internal and external expectations about the products we’ll bring to market. Maintaining a prioritized set of products, features, and bugs. 
Using your best judgment to make the right decisions, even when the data is imperfect; this includes saying “NO” to good ideas that simply won’t win, because they’re not great ideas. 
Collaborating with Design, Engineering, Infrastructure, Data Science, and other technology teams to deliver high-quality products and features on time. 
Coordinating across numerous commercial and go-to-market stakeholders to ensure that products are launched correctly, that they can be measured appropriately, that they can be serviced, and that they meet the business objectives they were designed to achieve. 
Partnering with customer service teams and early adopters to ensure that whatever we build is usable by our clients. 

Here's What You Need

6+ years of Product Management experience in ad tech platforms, auctions, yield management, pricing, forecasting, advanced modeling, machine learning, or AI. 
We prefer candidates with a degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Physics, or Business. However, we understand that some of the most accomplished product leaders may hold different degrees. Ultimately, we place greater emphasis on experience and relevant skills. 
A track record of successful product launches and landings 
Experience and familiarity with building and shipping within the Agile framework 
Strong technical, communication, and analytical skills 
Flexibility for some occasional travel 

Why You’ll Love Working Here

Comprehensive health, dental, and vision plans at no cost to you
Time off and flexible work schedules
Retirement plan with a 5% company match
Stock options and equity packages
Generous parental leave
Monthly wellness stipend plus fitness discounts and quarterly wellness group activities
Community engagement opportunities and donation-matching program
Annual virtual company retreats and regular community-led team events
One day off per year to volunteer 
A workplace that supports a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment – learn more here

Notification

Index Exchange is aware that there have been recent scams directed toward candidates regarding job interviews and offers.

Please be vigilant and do not accept interview requests, job offers, or other hiring-related documents from anyone other than our dedicated recruitment team, from the domain of @indexexchange.com. Our interview process consists of several steps, including phone screens and video interviews. We do not conduct interviews via an email questionnaire or request money at any point in the process.

If you do receive these requests, please let us know immediately at: report.scam@indexexchange.com.

Equal employment opportunity

At Index Exchange, we believe that successful products are built by teams just as diverse as the audience who uses them. As such, we are committed to equal employment opportunities. We celebrate diversity of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. Additionally, we realize that diversity is deeper than any status or classification—diversity is the human experience. For those who show grit, passion, and humility—Index will welcome you.

Accessibility For Applicants With Disabilities

Index Exchange is committed to working with and providing access and reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. Please let us know if you’d like to request a reasonable accommodation.

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

To further our growth, we’re looking for a Data Scientist with strong software development skills who will be responsible for the design, implementation and automation of new algorithms and methodologies for our products:

Understand and expand a thrilling tech stack for fully automated marketing
Analyze, improve, and design production ready Machine Learning model generators and feature extraction systems
Be responsible for the continuous optimization of data input and model output
Apply Data Mining, Predictive Analytics, Machine Learning & Big Data Technologies

THE ASSETS YOU BRING TO THE TEAM:

Degree in Mathematics, Data Science, Informatics or similar
Experience in at least one relevant programming language (e.g. Java, Scala, Python)
Knowledge of SQL and Big Data Technologies
Experience in mathematical programming (e.g. Python)
Independent, committed, pragmatic, but also a good team player
Fluent in English, German a plus

Emerged from Mapp’s successful cross-channel marketing solution and Webtrekk’s proven customer intelligence tool, we have created an insight-led customer experience platform – unlike anything in the market. Mapp has offices all over the world, including USA, London, Paris, Berlin, Munich and Milan. More than 250 employees around the globe work on Mapp’s technology to provide customers with actionable marketing insights that will help them deliver exceptional customer experiences. At Mapp, we also encourage employees to push the limits on what we deliver, both as individuals and as a company.

Do you want to shape the future of marketing with us? If you’re tech-savvy, love helping customers be successful with technology, and always hunting for the next big deal, we want to have you on board!

We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our Investment Modeling team to build quantitative growth models and optimise investments across hundreds of cities around the world!

About Us

Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 150 million customers in 45+ countries. We’re a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission – to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!

About The Role

You will be building forecasting models to predict the short and long-term impact of incentives on growth of the business. You will use an optimization techniques to distribute incentives over time periods, across different cities and channels to maximize the growth of the business. As a Data Scientist you will be building products powered by Data Science models for internal teams to use in portfolio planning and budgeting. In addition you will work on decomposing and modeling business growth by interpretable and actionable components

Your daily adventures will include:

Develop a deep understanding of technical and business needs to solve real-world problems end-to-end
Research, test and apply novel forecasting techniques and methods
Develop and maintain predictive models to ensure accurate forecasts at short and long horizons for multiple business verticals
Quickly deploy models to production using AWS and internal machine learning platform
Solve optimization problems for incentives budget allocation within local and global constraints.
Communicate and present results to product and business stakeholders
Work with Python, Spark, Presto, Docker, SageMaker, Airflow
Work with data analysts, data scientists, product managers and software engineers in cross-functional feature teams
Regularly exchange knowledge with Data Scientists at various levels of seniority in the company


About you:

Industry experience in data science and machine learning (3+ years recommended)
Natural curiosity to identify problems, explore trends and discover opportunities with little supervision
Capability to approach problems with first principles thinking
Team player with strong verbal and written communication skills in English
Experience in time series analysis, modeling multivariate time series, familiarity with forecasting techniques
Experience in Python programming, including libraries like Pandas, Numpy, sklearn, OR-tools
Understanding and practical experience with statistical hypothesis testing
You will get extra credits for product development experience in a technology company
You will get extra credits for Ph.D in a quantitative field (physics, mathematics, computer science, economics)
You will get extra credits for an experience with multivariate time series forecasting methods


Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!

Why you’ll love it here:

Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 500+ cities across 45 countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world. 
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
Some perks may differ depending on your location.

job_title: Senior Data Governance Architect:in Data Platforms für die Digitale Schiene Deutschland (w/m/d)
job_desc:
Als Treiber:in für innovative Lösungen erhältst du bei der Digitalen Schiene Deutschland eine einzigartige Chance in einem dynamischen Umfeld: Du gestaltest Themen von der Konzeption bis zur Umsetzung und baust zeitgleich einen der zukunftsweisendsten Bereiche in der Geschichte des Schienenverkehrs auf. Du wirkst an einem historisch einmaligen Vorhaben mit und begleitest die Deutsche Bahn in die digitale Zukunft. Jetzt ist die spannendste Zeit einzusteigen!

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir dich als Senior Data Governance Architect:in Data Platforms für die Digitale Schiene Deutschland (w/m/d) für die DB Netz AG am Standort Berlin oder Frankfurt (Main).

Deine Aufgaben:

Du entwickelst eine übergeordnete Data Governance für das zukünftige automatisierte Bahnsystem unter Berücksichtigung der rechtlichen und regulatorischen Anforderungen im Kontext von kritischer Infrastruktur
Du erarbeitest transparente Ziele eine Datenstrategie für die Digitalen Schiene Deutschland
Dabei etablierst du Kommunikationspfade für den Data Governance Prozess und treibst letzteren proaktiv voran
Du entwickelst geeignete Formate für die Umsetzung von Aufgaben und Rollen in Bezug auf Data Management und etablierst geeignete Maßnahmen um die Qualität von Daten zu erhöhen
Um das zuvor Genannte zu erreichen, initiierst du Partnerschaften und etablierst eine gute Beziehung zu diversen DB-Stakeholder:innen


Dein Profil:

Du hast einen erfolgreichen Studienabschluss in Informatik, einer Ingenieurwissenschaft oder vergleichbarem Gebiet, idealerweise bereits mit Berührungspunkten zu Dateninfrastrukturen und Data Governance
Du hast mehrere Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung im Kontext von Data Governance oder Data Platforms, Kenntnisse in der Mobilitätsbranche sind ein Vorteil
Darüber hinaus bist du vertraut mit rechtlichen und regulatorischen Randbedingungen zu Data im IoT und KI-Kontext
Du hast einen guten Einblick in Architekturen von Datenplattformen wie Datenbanken, Storage Lösungen, Data Lakes und ihre Vernetzung, Broker Konzepte, Analyse-Plattformen, IoT-Protokolle
Wenn du darüber hinaus über exzellente Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse verfügst, bist du bei uns genau richtig


Benefits:

Wir unterstützen Dich bei der Suche nach Kitaplätzen oder Ferienbetreuung für Deine Kinder. Außerdem kannst Du Auszeiten für die Pflege von Angehörigen oder Sabbaticals nehmen. Je nach Job ist eine flexible Gestaltung von Arbeitszeit/-ort möglich.
Du erhältst bis zu 16 Freifahrten innerhalb Deutschlands pro Jahr und weitere Fahrvergünstigungen für Deine Freunde und Familie.
Du profitierst von Vergünstigungen in den Bereichen Shopping, Freizeitwelt, Reisen und Bahnangebote. Die monatlich wechselnden Angebote beinhalten z.B. Mobilfunkverträge, Versicherungen, Stromtarife, Vergünstigungen bei Hotelketten, Mode und Lifestyle.


Chancengleichheit und selbstbestimmte Teilhabe Schwerbehinderter und Gleichgestellter sowie eine respektvolle Zusammenarbeit sind innerhalb des DB Konzerns fest verankerte Grundsätze. Deshalb werden schwerbehinderte und gleichgestellte Bewerber:innen bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

Du machst den Unterschied. Ob im Business Audit & Assurance, Risk Advisory, Tax & Legal, Financial Advisory oder Consulting: Wir bei Deloitte unterstützen unsere weltweiten Mandanten dabei, sich kontinuierlich weiterzuentwickeln. Entdecke ein vielfältiges Arbeitsumfeld, das ständig in Bewegung ist und immer um ein Zentrum kreist: dich und dein Know-how. What impact will you make?

Du willst im Bereich Consulting – Artificial Intelligence and Data Kunden helfen, strategische Entscheidungen zu AI und Data zu treffen? Unser Team unterstützt bei der Implementierung groß angelegter Datenprogramme. Sichere unseren gemeinsamen Erfolg und mach mit uns den Unterschied: als (Senior) Manager Process Automation / AI & Data (m/w/d).

Standorte: Berlin, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt (Main), Hamburg, Hannover, Köln, Leipzig, München, Stuttgart und Walldorf.

Dein Impact:

Als (Senior) Manager Process Automation / AI & Data (m/w/d) legst du deinen Fokus auf schmarte Lösungen, die Menschen bei der Arbeit unterstützen - von der Automation Strategie bis zur Implementierung.

Beratung unserer Kunden bei der fachlichen und technischen Umsetzung von Prozessautomatisierungslösungen mit Schwerpunkt auf Robotic Process Automation (RPA), Chatbot/Voicebot Technologien (Conversational AI) und NLP/NLG sowie im Bereich Intelligent Document Processing
Analyse von Prozessabläufen und Digitalisierungspotentialen unter Verwendung moderner Technologien und traditioneller Lean SixSigma Ansätze
Verantwortung von Projekten oder Workstreams über alle Phasen eines Projekts: Vom Angebot, über die Analyse, Planung, Konzeption bis hin zur Umsetzung
Weiterentwicklung und Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Intelligent Automation Expert:innen

Dein Skillset:

Starke Begeisterung für innovative Automatisierungslösungen und Software-Roboter jeglicher Art, die du bereits in den letzten Jahren unter Beweis gestellt hast
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium sowie nachgewiesene, einschlägige Erfahrung in mindestens einem der folgenden Automatisierungsbereiche: RPA, Conversational AI oder Intelligent Document Processing
Erfahrungen in strategischen Analysen, Maturity und Cost-Benefit Assessments rund um Intelligent Automation sowie im Design und Aufbau von Operating Modellen
Reisebereitschaft sowie Deutsch und Englisch sehr gut in Wort und Schrift

Deine Chance:

Best-in-class Weiterbildung an der Deloitte University sowie im Rahmen individueller Qualifikationsangebote und Trainings
Umfassende Entwicklungschancen durch strukturierte Karriereplanung, Inclusive Leadership, Entsendungsprogramme, projektbasierte Job-Rotation sowie Förderung sozialen Engagements und Corporate Volunteering
Vereinbarkeit von Beruf & Familie dank Familienservice, Teilzeit & Remote-Working, Sabbaticals, Unterstützung für pflegende Angehörige, Beratung zur Elternzeit und vielem mehr
Gesundheit & Fitness im Fokus durch regelmäßige Gesundheitstage, Kooperation mit Fitness-Anbietern und die Unterstützung von Sport- und Teamevents
Attraktive Arbeitgeberleistungen inklusive Bike- und Pkw-Leasing, flexiblen Arbeitsmodellen (zum Beispiel Vertrauensarbeitszeit) sowie Firmen-Smartphone zur privaten Nutzung
Vielfältige Gestaltungsräume und aktive Förderung einer inklusiven Unternehmenskultur - u.a. durch unsere globale Diversity & Inclusion-Initiative ALL IN und lokale Mitarbeiter:innen-Netzwerke

Bist du bereit? Mach mit uns den Unterschied!

Unser Recruiting-Team freut sich auf deine Bewerbungsunterlagen über unser Online-Formular. Ein Anschreiben ist nicht notwendig.

Die Inklusion von Menschen mit Behinderung entspricht unserem Selbstverständnis und wir begrüßen daher deine Bewerbung. Wir bitten dich um Verständnis, dass wir aufgrund der geltenden Datenschutzgrundverordnung ausschließlich Online-Bewerbungen über unser Recruiting-Management-System entgegennehmen können.

Bei Fragen rund um das Thema Bewerbung bei Deloitte helfen dir unsere FAQs schnell weiter. Unsere Bewerbungshinweise geben dir konkrete Ratschläge zur erfolgreichen Bewerbung über unser Online-Portal:

⇒ FAQs

⇒ Bewerbungshinweise

What impact will you make?

Job-ID: 41203

Teraki is a multinational and multicultural Berlin-based tech company. We stand for innovation in the rapidly developing automotive domain of connected car, self-driving and world 3D mapping. Teraki enables improved Machine Learning performance through its edge processing products for Automotive (IoT) applications and enables the launch of new technologies by enabling on-sensor ML. We enable customers with Teraki's products to cope with the challenges that are posed by the exploding computational requirements of processing sensor data in autonomous robots and cars with different on-board sensors, cameras, RADAR systems, thus enabling wider-range access to autonomous systems.
 Your responsibilities:
Defining and collecting training datasets
Building training pipelines and real-time inference run-times (PyTorch, TensorFlow, TensorRT, Python, C++).
Experience in the field of real-time and embedded systems
Track and analyze the scientific literature and regulation on RADAR to identify relevant research questions and technical trends
Develop algorithms using and improving simulation environments, eg. with sensormodels
Conduct Machine Learning experiments, publish internal reports, and file patents.
Communication with internal and external stakeholders
 What we are looking for:
PhD or Master graduated in computer science, mathematics, physics or a related field. 
Hands-on experience with radar or camera data ideally in automotive industry, robotics or drone's domain
Strong programming skills in Python. C/C++ knowledge would be an advantage 
Demonstrated professional and research experience in machine learning, image/signal processing, numerical optimization or computer vision 
Familiar with one or few areas related to signal processing such as multi-channel signal processing, RF-signals, MIMO acquisition, multi-dimensional processing, hyper-spectral images, antenna array
Strong technical and nontechnical communication skills
Fluent in English 
 The position we offer gives you a chance to: 
Actively contribute to the new mobility revolution and the emergence of novel data-driven automotive platforms 
Increase your technical know-how in hot topics of autonomous driving 
Experience research and development in an industrial setting 
Work in a vibrant startup environment and share insights within an international team 
Work on your own self-contained R&D project 
 What we offer: 
The chance to immerse yourself in autonomous driving, with tasks from embedded design to machine learning 
To work closely with world class European, Asian and American companies 
To work in a dynamic start-up environment in the heart of Berlin, and to share insights with an international team spread across Europe and the US 
To work in a small, but highly motivated, multidisciplinary, multicultural team with flat hierarchies. 
Free public transport around within Berlin and free German classes

(Senior) Consultant Data Scientist (m/w/d)

In Deutschland - Berlin | Bonn | Frankfurt/Main | Hamburg | Köln | München

Du möchtest deine persönliche Entwicklung in den Bereichen Data Science, Analytics und AI vorantreiben? Gleichzeitig suchst du ein innovatives, agiles Arbeitsumfeld in den Bereichen IoT, E-Commerce und Digital Marketing, in dem du Einfluss auf namenhafte Unternehmen und Hidden Champions nehmen kannst? Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig! Werde ein Pionier der digitalen Transformation und unterstütze uns als Data Scientist.

Mehr von uns für dich: 
Steile Lernkurve: werde Teil unserer Projektteams und arbeite an spannenden Fragestellungen und nachhaltigen Wachstumsstrategien für unsere Kunden. In einem schnell wachsenden internationalen Unternehmen mit Start-up-Atmosphäre übernimmst du von Beginn an Verantwortung.
Horizont erweitern: durch umfangreiche Inhouse Trainings- und Fortbildungsprogramme (ergänzt durch LinkedIn Learning)
Umfassendes Onboarding: bei unserer globalen Onboarding-Woche lernst du alle Neustarter:innen bei Simon-Kucher kennen und legst den Grundstein für dein Netzwerk bei uns.
Gefragte Perspektiven: mit umfassenden Feedback- und Entwicklungsprozessen inklusive 360-Grad-Feedbackgesprächen
Fernweh stillen: durch die Möglichkeit, aus dem Ausland zu arbeiten (Workation)
Attraktive Vergütung: Bonus-Zahlungen, monetäre Beteilung am Unternehmenserfolg, hybrid Working-Zuschuss
Gut umsorgt: mit einem großzügigen Budget für deine Gesundheit (flexibel einsetzbar für Fitness-Studio, Sport-Zubehör, Massagen u.v.m.), vielen Angeboten zur mentalen Gesundheit und einer attraktiven betrieblichen Altersvorsorge
Easy durch den Alltag: dank Hybrid Working, Kinderbetreuungszuschuss, Firmenrabatten und einem monatlichen Zuschuss für deine (private) Mobilität – nutzbar für Taxi, Bahn, Carsharing u.v.m.
Erfolge gemeinsam feiern: bei regelmäßigen Mitarbeitenden-Events (Office-Events, Sommerfest, Weihnachtsfeier u.v.m.)
Gemeinsam wachsen: Nachhaltig und langfristig! Darum dreht sich alles bei Simon-Kucher. Unsere Stärke: ein mitreißendes, hoch motiviertes und sympathisches Team. Und jetzt kommst du: mitten hinein in die offene, wertschätzende Start-up-Atmosphäre eines etablierten Unternehmens mit über 30-jähriger Erfolgsgeschichte.

Hier bewegst du was: 
Du berätst und unterstützt unsere Kunden bei der Entwicklung von auf künstlicher Intelligenz basierender Produkte in verschiedenen Geschäftsbereichen (Mobilität, IoT, Industrie, Konsumgüter, Finanzdienstleistungen und gemeinnützige Organisationen).
Du wendest dein theoretisches Wissen an, um Vorhersagemodelle unter Verwendung moderner statistischer Analysemethoden und mathematischer Modelle zu entwickeln.
Du tauschst dich mit deinem Team in anregenden Diskussionen über die neuesten Datentrends aus.
Indem du Methoden des Machine Learning und der künstlichen Intelligenz auswählst, testest und anwendest, führst du prädiktive Analysen durch.
Über neue Forschungsergebnisse und Marktveränderungen hältst du dich regelmäßig auf dem Laufenden.
Mit deinem Fachwissen zu Machine Learning und künstliche Intelligenz entwirfst du innovative Strategien für Preisgestaltung, Marketing und Vertrieb für unsere Kunden.
Du wirst Teil unseres ständig wachsenden und multikulturellen Teams und arbeitest mit internen und externen Geschäfts- und Technologieexpert:innen aus aller Welt zusammen.

Hiermit begeisterst du: 
Du hast einen Bachelor- oder Masterabschluss im Bereich Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Informatik, Ingenieurwesen oder ähnlichen Studienfächern.
Du bringst mindestens 2 - 3 Jahre Erfahrung als Data Scientist mit und kennst dich mit der Modellierung mit Python oder ähnlichen Werkzeugen sehr gut aus.
Du hast Erfahrung mit Visualisierungstools wie bspw. PowerBI und Tableau und kennst dich mit relationalen / NoSQL-Datenbanken und dem ETL-Prozess bestens aus.
Du beherrscht die Auswahl und Anwendung von AL- und ML-Methoden wie bspw. Neural Networks, Support Vector Machine, etc.
Dir sind die gängigsten Cloud-basierten Machine Learning Programme bekannt.
Du verfügst über fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse (in Wort und Schrift).
Du bist offen für das Erlernen neuer Technologien und Strategien und hältst dich stets auf dem Laufenden.
Eine scharfe, analytische und problemlösende Denkweise sowie strukturiertes Arbeiten zeichnen dich aus.

Über Simon-Kucher
Simon-Kucher ist eine globale Unternehmensberatung mit über 2.000 Mitarbeitenden in 30 Ländern weltweit. Unser Fokus: „Unlocking Better Growth“. Wir helfen unseren Kunden, „besser“ zu wachsen, indem wir jeden Aspekt ihrer Unternehmensstrategie optimieren, von Produkten und Preisen bis hin zu Innovation, Digitalisierung, Marketing und Vertrieb. Mit rund 40 Jahren Erfahrung in Monetarisierung und Pricing gelten wir als weltweit führend in den Bereichen Preisberatung und Unternehmenswachstum.

Wir setzen uns für eine Unternehmenskultur ein, die Diversität, Gleichstellung und Inklusion fördert – und damit ein Umfeld der Anerkennung, das individuelle Entfaltung stärkt und den Beitrag eines jeden Einzelnen würdigt. So können wir weitreichende und positive Veränderungen bewirken. Wertschätzung und Anerkennung befähigen uns dazu, schneller zu wachsen, innovativer zu arbeiten und nachhaltigere Ergebnisse für alle zu erzielen – für unsere Teams, unsere Kunden und unser Unternehmen.

Deine persönliche Ansprechpartnerin:
Jacqueline Döring-Gil
Willy-Brandt-Allee 13, 53113 Bonn
Tel. +49 (0)228 9843-0

Better growth starts here. With you.

job_title: Lead Machine Learning Scientist (f/m/d) - Generative AI and Knowledge Graphs (T4PF)
job_desc:
We help the world run better

Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!

What you`ll do

At SAP, we integrate AI technology with extensive industry-specific data and deep process knowledge to create innovative AI capabilities for all SAP applications. Large Language Models (LLMs) hold immense potential to change the way we work and develop products. They are reshaping the landscape of Machine Learning across various domains. However, their limited ability to leverage tabular data leaves a considerable share of enterprise data untapped. It is SAP's mission to overcome this challenge within the realm of Business AI. Our goal is to adapt Foundation Models to SAP data, enabling our clients to solve their business processes more effectively.

The Role

 Unique opportunity to lead the development of Foundation Models on structured business data embedded in a rich and diverse business context
 Technical lead for the project team of AI Scientists and Data Engineers, providing strategic guidance and overseeing project execution
 Design a representation suitable for Self-Supervised Learning on data across the entire SAP application and process portfolio
 Define processes, methods, hypothesis, experiments and review results from the ground up with an understanding to put them together for End-to-End Foundational Models.
 Leverage semantic business and process knowledge in the form of a Knowledge Graph
 Collaborate cross-functionally with other teams to understand needs and requirements, ensuring the Foundation Models align with strategic company objectives of embedding AI into our product portfolio
 Maintain up-to-date knowledge of AI and Data Engineering trends and apply this expertise to improve team performance and product quality
 Establish and drive research collaborations with academic and commercial partners
 Contribute to thought leadership in a revolutionary new data modality for Foundation Models and Generative AI

What You Bring

 PhD or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or other relevant disciplines
 Extensive experience with Foundation Models as well as Machine Learning with Knowledge Graphs (e.g., GNNs)
 Deep understanding of issues and opportunities of applying Generative AI in a business context
 Proficiency in Python, and experience with ML frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or similar
 Ideally, professional experience with Machine Learning on structured data such as in the ERP or CRM domain
 Exceptional teamwork abilities, strong leadership and strategic thinking skills
 Substantial publication record related to LLMs, Foundation Models, or Knowledge Graphs

Meet your team 

SAP's AI organization is dedicated to seamlessly infusing AI into all enterprise applications, enabling customers, partners, and developers to enhance business processes and generate remarkable business value. Join our international AI team where innovation thrives, opportunities for personal development abound, and exceptional colleagues collaborate globally.

#SAPBusinessAICareers

 We build breakthroughs together

SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.

We win with inclusion

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

Requisition ID: 387325 | Work Area: Software-Design und Entwicklung | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Berufserfahren | Employment Type: Vollzeit, unbefristet | Additional Locations: Berlin |

job_title: Senior Data Scientist - Insights (Marketing Growth) | Paid relocation to Barcelona, Spain

job_desc:
acatech – Deutsche Akademie der Technikwissenschaften berät Politik und Gesellschaft unabhängig und gemeinwohlorientiert. Die Themen reichen von der Digitalisierung über die Zukunft der Energieversorgung, Mobilität, nachhaltige Ressourcennutzung, Bildung und Arbeit bis hin zu Fragen der Technikkommunikation. Expertinnen und Experten aus Wissenschaft, Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft entwickeln fundierte Handlungsentwürfe und bringen diese in die öffentliche und politische Debatte ein. Die von Bund und Ländern geförderte Akademie setzt sich dafür ein, dass technikbezogene Fragen auf dem aktuellen Stand des Wissens diskutiert und zukunftsrobuste Entscheidungen getroffen werden. Eine Geschäftsstelle mit Standorten in München, Berlin und Brüssel koordiniert die Arbeit von acatech.

Für unsere Geschäftsstelle in Berlin oder München suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine/n:

(Wissenschaftliche/n) Referent:in Vernetzte Datenräume (m/w/d)
(Technologie/Infrastruktur/Standards)
(Kennziffer 6/2024)

Künstliche Intelligenz (KI) ist eine Schlüsseltechnologie und verändert sowohl das tägliche Leben als auch den globalen Wettbewerb intensiv. Für einen souveränen Aufbruch in eine KI-basierte Datenökonomie brauchen Deutschland und die EU ein starkes Ökosystem für Datenökonomie und Künstliche Intelligenz. Zu diesem Zweck wurde die Nationale Initiative zur KI-basierten Transformation in die Datenökonomie (MISSION KI) vom Bundesministerium für Digitales und Verkehr (BMDV) ins Leben gerufen. Sie übernimmt als Hebelprojekt der Digitalstrategie der Bundesregierung dabei eine vernetzende und umsetzungsorientierte Rolle. Das Hauptziel der Initiative besteht darin eine starke Basis für marktfähige und gemeinwohlorientierte KI-Anwendungen zu schaffen.

Im Rahmen des Forschungs- und Entwicklungsvorhabens MISSION KI – Nationale Initiative für Künstliche Intelligenz und Datenökonomie werden folgende Maßnahmenfelder adressiert:
Datenräume sektorübergreifend vernetzen: Durch die Vernetzung von Datenräumen über Sektoren- und Ländergrenzen hinweg wird die Datenbasis für innovative KI-Anwendungen erweitert und die digitale Wettbewerbsfähigkeit insbesondere des deutschen Mittelstands, gestärkt. Dieses Vorhaben, das sowohl bestehende als auch sich im Aufbau befindende Datenräume umfasst, wird durch die Zusammenarbeit mit europäischen und internationalen Initiativen und Gremien vorangetrieben, um europäische Anschlussfähigkeit zu gewährleisten.
Transparente KI-Qualitäts- und Prüfstandards schaffen: Wir entwickeln und erproben KI-Prüfansätze, also Kriterien und Werkzeuge, um eine breite und skalierbare Anwendung von KI zu gewährleisten – selbstverständlich unter Berücksichtigung des AI Acts der EU. Durch die Gründung mehrerer KI-Qualitäts- und Innovationszentren stellen wir die hierfür notwendige Erprobungs- und Experimentierumgebung zur Verfügung und bieten gleichzeitig einen Erlebnisraum für die breite Öffentlichkeit.
(3) Wachstum von KI-Innovationen unterstützen: Wir entwickeln Instrumente, um den Transfer der starken KI-Forschung in die Praxis als auch das Wachstum herausragender KI-Innovationen zu beschleunigen. Dazu bringen wir Investor:innen mit KI-Gründer:innen und Unternehmen zusammen. Zusätzlich entwickeln und erproben wir eine Reihe an nicht-finanziellen Maßnahmen wie bspw. KI Fellowship-Programme, um Wissenschaftler:innen die Ausgründung zu erleichtern.

Weitere Informationen und News zur Initiative finden sind auf unserer Webpage (https://mission-ki.de/) oder auf unserem LinkedIn-Kanal (https://www.linkedin.com/company/mission-ki/).

Als Referent:in Vernetzte Datenräume (m/w/d) sind Sie Teil eines umfassenden Vorhabens im Themenfeld Datenökonomie, Datenräume und Künstliche Intelligenz. In einem wachsenden interdisziplinären Team tragen Sie zur technischen und strategischen Weiterentwicklung der Datenökonomie in Deutschland und Europa auf höchstem Niveau bei. Sie beobachten und beurteilen aktuelle Entwicklungen im Bereich Interoperabilität und Anschlussfähigkeit von Datenräumen und bringen Ihre Expertise und Anforderungen des Vorhabens in die relevanten Gremien ein.

Ihre Aufgaben 
Technische und konzeptionelle Beratung im Bereich Vernetzung von Datenräumen über verschiedene Domänen und Anwendungsbereiche hinweg
Entwicklung, Strukturierung und Kommunikation von (technischen) Standpunkten zu eingesetzten Referenzarchitekturen und Datenraum Komponenten bzw. Connector-Technologie
Unterstützung bei der Erstellung von Vergabedokumenten, insbesondere technische Leistungsbeschreibungen
Unterstützung bei der Begleitung und Überwachung von Unteraufträgen der MISSION KI (Use Cases), insb. Analyse und strukturierte Aufbereitung der Ergebnisse 
Vertretung der technischen Perspektive und Beitrag des technischen Know-Hows zu Projekt-Terminen, Sicherstellung der Verfügbarkeit und Reife von Lösungen, technische Komplexität und Konzeption kreativer Lösungen
