job_title: Senior BI Analyst - Supply Analytics (all genders)
job_desc:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM 


As a Senior BI Analyst (all genders) in our Supply Analytics team within Zalando Lounge, you will work alongside the Supply team and leadership towards our vision of acquiring unmatched value-for-money deals that drive Lounge user acquisition, conversion and retention. In this role, you will build on your analytical and statistical skills to create actionable business insights enabling smarter decision-making. You will lead and implement initiatives that develop sustainable reporting solutions, and create fact-based business insights regarding our Supply planning and steering. You will actively partner with cross-functional stakeholders by sharing relevant information and context, based on relevant KPIs you report on, analyse, track and embed in our business landscape. To succeed in this role you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users.


This contract it limited to 2 years INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.


We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)



 Develop a strong understanding of the business processes, tools and overall data landscape and use it to build, implement and operationalize business reporting with focus on supply, planning and steering capabilities for Zalando Lounge 
 Generate hypotheses and test them by performing descriptive, exploratory and quantitative analyses, with the aim of developing impactful business insights, as well as identifying risks and opportunities 
 Share with Senior internal stakeholders relevant fact-based business insights you / your team derived based on complex analysis in a visually compelling and comprehensible manner (using Tableau) - develop our collective intelligence 
 Accountable for all aspects of data analysis, research, and data visualisation leveraging storytelling techniques, as well as for driving relevant Data & Analytics projects or initiatives. 
 Lead the collaboration with relevant technology and data teams across Zalando, ensuring we get the most out of our existing datasets, and that we are optimally enabled to consume viable and relevant data points. 



WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



 Highly proficient developer of Tableau and have a good knowledge of SQL, Python is a plus; you can work with these tools autonomously and can guide others in using them. 
 You have already led initiatives or projects that helped businesses make decisions with significant impact through the insights you generated or solutions you built; domain expertise in the fields of Supply Chain Management (SCM), supply planning & steering, category controlling. Planning and steering of sales and supply as a strong plus. 
 Educational background in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Informatics or similar quantitative field, and 5+ years professional experience in a similar role, ideally in a fast paced (e-commerce) retail environment; knowledge of statistical methods is a plus. 
 People appreciate your willingness to make an impact, ability to spot inefficiencies and make improvements with a hands-on mentality, as well as your finding simple, efficient solutions to challenges. You are proactive, can adapt quickly to changes whilst remaining focused on the key objectives 
 You balance technical acumen with business understanding and excel in collaborating with commercial stakeholders to generate insights. 
 Ability to communicate clearly, concisely and to create an engaging narrative around the results of your analysis. 



OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.


 Employee shares program 
 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners 
 2 paid volunteering days a year 
 Hybrid working model with 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration 
 Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year 
 27 days of vacation a year to start 
 Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement) 
 Family services, including counseling and support 
 Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass) 
 Mental health support and coaching available 


 Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

The Marketing Analyst role is part of our Media Analytics team, responsible for the monitoring, analysis & trading decisions around brand marketing channels (digital and offline). This team, as part of our holistic Commercial Planning & Trading unit, plays a key role in the commercial business steering and ensures that a triple digit yearly budget is invested in support of our growth ambitions and strategic priorities. Media Analytics operates in close collaboration with commercial, marketing, product & engineering colleagues across the company to deliver relevant business insights in a complex, fast-paced environment.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups

What We'd Love You To Do (and Love Doing)


You perform analyses on various data sources (e.g. DWH, GA) with a focus on connecting the dots between brand marketing investments and their impact
You contribute to the development and implementation of measurement frameworks and products to capture the effectiveness of Brand Marketing investments. This includes suitable marketing and business KPI selection, benchmarking as well as leveraging your statistical knowledge for the conceptualization of new measurement solutions
You drive the creation and maintenance of automated self service reporting solutions for our stakeholders and collaborate closely with tech and product teams to ensure data availability and consistency (including quality assurance analysis)
You are the stakeholder interface for the Marketing & Trading teams for a selected set of markets to ensure continuous, aligned trading decisions and provide them with actionable analyses and deep dives around marketing activities. For these markets you also create investment proposals which support our strategic business goals and align & validate their impact on growth, profitability and our operations
You function as a sparring partner for the Brand Marketing (Design, Marketing & Content) teams on analytics and measurement topics, and enable them to effectively leverage analytical resources for decision-making



WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF...



 You’re proud of your degree (Bachelor, Master, MBA) in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Business Administration, or a related data-driven equivalent. 
 You have 3+ years of relevant work experience in an analytical role (with marketing context being a plus). 
 You have a profound experience with SQL and strive for automation with Python, Google Apps Script, R or similar. 
 You have a solid understanding of marketing attribution or tracking schemas and worked with related tools or systems (e.g. GA, Adjust). 
 You can gather, clean up, and transform data from various sources to enable convenient insights creation. 
 You have advanced skills around visualization & dashboard building with strong stakeholder centricity (e.g. MicroStrategy, Tableau, Google Data Studio, BigQuery, GA). 
 When you see a problem or analytical question, you latch on and cannot let go until it is solved, always questioning the validity of the results. 
 You are self-driven, results-oriented, enjoy working independently, and taking on responsibility. Your great communication skills would enable you to drive projects with different teams across the organization. 
 Your oral and written English is business fluent. 


If you think you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every single requirement. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!


OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.


 Employee shares program 
 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners 
 2 paid volunteering days a year 
 Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration 
 Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year 
 27 days of vacation a year (for Zalando SE) 
 Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement) 
 Family services, including counseling and support 
 Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass) 
 Mental health support and coaching available

job_title: Technical Senior Consultant Audit Analytics / Business Assurance (m/w/d) in Berlin
job_desc:

Entdecke ein vielfältiges Arbeitsumfeld, das ständig in Bewegung ist und immer um ein Zentrum kreist: dich und dein Know-how. What impact will you make?

Du willst im Bereich Audit & Assurance – Audit Analytics Group den Wandel der Abschlussprüfung hin zu einer datengetriebenen und digitalen Prüfung gestalten und umsetzen? Data Analytics ist für dich nicht bloß ein Phänomen, sondern deine Leidenschaft? Je komplexer der Datensatz, umso grö-ßer deine Neugier? Job-ID: 37923

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will contribute to your team's vision and with the different business units to establish and maintain best practices for data-driven decisions, including the data supply chain, data storage, reporting solutions, and analysis.

About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 135 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 18 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will

Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports
Serve as a liaison between the product teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role

Who You Are

5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Experience evaluating ML models performance and accuracy
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python (eg: pandas, scikit-learn)
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Ability to understand and explain the impact of ML models on user behavior
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

How We Set You Up For Success

Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
Become a part of our success with virtual stock options
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies

And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.

Job Description

People First - At Takeda we are dedicated to improving the health and well-being of all people and bringing them the hope of a brighter future. It is our passion that transforms every job into meaningful action. Our people are the heart of Takeda.

Within our Data, Digital & Technology (DDT) department, we are looking for a

Data & Insights Analyst (m/f/d) 

in full time at the location Berlin.

Our Data & Insights (D&I) Analyst (m/f/d) operationalizes LOC data strategic roadmap by ensuring right methods, platforms and governance are in place to support business needs.

Your tasks in detail 

Owns, develops, and enhances the standardized PowerBI dashboard and dashboard governance; ensure right insights are accessible by the right person locally.
Owns and enhance our local data Mart (EDB enterprise data backbone)
Supports the local DDT D&I Lead by providing insights on technical feasibility and requirements of new EUCAN implementation and integration of projects.
Creates synergies by standardizing data structures, harmonizing processes & systems and re-utilizing assets in LOC and in alignment with EUCAN directives.
Turns ambiguous problem and complex analyses into clear and concise stories to support effective decisions making, campaigns and investment optimization, and business case development.
Maintains up-to-date knowledge and emerging trends in analytics techniques.
Challenges the status quo and explores new data assets and experiment with innovative analytics to ensure Takeda maintaining competitive advantage.
Drives operational local implementation of regional and global analytics workstreams/ initiatives.
Collaborates with Data & Insights and OCE team to embed data-driven mindset and approaches across the business (commercial and medical)
Owns data steward tasks such as Lead generation process, data quality and data mapping.

Your profile 

A bachelor’s / master’s degree preferred or a comparable educational background or equivalent.
Min. 5 years of business experience in the pharmaceutical industry with strong track record analytics responsibilities, possibly including but not limited to commercial and market analytics, next best action, data science initiatives.
Strong knowledge of SQL, Power BI, Databricks, Python and statistical methodology.
Strong knowledge of IQVIA data, Salesforce/Veeva CRM data, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Matomo, and Brightcove data are strong assets.
Very good knowledge of English and German
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills – structured and process-oriented thinker, with great attention to detail and technology proficiency.
Ability to work with large amount of data data migration, data preparation for import/ ex-port, generating datasets.
Ability to explore, interpret and challenge data from various sources, to transform user stories and requirements into user-friendly functionalities.
Comfortable navigating problem solving in ambiguity and bringing clarity.
Proficiency in influencing without authority and form strong partnership with internal stakeholders to generate mutual value.
Ability to stay flexible and deal with change and uncertainty effectively.
Can-do attitude and problem-solving mindset with strong ability to identify areas or improvement.
Strong project management skills, ability to prioritize, and manage stakeholder expectation.

What You Can Look Forward To With Us

Appreciative working atmosphere in an international and exciting working environment with a wide range of development opportunities
Independent work with the opportunity to play a part in shaping an innovative company
Professional and personal development opportunities
A wide range of social benefits
Flexible working hours and home office (only 40% in the office)

Empowering our people to shine

At Takeda, we earn the trust of society and our customers through our values of Takeda-ism Integrity, Fairness, Honesty, Perseverance. We incorporate these values in everything we do. They represent who we are and how we act. They help us make decisions that we can be proud of today and in the future. We enable our employees to develop their full potential. As a global top employer, we offer exciting career paths, promote innovation and strive for top performance in everything we do. Takeda fosters an inclusive, collaborative and international work environment where our teams are united by their relentless commitment to our goal of improving people's health and creating a better future for the world. Learn more at takedajobs.com.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

Takeda is committed to foster diversity, equity and inclusion. Hiring decisions are based entirely on qualifications and are made regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, sexual orientation, age or disability.

If you are interested in this opportunity, we look forward to receiving your application via our online tool!

For further questions, please contact Jennifer Kriedemann | Talent Acquisition Partner EUCAN | E-Mail jennifer.kriedemann@takeda.com

Locations

DEU - Berlin - Wirtschaftswunder

Worker Type

Employee

Worker Sub-Type

To solve one of the largest problems of our generation we need to get the world’s best talent.

We are on a mission to enable the global food system to become sustainable. Our technology is enabling thousands of restaurants, wholesalers, and producers across 7 countries to operate waste-free and efficiently already today. Yet, this is a drop into the ocean. We just started. Our goal to connect the global food system is extremely ambitious and complex. A problem of this magnitude and complexity requires a massive scale and only the best people will be able to solve it. We are gathering the best people globally together in order to succeed in our mission. Are you in?

For us, it is always team-first. Teams in which everyone subordinates their individual success to the team's success will win against teams that don't. Can you put your ego aside?

We are looking for the hungry underdogs that will rather fail than not try. We look for humility because it makes us learn faster. And we look for people who understand that hard work is necessary and that shortcuts don’t exist. We are playing the long game and want to build a truly generational company.

Our mission requires us to be fast. We believe that urgency is a mindset. We look for people who act with speed in everything they do, yet never lose sight of the bigger picture.

Fun plays an important role. We want to succeed and celebrate when we do. It is important to us that our people form real bonds in and outside of work.

We have no small plans, we are assembling a championship team, with people that take real ownership of our company’s long-term success. If you feel this is for you, then deep inside you, you might be already one of us.

See what we’ve been up to: bit.ly/3BX0kYj

Building a great company means putting Data and Analytics at the heart of decision making and operations - and enabling everyone in the organization to have access to high quality insights.

As our Senior Business Intelligence Analyst you will be a core part of our Intelligence department by leading the day-to-day operations of the team - from technically leading and mentoring the team in delivering insights, developing Choco's analytics and reporting infrastructure to communication with internal and external stakeholders.

What You’ll Do

Be a sparring partner to senior management and operational leads at our Berlin HQ for everything related to data driven decision making - KPI definitions, reporting frameworks and more
Deliver data insights and performance dashboards to on-the-ground teams to enable them to operate faster and better
Discover new truths and tell stories about our business with data for C-Level stakeholders
Contribute to the development of strategies, roadmaps and business cases for analytics solutions
Manage ad-hoc requests from business teams, deliver reports and dashboards and contribute to our analytics data model
Lead the full lifecycle of an Analytics project: from gathering requirements to architecting a solution, supervising on technical implementation and monitoring delivery
Design and manage underlying data sources to allow quick and efficient data extracts to support analysis

What We’re Looking For

You have 4+ years of experience in Data and Analytics
Excellent written as well as verbal communication skills for effective presentation of data stories to C-Level
You can communicate with more senior as well as more junior team member effectively, you have good people skills
Extensive experience in SQL, Python or other data languages
You can visualize data in a simple manner with tools such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI or similar
Experience with fast-moving startups - having scaled Analytics in such a company is a strong bonus
Excellent understanding of SAAS and Marketplace Business Metrics
You have empathy for the users you build for
You are passionate about Choco and the problem we are solving

You impress us even more if

Experience with AWS, Databricks, DBT and Airflow 
Great technical understanding of data infrastructures

What It’s Like To Work At Choco

As an office-first company, you’ll participate in our weekly face-to-face days. Three days a week, all teams gather in our office to enable better collaboration, participation, and engagement. All of which, is essential at Choco. Plus, we value camaraderie and genuinely enjoy the time we spend together as a team!

Need a better idea of who we are? Take a video tour of our headquarters in Berlin.

Choco was founded in Berlin in 2018 and has since expanded to a team of over 400 committed Chocorians working from Choco offices in the US, France, Belgium, Germany, Austria, the UK, and Spain. Our ordering app is used by over 15K buyers and over 10K suppliers around the globe - processing hundreds of thousands of tons of food every month.

We raised over $280mn from some of the world’s best investors like Bessemer Venture Partners, Insight Partners, Coatue Management, and LeftLane Capital. We are the first unicorn to reduce food waste.

We’re working alongside those who built companies like Google, Facebook, Amazon, Uber, Rocket Internet, and more.

Choco is an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. We are committed to ensuring that our technology is available and accessible to everyone. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

THE ROLE & THE TEAM


As a Senior Data Analytics Consultant/ Product Manager for Customer Data in the central Data Analytics department you will co-drive the transformation of customer data for Zalando together with the respective engineering leadership. You will lead and drive the creation of substantial customer data products that are consumed inside and outside the company. You will manage implementation teams assigned to your projects and oversee the product phases end to end. You consult stakeholders in our solution stack, best practices and suggest state of the art analytical & engineering solutions where applicable. Additionally, as a team member to the Data Analytics Product Management, you get to be involved in the Zalando Data Strategy, an initiative that is fundamentally changing how we work with data.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups

What We'd Love You To Do (and Love Doing)


Product Management and Agile Methodologies Utilize hands-on product management skills and a product-centric mindset to employ Agile methodologies effectively. This includes conducting sprint planning and reviews, backlog management, and prioritization to enhance overall product development and user experience. 
Enhancing User Productivity and Experience Focus on identifying blockers and exploring new opportunities to improve user productivity. Employ a customer-focused approach to drive enhancements in user experience. 
Strategic Product Development Drive product development with a clear vision and roadmap, ensuring alignment with Zalando's Strategy and Data Strategy. Utilize business acumen and efficient execution strategies for better product offerings. 
Decision-Making and Problem-Solving Create detailed narrative documents to facilitate decision-making, clearly communicating rationales and strategies. Analyze problems, propose solutions with their pros and cons, and evaluate outcomes. 
Coaching and Mentoring Act as a coach and mentor to colleagues, promoting a customer-first, problem-solving approach. Encourage a culture of starting with the customer and working backwards. 
Customer Needs and Data Product Development Understand and interpret customer needs and requirements for data products. Ensure that the development aligns with the overall vision, roadmap, and targets customer needs effectively. 
Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement Collaborate closely with data scientists, engineers, and other stakeholders to meet target customer needs. Lead the adoption process of the data product. 
Metrics and Analytics for Product Improvement Utilize metrics and analytics to measure the success of the data product. Implement improvements based on these insights and actively seek user feedback for continuous product enhancement. 
Sprint Planning and Implementation Steer bi-weekly sprint planning based on priorities with the implementation team and main end-users, ensuring agile and efficient progress towards goals. 



WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF...



 3+ years of relevant work experience as Product Manager or Tech Consultant, leading development of several products, collaborating with a team of data and software engineers and cross-functional partners to build products 
 Bridge between customers and engineering teams, skilled in translating business requirements into technical requirements, experience with software products and architectures in the Data area 
 Natural problem-solver, pragmatic approach, with a strong history of leading product discovery, solving meaningful customer and business problems, and delivering scalable solutions. 
 Ability to create a strong product vision and translate that vision for any audience, through well-crafted strategic documents, thorough requirements, and clear communication with stakeholders 
 Strong analytical mind, with the expertise to evaluate data, draw insights to make informed product decisions by defining success criteria and measuring impact of the product

Willst Du gemeinsam mit uns das 36.000 Kilometer lange Berliner Stromnetz fit halten, ausbauen und modernisieren? Willst Du Dich mit voller Kraft für unsere 3,7 Millionen Kund*innen und für eine nachhaltige Stadtgesellschaft engagieren?

Dann unterstütze uns zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt als

 Data-Analyst*in für Kundenprozessoptimierung 

in der Arbeitsgruppe Prozessmanagement am Standort Berlin Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf.

Wir sind Stromnetz Berlin. Als Mitgestalter der Energiewende halten wir die Stadt am Laufen, geben ihr Energie und bringen sie zum Leuchten.

Mehr über uns erfährst Du hier: Über uns - Stromnetz Berlin

Als Teil des Fachgebietes Bereichsmanagement verantwortet die Arbeitsgruppe Prozessmanagement übergreifende Prozessverbesserungen und Prozesse innerhalb der Abteilung Mittel- und Niederspannung. Dazu zählen die Weiterentwicklung der Digitalisierungsstrategie, Gestalten von Prozessen für die Product-Life-Cycles und das Release Management der bereichspezifischen Applikationen, die zentrale Beschaffung von IT sowie die Koordination der Arbeitssicherheit und des Qualitätsmanagements. Diese Aufgaben erwarten Dich: 


Verantwortung für das Reporting und die Qualitätsanalysen kundenbezogener, energiewirtschaftlicher und prozessbezogener Kennzahlen.
Unterstützung der Prozessverantwortlichen - zum Beispiel bei der Prozessoptimierung der Durchlaufzeiten von Hausanschlüssen, PV-Anlagen, Ladeeinrichtungen und Wärmepumpen - durch Deine Reportings.
Prüfung, Analyse und Überwachung der vorliegenden Datenqualität sowie Information aller relevanten Stakeholder bei Abweichungen.
Definition und Ermittlung von Kennzahlen, Konzipieren aussagefähiger Reports, Dashboards und Visualisierungen zur Ableitung von erforderlichen Steuerungsmaßnahmen in enger Zusammenarbeit mit der Abteilung Mittel- und Niederspannung.
Deine weiteren Aufgaben sind unter anderem:
Koordination und Konzeptionierung der Aufarbeitung fehlerhafter Datensätze.
Identifizierung fehlender Daten sowie Nachhalten bei der Beschaffung dieser.

 Wir suchen jemanden mit: 


einem Hoch- oder Fachhochschulabschluss im Bereich der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung.
Spaß daran, sich in Systeme, Prozesse und Datenstrukturen einzuarbeiten. Du möchtest Zusammenhänge verstehen und gemeinsam mit Deinen Kolleg*innen systemübergreifend eine plausible Datenlage herstellen.
unternehmerischer und analytischer Denkweise, Eigeninitiative, Engagement, Selbstständigkeit sowie Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit.
Plus, aber kein Muss:
Erste Berufserfahrungen im Bereich der Datenbanken und idealerweise auch Kenntnisse von Datenanalysen durch Process Mining.
Ein grundlegendes und übergreifendes Datenbankverständnis, Kenntnisse in Power BI oder einer anderen BI-Software, MS Power Query und MS-Office-Kenntnisse.

 Das spricht für Deine Karriere bei uns:


Work-Life-Balance: Für die Vereinbarung von Familie, Freizeit und Beruf bieten wir unseren Mitarbeitenden flexible Arbeitszeiten bei einer 37h-Woche, mobiles Arbeiten, 30 Urlaubstage im Jahr sowie weitere arbeitsfreie Tage an Weihnachten und Silvester an.
Persönliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir fördern Deine persönliche Entwicklung (z.B. durch Entwicklungsgespräche) und unterstützen durch individuelle Weiterbildungsmaßnahmen.
Arbeitsumfeld: Wir sichern Dir ein Umfeld mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum zur Eigeninitiative und eigenverantwortlichem Handeln sowie eine offene Kommunikationskultur zu.
Gesundheit: Weil uns Deine Gesundheit am Herzen liegt, haben wir ein vielfältiges Gesundheitsmanagement implementiert und unterstützen Dich bei gesundheitsfördernden Aktivitäten, wie z.B. Fitnessstudiomitgliedschaften.
Finanzielle Sicherheit: Du erhältst eine attraktive tarifliche Einstiegsvergütung zwischen 60.000 - 72.000 € in einem krisensicheren Unternehmen. Durch abweichende persönliche Voraussetzungen kann eine Eingruppierung zu Beginn auch niedriger erfolgen. Profitiere von weiteren Leistungen, wie einem Zuschuss zum Firmenticket AB, vergünstigtem Mittagessen sowie einem Jobrad-Leasing und einer betrieblichen Altersvorsorge. 
Standort Berlin: Du wohnst noch nicht in Berlin und Umgebung? Durch unsere Kooperation mit einem Berliner Wohnungsunternehmen unterstützen wir Dich beim schnellen Ankommen in Deutschlands Hauptstadt.


So wird die Stromnetz Berlin als Arbeitgeber (kununu.com) gesehen.

Bunt – spannend – vielfältig – Berlin.

Wir sind überzeugt von Vielfalt und Inklusion. Bewerbungen von Menschen jeglichen Alters, geschlechtlicher Identität, sexueller Orientierung sowie mit Migrationsgeschichte sind herzlich willkommen. Da wir uns Chancengleichheit und die berufliche Förderung von Frauen zum Ziel gesetzt haben, sind wir an Bewerbungen von Frauen besonders interessiert. Menschen mit Behinderung werden bei gleicher fachlicher Eignung besonders berücksichtigt. Das hört sich gut an? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung - gern unter Angabe Deiner Kündigungsfrist sowie Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung.

Hast Du Fragen? Wir helfen Dir gern:

Informationen zum Job: Franziska Bonitz, Telefon: +49 173 3002 971.

Informationen zum Bewerbungsprozess: Gina Bart, Telefon: +49 151 5353 3232.

Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com

We are hiring freelance English and German speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography. 
 This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task. 

Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in English and German
You must be living in Germany for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Germany
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over. 

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Better work-life balance
Be your own boss
Remote work & location independence
Complimentary Well-Being package encompassing a wealth of well-being resources.

Introduction

Sourcing & Procurement Data Analyst

Your working environment

In the departments of the "Supporting Functions" you may not come into direct contact with our products, but with your expertise you contribute significantly to the smooth functioning of our company. Only with colleagues from these structured, efficient and supportive departments, such as Human Resources, Accounting, Controlling, IT and Communications, is it possible for us to grow beyond ourselves and achieve our goals as a company.

Your tasks

Each employee is responsible for the continuous improvement of work processes, working conditions and the entire organization by making their own contributions, suggestions or approaches to solutions.


Design, implementation and further development of existing processes and tools.
Development and maintenance of S&SC Berlin KPIs and tools in Spotfire dashboards.
Driving forward industrialization of standard tools and setting up standard data sets for reporting (e.g. QLTCS meeting).
Provision of ad-hoc analytics and data-driven support for management reporting
Integration of S&SC Excellence, Analytics and Business Support of the Berlin site into the ASML Group structures
Management of and participation in select integration projects
Key user SAP for S&SC division


Your Qualifications

Several years of professional experience (at least 3 years) in Purchasing or Logistics division
Knowledge of the DIN EN ISO 9001 and 14001 requirements for suppliers
Excellent knowledge in the use of MS-Office and SAP
Fluency in written and spoken English


Your skills


Independent and result-oriented way of working
Willingness to travel globally
Experience in process management (modeling, implementation, controlling and optimization)
Experience in data analytics and reporting tools (e.g. Spotfire)
Ability to transfer supplier performance to a business context, so as to support management decisions

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir für den Standort Berlin oder Gerlingen bei Stuttgart eine/n (Senior) Web Analyst / Web Analytics Expert (m/w/d).

Darauf kannst Du Dich freuen:
Du verantwortest die (Weiter-) Entwicklung des Web Analytics Setups für einen internationalen Automotive-Konzern sowie die Konzeption und Umsetzung von Tracking und Web Analytics Strategien
Dabei übernimmst Du für einzelne Kunden-Applikationen die Verantwortung von der Beratung bei der Gestaltung ihrer Anforderungen an Web Analytics Reports, die daraus resultierenden technischen Anforderungen der zugrundeliegenden Webseite bis hin zur Erstellung der finalen Dashboards
Du betreust weltweite Stakeholder in der operativen Nutzung des Web Analytics Tools und bist deren direkter Ansprechpartner
Zudem analysierst Du Web Traffic Daten, um Trends zu identifizieren, Hypothesen zu entwickeln und entsprechende Handlungsempfehlungen abzuleiten
Du erstellst Berichte und Präsentationen, um den Stakeholdern relevante datengestützte Erkenntnisse und Empfehlungen zu präsentieren, die zur Verbesserung der Web-Performance beitragen


Diese Qualifikationen bringst Du mit:
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium und mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Web-/Datenanalyse, Online-Marketing oder IT-Consulting-Projekte, idealerweise im Umfeld Automotive
Sehr gute Kenntnisse gängiger Web Analytics Tools (GA4, Matomo von Vorteil) inkl. Konzepterstellung, technische Implementierungsbegleitung und hohe Anwenderkenntnisse
Fähigkeit, komplexe Daten in verständliche und handlungsorientierte Informationen zu übersetzen
Ausgeprägte Kundenorientierung und Freude am Kundenkontakt
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift (mind. C1 Niveau)
Nationale Reisebereitschaft (ca. 1-2 Tage/Monat)


Diese Vielfalt erlebst Du bei uns:

Unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag, kurze Entscheidungswege
Einarbeitung mit „Buddy-Programm“, persönliche und fachliche Weiterentwicklung
Zuschuss zur betrieblichen Altersvorsorge & Bahn
Monatlicher Gutschein (Tanken, Shoppen)
Freie Wahl des IT Equipments (Apple, Microsoft), kostenlose Getränke & Obst, coole Teamevents

Über uns:
Credera ist ein weltweit tätiges Beratungsunternehmen und agiert in Deutschland unter den beiden Firmen Smart Digital GmbH und Credera Deutschland GmbH. Wir vereinen ein tiefgreifendes Verständnis von Transformation mit umfassendem Branchenwissen und führender Expertise in den Bereichen AI und Technologie. Durch unsere hohe Kundenorientierung setzen wir diese Fähigkeiten in zahlreichen Projekten ein und generieren gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden neues Wachstum. Unser einzigartiger Ansatz einer globalen Consulting-Boutique bedeutet, dass wir Kunden überall auf der Welt mit individuell für sie erarbeiteten Lösungen bedienen und diese gleichzeitig aus unserer Organisation heraus global skalieren können. Getrieben von der Suche nach nachhaltigen Mehrwerten für unsere Kunden, lautet unsere Mission "to make an extraordinary impact on our clients, our people, and our community". Wir glauben, dass es diese Motivation ist, die es uns ermöglicht, die größten und einflussreichsten Marken und Organisationen weltweit erfolgreich zu transformieren, von der Strategie bis hin zur Implementierung.

Mehr Informationen finden Sie auf www.credera.com. Wir sind Teil der OPMG Unternehmensgruppe, ein Bereich der Omnicom Group Inc.

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

 Our Purpose –  Bridging the World Through Travel 

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND (WITH RELOCATION PROVIDED)

Location: Bangkok, Thailand (*Not open for remote work.)

Get to Know our Team:

As part of the Supply Analytics, you will be responsible for identifying new partners and opportunities, cultivating a relationship with them, and working together with them to deliver the best outcome for our end customers. You would also be responsible with managing the day-to-day interaction with the partner and working closely with other teams within Agoda to ensure the partners needs are met.

We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda’s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we build new channels to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.

The Opportunity: 

As an Analyst/Senior Analyst, you will report directly to either the Senior Manager or Associate Director within the Supply Department and this will be an individual contributor role. You will be responsible and fully empowered to work with the partners on the ground. You will be supported by a team within the Supply department and work closely with other Team members within Agoda.

In this Role, you’ll get to:

Translate internal briefs into analytical projects (to include refining the initial brief and asking the ‘right questions’, working through potential hypotheses and storyboarding the output)
Use and analyze data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and present statistically strong analysis to a wide range of business stakeholders
Proactively identify opportunities for growth within supply and the wider business
Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organizational efficiency and shaping Agoda supply
Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at scaling up the way the Supply organization leverages on data, insights, and intelligence
Automate manual operational processes and present back on time savings gained through modernization of business operations

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

At least 3-5+ years of experience working as an Analyst with experience in analytics/data science/insights/strategy/BI
Advanced working knowledge and hands-on experience in SQL
Strong knowledge and hands-on experience in data visualization tools such as Tableau (preferably) 
Expert domain of data analysis and data visualization tools and software such as Excel, Python (or R)
Bachelor’s degree ideally in a business or quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance)
A good understanding of statistical modelling knowledge or any machine learning technique knowledge (such as hypothesis testing, regression, logistic regression, random forest, etc.)
Good stakeholder management experience. Comfortable presenting to senior leadership and C-suite
Experience in conducting A/B testing experimentation
Strong experience in finding data insights and provide business recommendation to the business
A hacker’s mindset – the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping
Excellent communicator with superior written, verbal, presentation and interpersonal communication skills
Data driven in both decision making and performance measurement
Extreme comfort in ambiguous, fast-paced environment
Ability to multi-task, prioritize and coordinate resources

It’s Great if you Have: 

MBA or Masters in a quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance)
Program management certifications (e.g. PMI, PRINCE2) to compliment your program management experience
Asian market experience
Travel industry / e-commerce / tech / consulting experience

Über uns
 Wir glauben an einen ganzheitlichen Heilungs-Ansatz von Skin und Soul.
 
 Wir haben es uns zur Aufgabe gemacht, mit natürlich wirksamen Skincare-Produkten, innovativen Inhaltsstoffen, den richtigen Beauty Tools und neuen Anwendungstechniken die Confidence unserer Kundinnen zu stärken und ihr inneres und äußeres Wohlbefinden in Einklang zu bringen.
 
 Deine Mission
 Als Datenanalyst bei Rosental bist du der Schlüssel zum Erfolg unserer Sales- und Marketingstrategien. Deine Hauptaufgabe ist die tiefgreifende Analyse von Verkaufsdaten, um klare, actionable Insights zu generieren, die unser Marketing-Team in die Lage versetzen, effektive Produktbundles zu schnüren und gezielte Promotion-Aktionen für unsere Beauty-Produkte zu planen.
 
 Du wirst: 
Datenanalysen durchführen: Analysiere Verkaufszahlen, Kundenverhalten und Markttrends, um die Performance unserer Produkte zu verstehen und vorherzusagen.
Produktbundles optimieren: Identifiziere, welche Produktkombinationen am besten zusammen verkauft werden, und entwickle Vorschläge für attraktive Bundles, die unseren Kunden echten Mehrwert bieten.
Promotion-Strategien entwickeln: Arbeite heraus, welche Produkte nach bestimmten Käufen promotet werden sollen, um den Umsatz zu steigern und die Kundenbindung zu erhöhen.
Upsell-Funnels gestalten: Nutze dein Verständnis für Beauty-Routinen, um personalisierte Upsell-Funnels zu kreieren, die auf den individuellen Bedürfnissen und Vorlieben unserer Kunden basieren.
Zusammenhänge aufdecken: Entdecke und erkläre komplexe Zusammenhänge zwischen verschiedenen Produkten, Kaufverhalten und Marktrends, um strategische Entscheidungen zu untermauern.
 
 Dein Profil
 Wir suchen eine leidenschaftliche und datengetriebene Persönlichkeit mit einem Verständnis für die Beauty-Branche und einem scharfen analytischen Verstand. Du solltest folgendes mitbringen:
  Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse: Du hast bereits Erfahrung in der Analyse von E-Commerce-Verkaufsdaten, vorzugsweise in Shopify, und bist vertraut mit Analysetools und -methoden.
Affinität zur Beauty-Branche: Du bist begeistert von Beauty-Produkten und -Trends und verstehst die Bedürfnisse und Wünsche unserer Zielgruppe.
Kommunikationsstärke: Du kannst komplexe Daten und Analysen in klare, verständliche Empfehlungen übersetzen und diese effektiv an das Marketing-Team und weitere Stakeholder kommunizieren.
Strategisches Denken: Du denkst voraus, erkennst Muster und Trends und bist in der Lage, datenbasierte Strategien zu entwickeln, die unser Unternehmen voranbringen.
Teamplayer: Du arbeitest gerne im Team, bringst dich ein und teilst dein Wissen, um gemeinsam zum Erfolg zu gelangen.
Innovationsgeist: Du bist kreativ in der Lösungsfindung, experimentierfreudig und immer auf der Suche nach neuen Wegen, um unsere Produktpräsentation und Kundenansprache zu verbessern.

job_title: Senior Consultant Microsoft Business Intelligence (all genders)
job_desc:
Wir gehören zu den Top-Adressen in der IT-Welt und fokussieren uns auf die Optimierung der Kerngeschäftsprozesse unserer Kunden. Durch den smarten Einsatz maßgeschneiderter IT-Lösungen unterstützen wir unsere Kunden dabei, das Beste aus ihrem Business und aktuellen Technologien herauszuholen. Unseren Erfolg aber erreichen wir nur durch eins: die Menschen bei adesso! Sie bringen Ideen, fachliches Know how und Technologien zusammen. Gemeinsam programmieren wir (deine) Zukunft bei adesso.

Standorte

Berlin, Köln, Essen, Hamburg, Stuttgart, Dortmund, Hannover, Frankfurt, Nürnberg, München, Karlsruhe

DEINE ROLLE - DAS WARTET AUF DICH

Du bist Schlüsselspielerin bzw. Schlüsselspieler für unseren Unternehmenserfolg und bewegst dich an der Schnittstelle zwischen den Fachabteilungen und der IT.

Das Competence Center Business Intelligence IT-Consulting ist verantwortlich für die Umsetzung komplexer Business Intelligence und Big Data Projekte für unsere namhaften Kunden.

Dein Aufgabengebiet im Einzelnen beinhaltet weiterhin:

Beraten unserer Kunden in betriebswirtschaftlichen Fragestellungen sowohl im fachlichen als auch im technischen Kontext
Erstellen des fachlichen und technischen Design für die von Ihnen erhobenen Anforderungen auf Basis der Microsoft Business Intelligence-Technologie und eigenverantwortliche Umsetzung dieser im Team
Übernahme von Projektleitungsaufgaben und Aufbau neuer Kunden-Accounts
Einführung neuer Mitarbeiter und Coaching von Junioren

In unseren Teams denken und handeln adessi interdisziplinär, lösungsorientiert und gehen gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden voran.

DEINE SKILLS - DAS BRINGST DU MIT

Abgeschlossenes Studium der Wirtschaftsinformatik , Betriebswirtschaftslehre oder vergleichbare Qualifikation
Mehrjährige Beratungs-und Projektleitungserfahrung in verschiedenen Microsoft BI-Projekten
Nachweisliche Kompetenz im Design und der Implementierung anspruchsvoller Reporting- und Analyse Anwendungen (z.B. mit PowerBI und Reporting Services)
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Anbindung heterogener Landschaften und Transformation komplexer Logiken
Ausgezeichnete Kenntnisse im Design und Aufbau stabiler Enterprise Data Warehouse Strukturen
Praktische Erfahrungen in anerkannten Data Warehousing Standards (Kimball, Inmon)
Ausgezeichnete kommunikative Fähigkeiten und Überzeugungskraft
Projektbedingte Reisebereitschaft innerhalb von Deutschland, Österreich und der Schweiz

Unser Versprechen: Du wirst dich bei uns wohlfühlen! Kollegial, familiär und auf Augenhöhe – wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Diversität und verschiedene Blickwinkel werden bei uns genauso geschätzt wie du als Mensch. Das und viel mehr steht für unser ganz besonderes Wir-Gefühl. Für das es sogar ein Wort gibt: adessi.

Unsere Kultur und das Zusammenarbeiten sind geprägt von gegenseitiger Wertschätzung, Anerkennung und Unterstützung. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So belegen wir zum wiederholten Mal den 1. Platz beim Wettbewerb „Deutschlands Beste Arbeitgeber in der ITK“!. Unser umfangreiches Trainingsangebot und ein transparentes Laufbahnstufenmodell für alle sorgen dafür, dass deine Entwicklung bei uns nicht stillsteht. Denn gemeinsam zu wachsen und Chancengeber zu sein, das ist programmiert in unserer DNA.

Du machst den Unterschied. Ob im Business Audit & Assurance, Risk Advisory, Tax & Legal, Financial Advisory oder Consulting: Wir bei Deloitte unterstützen unsere weltweiten Mandanten dabei, sich kontinuierlich weiterzuentwickeln. Entdecke ein vielfältiges Arbeitsumfeld, das ständig in Bewegung ist und immer um ein Zentrum kreist: dich und dein Know-how. What impact will you make?

Du willst in unserem Business Audit & Assurance Innovationen in den Bereichen Prüfung und prüfungsnahe Beratung vorantreiben? Unser breites Portfolio eröffnet dir die Möglichkeiten, national und international für unsere Mandanten im Mittelstand, in multi-nationalen Unternehmensgruppen oder am Kapitalmarkt (DAX 40, MDAX) tätig zu sein – mit digitalen Tools und einem tiefen Verständnis für strategische Fragen. Sichere unseren gemeinsamen Erfolg und mach mit uns den Unterschied: als Consultant Data Analytics (m/w/d).

Standorte: Berlin, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt (Main), Hamburg, Hannover, Köln, Mannheim, München, Nürnberg und Stuttgart.

Dein Impact:

Als Consultant Data Analytics (m/w/d) bringst du dein Wissen in innovative Projekte im Bereich Audit Analytics ein – und unterstützt uns datengetriebene Prüfungsmethoden in allen Bereichen der Jahresabschlussprüfung zu integrieren. Dabei hast du die Möglichkeit, einen individuellen Schwerpunkt – sowohl technischer als auch fachlicher Art – zu legen und dich dahingehend weiterzuentwickeln.

Innovation: Sowohl bei der (Weiter-)Entwicklung von IT-Lösungen als auch bei interdisziplinären Datenanalysen setzen wir auf deinen Einsatz. 
Agilität: Mit deinem agilen Mindset entwickelst du kreative Lösungswege für unsere verschiedenen Projekte. 
Transformation: Zudem treibst du die digitale Transformation der Abschlussprüfung sowohl durch im Deloitte-Netzwerk entwickelte Tools, als auch durch eigene Ideen voran. 
Monitoring & Beratung: Du kümmerst dich um die Evaluation der global im Deloitte-Netzwerk entwickelten Tools und konzipierst sowie führst Beratungsprojekte im Umfeld unserer Assurance-Dienstleistungen durch. 
Aufgabenvielfalt: Nicht zuletzt entwickelst du Roll-Out Strategien für unsere globalen Audit Analytics Tools und unterstützt mit deinem Analytics Know-how bei Jahresabschlussprüfungen sowie prüfungsnahen Dienstleistungen.

Dein Skillset:

Abschluss in (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, (Wirtschafts-)Ingenieurwesen, (Wirtschafts-)Mathematik, Physik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder vergleichbar 
Fundierte Kenntnisse in der Datenanalyse, -modellierung und -visualisierung (z. B. PowerBI, QlikView) bzw. in Programmiersprachen (z. B. Python, R) sowie Datenbank- oder Big Data Systemen (z. B. SQL) 
Idealerweise erste Kenntnisse in der agilen Softwareentwicklung bzw. im agilen Projektmanagement (z. B. Scrum, Kanban) 
Interesse an Machine Learning, Process Mining oder Cloud-Technologien 
Deutsch und Englisch sehr gut in Wort und Schrift, ausgeprägte Kommunikationsstärke, hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein und Lust auf neue Herausforderungen 

Deine Chance:

Spannende Aufgaben in einem innovativen Umfeld mit hochmotivierten Kolleg:innen, die sich schon jetzt auf deine Impulse freuen
Gute Rahmenbedingungen mit attraktivem Gehalt und zahlreichen Zusatzleistungen, z. B. Firmen-Smartphone zur privaten Nutzung, Fahrradleasing und Corporate Benefits
Work-Life-Balance durch Mobile Working & Teilzeit, EU Remote Working, Sabbaticals, Mitarbeiter:innen-Events, Well-being Angebote wie z. B. Gesundheitstage, Kooperationen mit Fitness-Anbietern und den Familienservice, der dich bei privaten Herausforderungen unterstützt
Exzellente Weiterbildung an der Deloitte University, in On- und Offline-Seminaren und im Rahmen der Berufsqualifikation
Vielfältige Gestaltungsräume und aktive Förderung einer inklusiven Unternehmenskultur – u. a. durch unsere globale Diversity & Inclusion-Initiative ALL IN und lokale Mitarbeiter:innen-Netzwerke

Bist du bereit? Mach mit uns den Unterschied!

Unser Recruiting-Team freut sich auf deine Bewerbungsunterlagen (CV sowie Abitur-, Hochschul- und Arbeitszeugnisse) über unser Online-Formular. Ein Anschreiben ist nicht notwendig.

Gleiche Chancen für alle: Wir freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen, die so vielfältig sind wie wir – unabhängig von Alter, Behinderung, ethnischer Herkunft und Nationalität, Geschlecht, Religion, sexueller Orientierung oder sozialer Herkunft. Noch Fragen? Alle Infos zu unserem Bewerbungsprozess findest du in unseren Bewerbungs-FAQs.

Bewerbungsfrist: Solange der Job angezeigt wird, kannst du dich schnell und bequem online bewerben. Jobs werden häufig an verschiedenen Standorten mehrfach besetzt und du kannst flexibel jeden Monat beginnen - sofern nicht im Stellentext genannt, gibt es keinen Bewerbungsschluss.

job_title: Senior Data Analyst, Customer Payments (Relocation to Tallinn)
job_desc:
About the role
We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our payments team and help us to drive improvements in both user experience and payments platform in our HQ in Tallinn, Estonia (a relocation package will be provided).

As a Senior Data Analyst at Bolt, you are much more than a data cruncher. You are co-leading the product's development, being the customer's voice, and playing a crucial role in deciding what we build and why.

Customer Payments is a central team that offers a payment platform for other verticals and countries within Bolt to execute their strategies. The team provides reliable payment services to enable current and new Bolt customers to easily pay at the most reasonable cost possible.

Your daily adventures will include:
Identifying the most impactful opportunities in product development through data - features and configurations, user and payment flows, vendor selection, and more.
Designing and running experiments at scale, measuring their results, and providing business recommendations.
Researching payment methods for current and future Bolt markets, including understanding the technical constraints and value for Bolt users.
Conducting cost analysis, recommending optimisations, and ensuring the accuracy of cost-related budgets.
Monitoring payments performance indicators, highlighting trends, and analyzing unexpected variance.
Prepare and update regular reporting and perform ad-hoc analyses to uphold strategic decision-making.

About you:
You have at least 2-4 years of experience dealing with large volumes of data
You have some payments or finance-related experience in e-commerce.
You can rank your SQL skills as “outstanding” and Python/R experience as “profound”.
You have experience with BI tools and data visualisation tools (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI).
You are experienced in building data pipelines (for example using dbt and AirFlow).
You possess strong verbal and written English communication and can effectively collaborate with others.
You’re a proactive problem-solver and fast learner who takes ownership, finds solutions, drives results, and pays great attention to detail.

Experience is important, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!

Why you’ll love it here:
Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 500+ cities across 45 countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.

 *Some perks may differ depending on your location.

job_title: Senior Data / Product Analyst in Performance Marketing (all genders)
job_desc:
About The Role

Zalando's Performance Marketing department is creating and deepening relationships with consumers outside of Zalando premises by showcasing our digital ads. We’re marketing Zalando’s flawless choice, our best in fashion inspiration and the shopping convenience our customers love. We use the latest technology to make our ads relevant and engaging to consumers while fully respecting customer privacy.

The role as our Senior Data / Product Analyst is highly influential for taking strategic decisions about a multi-million marketing investment each week. With our marketing professionals you’ll ensure a consistent and sustainable channel performance and profitable growth. With our product management, applied scientists and engineering teams you’ll further innovate our best in-industry performance marketing engine, for instance our internal systems to measure incremental lifetime value of marketing activities and build out our privacy-first audience strategies.

This position offers great career growth opportunities, as we’re looking for an experienced candidate to step up as principal or team lead of product analytics in performance marketing in the future.

WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)

You’ll support the department with


 Being the trusted internal consultant for our marketing colleagues in optimization projects involving the largest global ad platforms (i.e. Google Search, Meta), and acting as a partner for external marketing science teams in innovative advertising tests. 
 Designing end-to-end research plans based on problem statements, starting with exploratory analyses to inform hypotheses to selecting the most appropriate methodologies and metrics to understand causal effects. 
 Supporting our leadership team in making critical decisions about large marketing investments or strategy shifts, by answering ad-hoc requests and calculating what-if scenarios. 
 Continuously evolving our KPI framework and creating models to detect metric anomalies, and improving existing marketing performance forecasting models. 
 Increasing the proficiency of more junior analysts and stakeholders by facilitating knowledge sharing and enablement (i.e. A/B-testing best practices, SQL, advanced Python usage). 


WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF

We’re looking for proficiency in the following areas in order to succeed in this role.


Experience 5+ years of experience as Data / Product Analyst in a diverse and fast-paced business environment are a must-have . You’re proud of your proven track record of leading analytical projects and guiding cross-functional project teams to success. 
Analytics You have experience in optimizing components of existing measurement frameworks and you can develop sound analytical approaches for various business strategies and tactics (i.e. revenue vs. profit growth). 
Statistics You’re safe and sound in a broad range of causal inference methods, frequentist & bayesian statistical testing and quasi-experimental research (i.e. diff-in-diff). Knowing simple predictive statistics (i.e. log-regression) is a plus. 
Programming You use SQL best practices (i.e using window functions, when to use common table expressions vs. temp tables) and you showcase proficiency in advanced analytics using Python. [Note Expect a related SQL and Python test during the hiring process] 
Data acquisition You have experience with defining data requirements (i.e. tracking data) and creating simple ETLs. First experience with data governance and compliance practices is a plus. 
Communication skills Your experience enables you to concisely communicate the essence and convey meaningful and relevant insights to analytical experts, non-expert stakeholders and executives. You are open and transparent to team members and stakeholders alike. 
Educational background You’re proud of your excellent degree in social studies, computer science, engineering, mathematics, economics, statistics or another similar quantitative field and eagerness to learn and apply new knowledge. 


Why Join Us?


 You'll be a key player in a department that's the driving force behind Zalando's growth. You’ll join a diverse and skilled analytics team, and closely work with other product analysts, business analysts and BI Analysts on a mid to principal level. 
 You’ll experiment with and challenge early versions of AI-driven marketing solutions developed by our partners like Google, Meta and other 3rd parties. 
 You’ll become part of Zalando’s 300+ people strong Analytics Community which offers learning and networking opportunities and projects outside of your day-to-day responsibilities. 
 You'll interact daily with cutting-edge infrastructure and massive datasets. 
 You will work cross-functionally and learn from experienced colleagues in marketing, product management, data engineering and applied science. 


Perks at Work 


 Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events 
 Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings 
 Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts 
 Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations) 


We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

About Zalando

Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, connecting customers, brands and partners across 25 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 50 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Please note that all the applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

Ready to Lead, Inspire, and Innovate?

Apply now and join us on this exhilarating journey where your work will not only be seen but felt across the fashion industry and beyond.

Job Description

Wer sind wir?

Avanade ist ein weltweit führender Anbieter von innovativen digitalen und Cloud-basierten Diensten, Business Solutions und designorientierten Anwendungen. Als Joint Venture von Microsoft und Accenture sind wir das weltweit größte Beratungsunternehmen, das sich auf Microsoft-Technologien spezialisiert hat. Bei Avanade sind wir nicht nur stolz darauf, unsere Kund:innen bei ihren Anliegen rund um Cloud, Modern Workplace, Business Applications (ERP & CRM), Data & AI oder Security zu beraten und zu unterstützen, sondern wir sind auch stolz auf unsere #PeopleFirst Mentalität.

Als Teil unseres Analytics-Teams hast Du Zugang zu den Forschungsergebnissen, dem Wissen und den Tools, mit denen Du führende Lösungen entwickeln kannst. Deine Rolle als Power BI-Berater ist eine Mischung aus Beratungsfähigkeiten und technischen Fähigkeiten zur Datenmodellierung und -visualisierung. Unsere Kunden erwarten von uns Innovation, und das bedeutet, dass Du frühzeitig Zugang zu den neuesten Microsoft-Technologien erhältst, damit Du diese beherrschst. Du bekommst ein tiefgehendes, zielgerichtetes Lernen von einem außergewöhnlichen Team sowie eine Vielzahl von Microsoft-Zertifizierungsmöglichkeiten. Gemeinsam tun wir, was zählt.

_____________________________________________

 Deine Aufgaben in unserem Team 

 Entwickeln von Ansätzen für die Steuerung und Bereitstellung von Power BI in großen Organisationen, einschließlich Beratung zu Lizenzierung, Verteilung/Freigabe, Schulung, Support und best Practices 
 Gestalten effektiver BI-Datenmodelle, Layouts und Designs in enger Zusammenarbeit mit unserem digitalen Design-Team, um eine optimale Benutzererfahrung sicherzustellen 
 Zusammenarbeit mit unserem Testteam, um die Prozesse rund um die User Acceptance Testing (UAT) beim Kunden zu steuern 
 Verwendung von Navigationsfunktionen in Power BI (Bookmarks, Drill-Through), um die Leser durch eine überzeugende daten-basierte Geschichte zu führen 

Deine Skills & Erfahrung

 Design von Datenmodellen unter Berücksichtigung bewährter Verfahren 
 Sichere Kommunikationsfähigkeiten zur Zusammenarbeit mit Kundenvertretern auf allen Ebenen 
 Umfassendes Wissen über die Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, DataVerse) 
 Kenntnisse der Azure Modern Data Platform (Azure Synapse, Data Factory, DataBricks 
 Fähigkeiten in komplexem DAX und SQL 
 Erfahrung in Power BI Embedded und der Entwicklung von benutzerdefinierten Visualisierungen ist von Vorteil Bereitschaft zu Reisen (abhängig von den Kundenanforderungen) 
 Sehr gute Präsentationskenntnisse sowie ein professionelles und sicheres Auftreten sind für dich selbstverständlich. 
 Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse 

Selbst wenn nicht alles auf dein Profil zutrifft und D u über Kompetenzen in anderen Bereichen verfügst, freuen wir uns über deine Bewerbung!

 Über Dich: 

Eigenschaften, die in dieser Rolle zum Erfolg führen können:

 Beratend, kooperativ, fähig Beziehungen aufzubauen 
 Belastbar, anpassungsfähig, flexibel 
 Intellektuell neugierig und leidenschaftlich für Technologie 
 Überzeugender Geschichtenerzähler und ansprechender Inhaltsentwickler 

__________________________________

 Enjoy your career 

Some of the best things about working at Avanade

Trust, responsibilty and appreciation: We are a large, international company – but we want to maintain the entrepreneurial spirit of a start-up. Every member at Avanade is equally valued and respected. Therefore, it is important for us that you get the trust and confidence immediately to take on responsibility within our large project portfolio. 
Broad Onboarding: It is important for us that you feel comfortable and welcome right away. That's why we not only have a comprehensive onboarding phase where you get to know all the relevant contact persons, but also a mentoring program where all new joiners are assigned to a buddy to make it easier for them to settle in with us.
Career Advisor: From day one you will have a mentor, who will support, coach and help you to find your space and balance and to build up your own network at Avanade. 
Equipment: We provide state-of-the-art equipment for your home office (laptop, smartphone incl. private use). There should be no lack of technical equipment when working form a modern office or in your home office.
Flexible Working: We are flexible – just like our working hours. Our flexible working time model with 1:1 overtime compensation (for all levels up to and including Senior Consultant) as well as the option for home office and a worldwide accident insurance which offers you security and balance when working from elsewhere. 
Pension Plan: Avanade covers 2/3 of your pension fund and your short term disability indemnity insurance. 
Continuous education: The opportunity to participate in local and international leadership programs (Avanade Leadership Program) gives you new perspectives. With your personal MSDN subscription including Azure contingent yo will have unlimited access to all Microsoft and other relevant certifications, various internal academies and guaranteed 80 hours training budget per year. 
Compensation: We put a lot of emphasis on performance-oriented and competitive compensation and offer you an attractive compensation package based on your experience and qualifications. 
Benefits: We are constantly working on our benefits package, which we have summarized for you here . 

A great place to work

As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and our communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, but to also lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!

We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our Inclusion & Diversity page.

Create a future for our people that focuses on

 Expanding your thinking
 Experimenting courageously
 Learning and pivoting

Inspire greatness in our people by

 Empowering every voice
 Encouraging boldness
 Celebrating progress

Accelerate the impact of our people by

 Amazing the client
 Prioritizing what matters
 Acting as one

About Avanade

Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.

We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.

We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.

Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

Kontinuierliche Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und Unterstützung bei Zertifizierung|An Projekten im Bereich erneuerbare Energien mitwirken

The Successful Applicant

Datenanalyse und -visualisierung mit Tools wie Python, R und Tableau
Erfahrung mit SQL und Datenbankabfragen

What's on Offer
