job_title: Data and policy analyst (Global role in a virtual working environment)
job_desc:
About Grant Thornton Grant Thornton is one of the world’s leading professional services networks with member firms in over 145 countries, 72,000 people and global revenues of $7.5bn. Member firms offer audit, tax, and advisory services to privately owned companies, publicly listed companies, public sector and not for profit organisations, both domestically and internationally.

Grant Thornton International Ltd (GTIL) is the umbrella legal entity for the Grant Thornton global network of member firms. GTIL sets the strategic direction, convenes member firms, connects global communities, and protects the brand and reputation of the network. GTIL and the member firms will continually improve the sustainability of their operations and strive to make a positive impact on clients, people, markets, and the communities in which we operate, in line with the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

Role purpose 

In our Go Beyond network strategy 2025 our vision is to become ‘the most valued network in the profession’.

This role sits within the International Business Support Function (IBSF) at GTIL. The Function exists to support member firms win more international business. Talking our clients’ language – and understanding the broader commercial issues and trends affecting their businesses – is critical to winning and expanding international client relationships in all geographies.

One of the ways in which we do this is by equipping our engagement partners with the knowledge, content and contacts they need to have quality conversations with their industry clients.

This new role will work with our Associate Director – Policy and Data, to deliver the global policy and data strategic objectives.

Main Responsibilities 

Policy Management
Manage GTConnect IBSF policy pages
Obtain awareness of market practice and stakeholder expectation and audit and review policies for updating
Work with Associate Director, Policy and Data to author and issue resources like FAQs, quick start guides, and other types of supporting documentation to enable member firm adoption of IBSF policies
Contribute to new policy and policy update projects including editing and drafting of policies.
Track usage metrics of policies and report to IBSF Team Leadership

 Data Management Responsibilities
Provide routine global business development reporting and ad hoc data analysis focused on IBSF areas of responsibility
Liaise directly with IBSF leadership to stay informed on new business activity (including pursuit, industry, business development, and targeting)
Maintain internal databases and manage data cleaning and validation processes
Help prepare presentations for internal meetings, business reviews, etc.
Provide data visuals and statistical analysis for corporate reports and presentations
Liaise with Finance to ensure accurate revenue and referral data is captured for firm reporting
Focus on enhancing, streamlining, and automating processes to create efficiencies

 Technology Liaison Responsibilities
Assist Associate Director, Policy and Data in liaising with Information Security and Information Technology teams to upgrade existing firm tech infrastructure to better enable business insights
Execute project management tasks for technology projects including note taking, meeting scheduling, and slide deck creation and management.

 Analysis Responsibilities
Conduct strategic analysis on internal and external data sets (including financial, market, and proprietary data) to develop fact-based insights and recommendations for the International Business Support Function strategy
Assist with business development and strategic projects that support corporate strategy
Conduct exploratory data analysis on existing data sets
Gather and assess new data sets for insights use
Design and conduct data experiments to test and validate hypotheses

IBSF support and wider support
Build awareness of wider IBSF activities and support on ad hoc projects when appropriate
Deploy skills to wider GTIL Policy and Data projects where requested

Location
Within US/Canadian or European time zones.

Person Specification

Bachelor's Degree
Credential/certification in data science, business analytics, or compliance

Experience - essential

Demonstrable experience in policy management, experience in a policy management in professional services firm a plus
Strong analytical and technical skills; advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint knowledge is required; Experience in Data Vizualization in PowerBI or Tableau. Experience with Alteryx, Knime, Microsoft Dynamics or comparable tools preferred
Team player with strong work ethic and positive attitude
Ability to work independently and demonstrate critical thinking
Attention to detail and business acumen essential
Excellent time management, organizational skills, and attention to detail

Experience - desirable

Coding fluency in SQL preferred

Benefits 

There are many benefits of being part of Grant Thornton International, working with a global and diverse team in a virtual setting is just one of them. We pride ourselves on our inclusive culture and believe it's one of our most valuable assets. We also recognise the importance of time off at Grant Thornton International. Taking time away can lead to improved wellbeing and better productivity, which is why we don’t cap your leave. So if you need to take that extra Friday off (and Monday too), no problem. We believe work is no longer a location, it is what we do. This should help all of us deliver our best work, while achieving the right balance in our lives. We want to build a culture of virtual inclusivity. One where all our people have the ability to choose what works best for them but also provides our people the best shared working experience utilising the digital tools we have available. GTIL will provide individuals with the necessary support and equipment to work effectively from home. We also have a collaborative space to offer should you prefer working outside of your home. We will offer you access to digital learning options, as well as external training, should you role and development needs require this. We fully understand the importance of balancing your life and we aim to support that with remote working and flexibility within your role. We understand the time you spend outside of work helps shape what you bring into work, so we encourage flexibility on both sides. However, if you prefer to work from the office, this is also something we offer. We also understand the importance of working comfortably in a remote office - most likely your home, which is why we offer all staff a monthly home office allowance to ensure you're well equipped and able to undertake your role to the fullest. These are just some of the benefits of working at Grant Thornton International. We also have a wide range of attractive core benefits including pension, health insurance, wellbeing programmes and much much more.

job_title: Data Analyst - Intern (Remote Internship - Data Analysis)
job_desc:
Delve into the dynamic world of data analysis with an exclusive internship opportunity offered by Winged Recruitment. Our innovative blend of remote work culture and cutting-edge AI technology positions us as leaders in the recruitment landscape, providing a gateway to unlock your career aspirations. In partnership with a prestigious Management Consulting firm in Germany, we're seeking ambitious talents ready to redefine the landscape of data analysis.

Role Overview:

Tailored for individuals passionate about data analysis and equipped with problem-solving skills, this internship offers an immersive introduction to the field. Under the guidance of industry experts, you'll tackle diverse data analysis projects, exploring concepts like data visualization, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and data mining. Expect hands-on experience in uncovering insights and informing decisions, all from the comfort of your own space.

Opportunity Snapshot:

Location: Fully Remote
Schedule: Flexible Internship


Who We're Searching For:

Aspiring data analysts keen on unraveling complex datasets and extracting meaningful insights
Analytical thinkers adept at translating data into actionable recommendations
Effective communicators who thrive in collaborative team settings
Detail-oriented individuals excelling in fast-paced, analytical environments
Enthusiastic learners committed to honing their skills in data analysis
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL) highly valued
Familiarity with statistical techniques, data visualization, and database management advantageous


Your Contribution:

Contribute to data collection, cleaning, and analysis processes
Collaborate with the data analysis team to develop analytical models and insights
Aid in interpreting data trends and patterns to inform strategic decision-making
Bring fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to tackle data challenges
Foster a collaborative team environment focused on excellence in data analysis
Assist in documenting and presenting analysis results and recommendations


Why Choose This Path?

Winged Recruitment serves as your catalyst for career growth, aligning you with roles promising substantial advancement in data analysis. This internship provides an exceptional platform for learning and establishing your presence in the data analysis industry, mentored by top-tier management consulting experts in Germany.

Application Note:

Applying through Winged Recruitment grants access to an extraordinary opportunity with our esteemed client. Committed to GDPR compliance, we handle your information with the utmost respect for privacy and security. By submitting your application, you consent to sharing your resume with our client for the internship selection process.

Embark on your data analysis journey with this unparalleled internship. Apply now and pave the way for your future in data analysis!

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst with a specialization in marketing analytics. In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

What You’ll Be Doing

Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to analyze marketing data and extract meaningful insights. 
Developing Reporting Dashboards: Create dynamic dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into marketing performance. 
Collaborating with Marketing Teams: Work closely with marketing teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making. 
Data Integration and Management: Integrate data from various sources to provide a comprehensive view of marketing performance. 
Performance Tracking: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies. 
Predictive Analysis: Use data to predict trends and market movements, aiding in proactive strategy development. 
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members in using data analysis tools and understanding reports. 

Who You Are

Proficient in Data Analysis Tools: You have strong experience with tools such as Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI. 
Analytical and Insightful: You possess the ability to analyze complex datasets and turn them into actionable insights. 
Collaborative in Nature: You work well with marketing teams, understanding their needs and communicating data insights effectively. 
Skilled in Data Integration: You are adept at integrating and managing data from various sources. 
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. 
Proactive and Predictive: You are capable of conducting predictive analyses to inform future marketing strategies. 
Excellent Communicator: You can clearly convey data insights and their implications to non-technical team members. 

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

Establish a comprehensive, organized online database in BigQuery to store all client and marketing data and integrate lead data from CRMs, digital advertising data, customer opt-ins, and purchasing data to provide meaningful insights that inform marketing decisions. 
Create and maintain data dashboards in Looker Studio for easy data visualization, analysis, and automated reporting. 

60 Days

Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions. 

90 Days

Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy.

Your mission

Dive deep into our datasets to extract valuable insights
Transform complex data into meaningful visualizations that tell a compelling story, enabling decision-makers to quickly grasp key insights
Leverage your analytical skills to provide solutions to business challenges, playing a pivotal role in driving our company's growth
Apply robust and appropriate methodologies to ensure the accuracy and relevance of your findings
Work closely with various teams to understand data requirements and provide analytical support, while also learning from and sharing your knowledge with team members
Present complex data findings in a clear and accessible manner to a diverse range of stakeholders, ensuring that everyone, from technical experts to non-technical team members, can understand and act upon them
Leverage your analytical skills to provide solutions to business challenges, playing a pivotal role in driving our company's growth


Your profile

A minimum of 2 years of experience in data analytics or a related field
Proficiency in SQL, with an ability to write complex yet well-structured and well-documented queries to extract and manipulate data. Familiarity with dbt is a definite plus
A firm grasp of statistical and data analysis methodologies, ensuring that all conclusions drawn are valid and actionable
Proven ability to communicate data findings effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences, tailoring presentations and reports as needed
A creative mind that constantly seeks new ways to analyze data and present findings, ensuring our data analytics remains cutting-edge
You have a learner’s mindset and always seek out new tools, techniques, and perspectives to enhance your work. You are also open to learning from team members and are generous in sharing your expertise with them
Ability to collaborate smoothly with cross-functional teams, understanding their needs and delivering insights that make a real difference
Adaptability: Comfortable and adaptive in a high-speed, dynamic work environment, ensuring timely deliverables without compromising on quality


What we offer

A meaningful job! We create a great product with real social impact
Collaboration in a great, experienced and international team that exchanges ideas and learn from each other
Insight into the entire work process of our startup as well as the nebenan.de foundation
Responsibility and great opportunities to get actively involved
A flexible vacation policy - take as much vacation as you need. We also offer the option of a sabbatical
Your nebenan.de Spendit Card - per month you receive an additional income of 35 Euro, which you can use for things of your choice
A strength-based development culture (we work with the Gallup StrengthsFinder)
A workplace in Berlin-Kreuzberg, in a cheerful team and regular events such as lunch roulette / lunch & learn / yoga / back courses
Flexible working hours and the possibility to work remote

Zander Labs is a leader in neuroadaptive technology, pioneering innovative solutions to enhance human-computer interaction. We are embarking on the NAFAS project, a landmark 30 million EUR initiative set to revolutionize the field.

We are looking for a skilled biosignal data analyst to join our scientific team. The successful candidate will be responsible for testing and evaluating novel data processing methods and for executing well-defined analysis protocols. The main focus will be on the analysis of multichannel electrical brain activity recordings (electroencephalography, EEG), and the occasional analysis of various biophysiological data (e.g. photoplethysmography, pupillometry, electromyography).

The tasks for this position are (among others):

Execution of analysis protocols for EEG preprocessing, including, filtering, artefact rejection, visual inspection, and data scoring.
Exploration of novel biosignal processing methods and their applicability to EEG analysis.
Feasibility assessment of signal processing methods from other domains.
Assistance to ongoing data collection efforts.
Preparation and presentation of (batch) analysis results.
Creation and/or update of large databases of processed data
Proven experience as biosignal analyst, with emphasis on EEG analysis 
Studies in biomedical sciences, neuroscience, or a similar discipline (BSc and up)
Experience with MATLAB/Python programming languages 
Experience with EEGLAB or MNE Python is a plus
Experience with EEG data collection is a plus
Familiarity with brain-computer interface technology is desirable
Ability to work collaboratively in a multidisciplinary team.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Command (written and spoken) of English language is a plus

job_title: Climate Data Analyst - Intern (Asset Impact) | Berlin
job_desc:
This job description is for a position at Asset Impact (AI), an impact-driven climate start-up that has been part of GRESB since 2022.

We are looking for an enthusiastic Climate Data Analyst Intern to join our team in in Berlin at the beginning of Q2 2024. If you’re someone who is passionate about sustainable finance, embraces a start-up mentality, and is excited to take on new challenges, we’d love to hear from you. We offer the opportunity to contribute to the world of ESG data, learn about data analysis applied to sectors key to the climate transition, and experience the growth phase of a start-up.

Responsibilities

Your primary responsibility will be to assist the Asset Impact Data Team, with frequent interactions with the Product and Business teams. You will make direct contributions to the development of our data and analytics. Depending on your profile and interests, you will:

Research commercial and open-source physical asset data providers and data sources to help improve the coverage and quality of Asset Impact’s climate data. 
Conduct quality assurance (QA) and quality control (QC) checks of our data and climate indicators
Support the onboarding of raw data into Asset Impact’s proprietary database
Support the development of new products, metrics and methodologies in collaboration with the Asset Impact Product Team (e.g. financed emissions, scenario analysis)
Analyze corporate, climate and financial data and prepare responses to clients’ queries on Asset Impact’s data products. 
Support the Data Team in any part of the Asset Impact data workflow

Requirements

Right to work in Germany. The internship is not fully remote, you will be required to to work on-site with our team in Berlin. We are looking for working students (“Werkstudierendenstatus”). 
Experience summarizing technical information into concise texts for a general audience
Knowledge of sustainability and sustainable finance. 
Cleaning and analyzing data with code, and proficiency with R, or Python for data analysis and manipulation. Proficiency with SQL (or knowledge of relational databases) is a plus
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Fluency in English

Mindset

Passion for sustainability and data. 
Interest in learning about climate-critical sectors such as power generation, oil and gas extraction, transport, etc. 
Desire to work in an international start-up
Enthusiasm and motivation!

Benefits

A paid internship lasting 4-6 months with a potential transition to a full-time role
An opportunity to work with and learn from an international team of data scientists, analysts, sustainable finance specialists, and developers passionate about the climate transition
Exposure to the latest tools and methodologies in tech and sustainability
A rapidly growing organization with a lot of opportunities to get hands-on experience, make your voice heard and help shape our future
A mission that brings together technology and impact
Flexibility in terms of working hours and location
Office in the center of Berlin

Application process

We are recruiting for this position on a rolling basis. Please apply through the link below. We want motivated candidates – no need to tick all the skills and experience boxes! Phone interviews will be organized with shortlisted candidates.

We are looking for working students (“Werkstudierendenstatus”).

Asset Impact is proud to be an equal opportunity workspace.

Find out more at https://asset-impact.gresb.com/

About Us

Asset Impact (AI) is an impact-driven climate start-up. Our vision is of a financial system that sets the global economy on a path to net zero emissions. We are a specialist provider of climate data and analytics used by financial institutions to achieve emissions reductions in the real economy. Our asset-based data and analytics cover the most carbon-intensive sectors of the global economy and map more than 250,000 physical assets across nine industry sectors – linked to more than 60,000 listed and private companies – to issued securities.

Our clients, mostly financial institutions, include large global organizations such as the 1,000+ financial institutions applying the PACTA tool, Barclays for its BlueTrackTM tool, ING for its Terra climate approach, and PwC for its Climate Excellence Tool.

AI, formerly Asset Resolution, was established in 2018 in Paris by the 2° Investing Initiative, an innovative international think tank working to align financial markets with climate goals. We became part of GRESB, the leading ESG benchmark for real estate and infrastructure investments, in 2022 and became Asset Impact. We work globally and are expanding rapidly to support the growing needs of financial institutions as they embark on their journey to decarbonization.

job_title: Data Analyst Working Student (m/f/d) for Berlin based Start-up
job_desc:
FINE Legal is a Legal Tech Startup aiming to bring access to justice to everyone. We are developing a digital Consumer Rights Platform that allows people to fight for their legal justice digitally and risk-free. Founded in 2020, our company is in a state of growth right now and looking for talented people who share our vision of a fair world.

Tasks

Maintain and monitor the data pipelines, ensuring seamless data flow from various sources to our data lake.
Oversee the data warehouse, ensuring that the data sets/models are aligned with the requirements.
Ensure data consistency by preparing the data and developing relevant concepts.
Collaborate with stakeholders to set up dashboards and reporting based on their requirements.
Work closely with Operations and Product teams to support a data-driven decision-making process.
Assist other teams with challenges related to Excel and data analysis.


Requirements

You are enrolled at a German university
You have studied something with computer science, data analytics, or something completely different and you are simply good at the things mentioned above
You know how to handle databases, data lakes/warehouses, and know what ETL is, and how to set up and maintain a pipeline
You are familiar with SQL and able to keep control of complex queries
You already have your first experience with reporting tools and dashboard solutions (PowerBi, Lookerstudio, etc.)
You are an excel wizard
You want to exchange ideas constructively with your colleagues and find the best solution to problems
You like to think your way into business processes and help to improve them through numbers
Fluency in English


Benefits

With us, you have responsibility and creative freedom: You are involved in many areas and work directly with the management. You are an important part of our team and can always contribute your ideas.
We offer an exciting job with a purpose: Our mission is to help consumers to get their rights and thus ensure justice in society.
Dynamic start-up environment and flexible working: For us, results count more than prescribed work locations and hours. You can work flexibly in a home office or in our office in Berlin-Mitte (directly at "Hackescher Markt").
Attractive remuneration, high-quality technical equipment, and the start-up classics coffee, fruit, and events as well as a Wellpass membership 😉


Interested? Reach out to us!

We would love to see some of your work, so please include the link to your GitHub or portfolio.

Unternehmensbeschreibung

MANIKO ist ein innovatives, schnell wachsendes Unternehmen in der Nagellackbranche , das hochwertige Produkte für anspruchsvolle Kunden weltweit anbietet. Wir sind bekannt für unsere revolutionäre, selbstklebende Nagellack-Technologie, die es unseren Kundinnen ermöglicht, professionelle Ergebnisse bequem von zu Hause aus zu erzielen.

Als Junior Data Analyst (m/w/d) in unserem schnell wachsenden Startup hast du die Möglichkeit, dich für Datenanalyse zu begeistern und die datengetriebene Entscheidungsfindung der Zukunft aktiv mitzugestalten. Wir suchen engagierte Persönlichkeiten, die mit uns wachsen wollen.

Aufgaben

Mitentwicklung unserer Datenlandschaft - vom Data Warehouse bis zum Dashboard
Analyse und Interpretation unserer Daten zur Unterstützung unserer Entscheidungsfindung
Effektive Kommunikation und Präsentation von Datenanalysen und Erkenntnissen
Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Teams, um gemeinsame Ziele zu erreichen


Qualifikation

Erste Erfahrungen in der Datenanalyse (im Studium oder durch eigene Projekte) oder du befindest dich noch im Studium und suchst einen Job als Werkstudent (m/w/d)
Ausgeprägte Neugier, neue Fähigkeiten zu erlernen
Strukturierte Herangehensweise an komplexe Problemstellungen
Teamplayer mit ausgeprägten Kommunikationsfähigkeiten
Freude an der Arbeit in einem dynamischen Umfeld
Optional: Erfahrung mit SQL, Visualisierungstools, Google Sheets oder Stakeholder Management


Benefits

Extrem steile Lernkurve, kurze Entscheidungswege und direkte Zusammenarbeit mit dem online-erfahrenen Gründerteam.
Die Möglichkeit, die unmittelbare Wirkung deiner Arbeit zu sehen und eine junge, aufstrebende Marke mitzugestalten.
Ein schnelles, junges, dynamisches und hochmotiviertes Team im Herzen von Berlin (Hackescher Markt)
Viele Freiräume, um deine Aufgaben nach deinen Vorstellungen zu lösen
Regelmäßige Team-Events
Ein BVG-Ticket
Vollkommen flexible Arbeitszeiten

Smart Pricer ist das führende Unternehmen für die Optimierung von Ticketpreisen in Europa

Wir bieten Pricing Services in den Bereichen Bergbahnen, Sport und Entertainment an. Wir sind stolz darauf, mit Partnern wie den Bergbahnen Sölden und Zermatt, dem FC Bayern München, DFB, Hertha BSC und vielen mehr zusammenzuarbeiten. Unsere Arbeit ist geprägt von unternehmerischem Denken, effektivem Transaktionsmanagement und innovativen individuellen Lösungen. Unseren Erfolg als einer der weltweit führenden Spezialisten auf unserem Gebiet verdanken wir nicht zuletzt einer ausgeprägt teamorientierten Arbeitsweise.

Gemeinsam wollen wir weiter wachsen und suchen daher zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt in Berlin eine:n

Junior Data Analyst:in (m/w/d)

Aufgaben

Du bist Teil unseres jungen und dynamischen Teams. Unsere spannenden Projekte bieten Dir täglich neue

Herausforderungen und viel Raum für eigene Ideen und Initiativen.

Als Data Analyst:in bei Smart Pricer wartest und verbesserst du unsere zentralen Daten-Microservices und treibst die Produktivität und Datenverfügbarkeit im gesamten Unternehmen voran. Du begleitest unsere innovativen Pricing-Projekte vom Scoping bis zur Auslieferung. Weiterhin verstehst du die Auswirkungen der Preisgestaltung auf das Geschäft unserer Kund:innen, indem Du große Datensätze verarbeitest und statistische Analysen durchführst, um ihnen so zu besseren Entscheidungen zu verhelfen. Dafür erstellst Du Berichte und Dashboards zur Unterstützung der Stakeholder.

Intern stehst Du in engem Kontakt mit unserem Tech-, Consulting- und Produktteam, um in allen datenbezogenen Fragen beratend tätig zu sein. Extern nimmst Du zusammen mit dem Consulting-Team an ausgewählten Kundengesprächen teil.

Qualifikation

MUST HAVES

Abgeschlossenes Studium oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung im Bereich Statistik, Operations Research, Informatik, Physik, Mathematik oder einem ähnlichen quantitativen Bereich
Du bist ein:e Datenanalyst:in mit praktischer Erfahrung statistischer Untersuchungstechniken wie linearer/nicht-linearer Regression, Zeitreihenmodellierung, statistischen Tests, etc.
Solide Erfahrungen mit Python und den relevanten Data Analytics Bibliotheken (Pandas, Numpy, etc…)
Gutes Verständnis von SQL-Programmierung und dem Umgang mit Datenbanken
Du verfügst über eine analytische und unternehmerische Denkweise und hast eine Leidenschaft dafür, neue Abläufe aus technischer und kaufmännischer Sicht von Grund auf zu entwickeln


NICE TO HAVE

Du bist vertraut mit der Erstellung moderner BI-Dashboards, idealerweise mit Qlik Sense
Erste Erfahrung mit Machine Learning, vorzugsweise im Bereich Forecasting und Time-Series Modelling
Du kannst deine Ergebnisse souverän präsentieren, intern vor dem Team und extern gegenüber Kunden


DU PASST ZU UNS, WENN DU…

ein:e Teamplayer:in bist, der:die für andere einsteht, bereit ist anderen im Team zu helfen und sie zu unterstützen
dafür bist, dass die smartesten Ideen, unabhängig vom Titel gewinnen
keine Angst vor Fehlern hast, selbst reflektiert bist und aus deinen Fehlern lernst
den Status-quo immer wieder hinterfragst, damit wir als Team noch besser werden
kundenzentriert arbeitest und aktiv auf deine internen oder externen Kundenbedürfnisse eingehst
gerne Verantwortung für deine eigenen Projekte übernimmst, strategisch denkst und planst
du strukturiert und effizient arbeitest und dein Team an neuen Ideen und Prozessen teilhaben lässt
wenn du dich für die Sport und Eventbranche begeistern kannst


Benefits

DAS BIETEN WIR DIR

Eine einzigartige Teamatmosphäre: Einer für alle, alle für einen. Wir stehen füreinander ein, helfen und unterstützen uns gegenseitig. Remote UND vor Ort.
Regelmäßige Teamevents (jährliche Offsites in die Alpen, Escape Rooms, gemeinsame Koch- und Grillabende)
SP Academy: alle zwei Wochen findet unsere Academy statt und bietet dir regelmäßige Trainings. Zusätzlich unterstützen wir dich bei deiner persönlichen und fachlichen Entwicklung.
Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Homeoffice und Remote Work
Ein strukturiertes und umfassendes Onboarding, um dich auf deine neuen Aufgaben vorzubereiten
Regelmäßige 2-way Feedbacks, als Basis dafür, dass sich deine Rolle mit deinen Skills und Lernzielen weiterentwickelt


PRICING zu revolutionieren ist eine Mission, aber keine einfache. Darum suchen wir Dich. Lass uns

gemeinsam mit SMART PRICER, die Sport- und Entertainment Welt nachhaltig verändern!

Sende deine Bewerbung an bianca.paulick(at)smart-pricer.com.

Wir freuen uns auf Dich!
Desired Skills and Experience
Rest APIs

Statistik

Python

SQL

Dashboards

Qlik

CrazyLabs is a top 5 mobile games publisher with over 6 Billion downloads to date, a worldwide leader in hyper-casual games development, distribution, and innovation.

We’re looking for an experienced Game Data Analyst to work closely with the product teams to analyze performance metrics, create insights, and guide data-driven decisions.

If you have Passion for Gaming and work in a dynamic fast fast-paced environment, then this position is for you!

Here’s what we need, up for the challenge?

Analyzing large, complex data sets representing the behavior of millions of players to address strategic and operational business questions
Optimization and maximization users monetization

Build the future with Enter.

Our mission is to decarbonize homes by making home retrofits easy and accessible for everyone! We've raised 20 Mio. € from top-tier investors like COATUE, Foundamental & Target Global to make a carbon neutral home reality. Enter allows homeowners to make the best decision regarding the energy efficiency of their homes.

We believe in:

Working software over comprehensive documentation
Responding to change over following a plan
Embracing mistakes over avoiding them
Full ownership over full control
Simplicity and focus over completeness


We’re looking for people with an entrepreneurial mindset who enjoy having the freedom to directly own and impact parts of the Enter product.

Within Enter’s analytics team your role as the BI Analyst will be crucial to plan, build and maintain the dashboards we rely on in our strategic decision making as well as to provide the adhoc analyses we need in our day to day processes. Your area of focus will be our Operational Excellence domain. As part of this role you’ll build on the foundations of our BI processes, craft and improve data models, and set the trajectory for our data-driven future.

Your mission

Craft Business-Centric Data Models: As an integral part of Enter's analytics team, you'll feel responsible for all layers of data modeling, from raw to refined.
KPI Blueprinting & Deployment: Ideate, define, and establish key performance indicators (KPIs) for the Operational Excellence domain in collaboration with it’s business stakeholders. In addition to defining KPIs, you'll pioneer the development and upkeep of a comprehensive KPI catalogue.
Transform Data to Decisions: Combine the structured data models with KPIs to build and maintain expansive reports and dashboards that drive the strategic and operational business decisions in your domain.
Elevate the Data Discourse: Help foster data literacy within Enter. By equipping teams with the knowledge and tools they need, you ensure that data isn't just consulted but conversed with.
Hands-On Collaboration & Innovation: While you'll primarily be immersed in the world of BI, your collaboration with the data engineering team and hands-on work where possible ensures that the data models are cohesive, coherent, and capable of catering to both granular analysis and high-level insights. Your expertise will constantly bridge the gap between raw data and refined intelligence.


In this capacity, you'll be entrusted with the autonomy to innovate, drive changes, and make impactful contributions. You will take ownership for any analytics related topic within your domain. With the freedom to innovate and a team to harmonize with, your contributions as the BI Analyst will reshape how Enter perceives, processes, and proceeds with data.

Your profile

You have a minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar role, ideally during a growth phase of the company/team or the strong ambition to join a growing area.
Ideally, you have worked with operational focused business units before.
Proven hands-on experience with BI tools and databases, especially within data warehouses like Snowflake and transformation tools like DBT. Proficiency in SQL.
A robust track record of collaboratively developing and implementing KPIs, ensuring they remain actionable, relevant, and aligned with business needs.
Profound analytical skills, highlighted by a history of proactively driving BI projects from conceptualization through to production.
Expertise in creating, refining, and maintaining data models and KPI catalogues, ensuring seamless integration with business strategies.
Stellar communication skills, paired with the talent to convey intricate data insights in a lucid and engaging manner to a diverse audience.
A solution-centric mindset, underscored by an autonomous work ethic, enabling you to yield impactful results without incessant direction.


Benefits

Become part of one of Europe's fastest growing Climate Tech Startups - funded by Europe's best known VC's.
Attractive & competitive compensation.
Work with top talent in a dynamic environment.
Individual benefits: learning budget, Urban Sports Clubs membership, job ticket or daycare allowance.
Office with a direct view of the Spree River, with everything your heart desires.
Corporate Pension for your safe future.
Numerous team events, including weekly yoga.

Responsibilities

Job description

Responsible to solve challenging data harmonisation problems, utilizing optimal ETL patterns, frameworks, query techniques, sourcing from structured and unstructured data sources
Demonstrate advanced data engineering skills to build and implement optimized and reusable transformation models, dashboards, and data marts that facilitate agility and sustainability
Development of insights based on cloud-based data centric technologies such as Snowflake, MS Fibre
Responsible for building visualization of data in tools such as PowerBi, Tableau and automate workflows based on data insights with tools such as PowerAutomate
Proactively building and implementing intelligence requirements with Process Owners, Process Experts, Strategy Experts and stakeholders around the E.ON group
Collaboration with Data Experts and team members for development of Data Analytics capabilities while proactively contributing to the community of Data & AI

Qualifications

Bachelor's or Masters degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
Multiple years of experience in Data Engineering
Proven experience in data management concepts, data mesh, data lake, data warehouse, and data integration projects
Excellence knowledge of database optimization, as well as big data technologies 
Familiarity with programming languages like e.g. Python, as well as data quality assurance and monitoring
Experience with agile methodologies and DevOps capabilities
Proven data analytics and visualisation skills using tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders

Benefits

We provide full flexibility: Do your work from wherever you want in Germany; of course including all our great offices (from Hamburg to Munich). You want even more? Go on workation for up to 20 days per year within Europe. 
Recharge your energy: You have 30 holidays per year (Christmas and New Years Eve are always free days). Your battery still needs charging? You can exchange parts of your salary for more holidays or you take a sabbatical. 
Your development: We grow and we want you to grow with us! We support you with individual trainings and push your personal and professional development to the next level. 
We elevate your mobility: From car and bike leasing schemes to job tickets for most of our locations your way is our way. 
We also think ahead: With our company retirements scheme and a great insurance package we take care of your future. 
This is by far not all: We are looking forward to speaking with you about further benefits during the recruiting process. 

Inclusion

It is important to us that people with disabilities have access to a fair application process, providing them with an opportunity to shine. Therefore, our representative body for severely disabled people will be included in the process from an early stage. Please let us know via the application form if you require technical or organisational adjustments during the application process. We will strive to make the required aids available.

Should you not be able to apply online and want to speak someone in person, please contact your local recruiter.

Du hast Lust, aus unserem umfangreichen Datenschatz spannende Insights zu generieren, die unseren Marktplatz im Ratenkredit voranbringen? Du willst Verantwortung übernehmen und dich in einem agilen Umfeld austoben? Dabei suchst du außerdem Weiterbildungsperspektiven und Flexibilität im Arbeitsalltag? Dann bist du bei EUROPACE in Berlin genau richtig!

Wer ist Europace?

Hidden Champion: Die Europace AG ist ein Tochterunternehmen der Hypoport Gruppe. Wir sind seit über zehn Jahren erfolgreich und haben den Finanzierungsmarkt revolutioniert. Mit unseren Transaktionsvolumen von über 4 Mrd. Euro im Monat und einem Wachstum, das deutlich über dem Markt liegt, schreiben wir gerne mit dir unsere Erfolgsstory fort. 
FinTech: Wir sind Deutschlands größter Finanzinerungsmarktplatz für Immobilienfinanzierungen, Bausparprodukte und Privatkredite. Wir gestalten und bewegen Märkte und befinden uns auf einer stetigen Mission für die Verbraucher:innen. 
B2B2C: Wir sind B2B und denken B2C. Wir bringen Banken und Vertriebe zusammen, um für Verbraucherinnen den einfachsten Zugang zu den besten Finanzierungen zu schaffen. 

Wir bieten dir die Möglichkeit, dich in einem Team kreativ auszuleben. Durch das Einbringen deiner Erfahrungen, Ideen und deiner Leidenschaft für Daten hast du die Möglichkeit, Einfluss auf deinen Tätigkeitsbereich zu nehmen und deinen Arbeitsalltag abwechslungsreich zu gestalten.

Wir freuen uns auf dich - come as you are!

Wie sehen deine Aufgaben bei uns aus?

Du bringst dich ein: Du begleitest die Produktentwicklung im Ratenkredit bei Europace, identifizierst selbstständig relevante Fragestellungen und unterstützt eine datengetriebene Kultur im Unternehmen. 
Du bist vorausschauend: Du hast im Blick, welche Daten für zukünftige Analysen relevant sind und initiierst rechtzeitige Erweiterung unserer Datenbasis. 
Du unterstützt: Du hilfst den Produktteams beim Ableiten, Visualisieren und Hinterfragen relevanter Metriken, um den Erfolg des Produktes, die Erreichung von Geschäftszielen und den Effekt einzelner Initiativen kontinuierlich zu messen. 
Du befähigst: Du ermöglichst es deinen Team-Kollegeninnen, auch selbst mit Daten zu arbeiten. Neben den technischen Grundlagen vermittelst du hierzu das Bewusstsein für den Wert von Daten sowie ein Verständnis für unsere Datenbasis. 
Du wertest aus: Du erstellst praxisnahe Ad-Hoc-Analysen, Visualisierungen und Dashboards, die es uns selbst und Stakeholdern ermöglichen, fundierte Entscheidungen zu treffen. 
Du bringst uns weiter: Wir entwickeln nicht nur eine Plattform, sondern auch uns selbst. Du trägst dazu bei, dass wir als Team immer besser werden. 

Was erwarten wir von dir?

Fachlich: Du beherrschst deskriptive Statistik und hast deine Fertigkeiten bereits in der Vergangenheit in einer Beschäftigung als Data Analyst unter Beweis gestellt. Du kannst Metriken-Frameworks sowohl für ganze Produkte als auch für einzelne Features zusammenstellen, ins Leben rufen und revidieren. 
Technisch: Du kennst moderne Programmiersprachen im Bereich der Datenanalyse (wie z.B. Python oder R) sowie Datenvisualisierung-Tools (wir benutzen Qlik und Redash, sind aber für Bereicherung offen) und kannst dich mittels SQL selbst mit Daten versorgen. 
Methodisch: Du hast Erfahrung mit agiler Produktentwicklung und schätzt die Vorteile von selbstorganisierten cross-funktionalen Teams. Für relevante Projekte setzt Du Dich gerne ins Driver Seat. 
Kommunikation: Du bist ein "Data Socializer" und stets in der Lage, komplexe Analysen in und um Deine Domäne deinen Kolleg:innen aus cross-funktionalen Teams verständlich zu erklären. 
Arbeitsweise: Du bist strukturiert, flexibel und arbeitest eigenständig und verantwortungsbewusst. Wenn nötig, stellst du auch den Ist-Zustand in Frage und denkst ihn neu. Dank deinem Urteilsvermögen kannst du Anforderungen verstehen und hinterfragen sowie schnell zuverlässige Analyse-Lösungen bereitstellen. Dabei bist du neugierig, lernbereit und kreativ. 
Mindset: Du zeichnest dich durch Pragmatismus, einen guten Geschäftssinn und ein gesundes Maß an Detailgenauigkeit aus. Außerdem engagierst du dich, bringst dich ein und bist motiviert uns voranzubringen. Deine Neugierde und Auffassungsgabe helfen dir, die für dich neue Domäne Ratenkredit schnell zu verstehen und neue Themen rasch zu adaptieren, Ideen zu entwickeln und weiterzudenken. 

Was erwartet dich bei uns?

Ein Arbeitsplatz frei von Stereotypen! Die Energie unserer Teams wächst mit der Vielfalt an, mit den Perspektiven, die alle einbringen.

Vollzeit oder Teilzeit? Kinderbetreuung, psychische Belastung, Pflege von Angehörigen, Wiedereintritt ins Arbeitsleben nach längerer Pause - ganz egal aus welchen Gründen du nicht Vollzeit arbeiten kannst oder willst, bei uns ist Teilzeit genauso möglich.

Wir sind inklusiv! Ob spezielle Hilfsmittel, besondere Bedürfnisse oder sonstige Barrieren, wir sind motiviert eine Lösung zu finden, damit du bei uns so barrierefrei wie möglich arbeiten kannst. Gerne kannst du dich auch vor oder während des Bewerbungsprozesses an unser Diversity Team wenden: diversity@europace.de

What else? Auf @Europace, dem Europace-Blog und Inside Hypoport erfährst du noch mehr über uns. Wenn wir dein Interesse geweckt haben, dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung.

Bei Fragen wende dich gerne an Johanna:

Johanna Siepmann

Talent Relation Managerin @ Europace

johanna.siepmann@europace.de

Hypoport SE | EUROPACE AG www.hypoport.de | www.europace.de

Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music publisher worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.

BMG’s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We’re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.

 

We are currently seeking a passionate Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. As an experienced Data Analyst, you will collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!

 

What You’ll Be Doing

Process big data volumes, modeling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (e.g. Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs 
Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Finance) 
Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business 
Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products 
Interact with developers, data engineers, and management to propose new technologies, processes and system improvements, as well as global data governance strategies 

What You Bring

Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field 
Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python 
Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau 
Knowledge of data analysis methods and storytelling 
Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
Capability to plan and implement projects independently
Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment 

It’s also a plus if you have… 

Prior music industry experience
Experience with GCP, dbt and Git 
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence 
Understanding of statistical methods and ML 
Usage of ETL frameworks

What We Offer

A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work.
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, an annual Headspace membership, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, discounts for Bertelsmann employees etc.
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees.
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters.
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team.

Zander Labs is a leader in neuroadaptive technology, pioneering innovative solutions to enhance human-computer interaction. We are embarking on the NAFAS project, a landmark 30 million EUR initiative set to revolutionize the field.

We are looking for a skilled biosignal data analyst with 3-6 years of experience to join our scientific team. The successful candidate will be responsible for testing and evaluating novel data processing methods and for executing well-defined analysis protocols. The main focus will be on the analysis of multichannel electrical brain activity recordings (electroencephalography, EEG), and the occasional analysis of various biophysiological data (e.g. photoplethysmography, pupillometry, electromyography).

The tasks for this position are (among others):

Execution of analysis protocols for EEG preprocessing, including, filtering, artefact rejection, visual inspection, and data scoring.
Exploration of novel biosignal processing methods and their applicability to EEG analysis.
Feasibility assessment of signal processing methods from other domains.
Assistance to ongoing data collection efforts.
Preparation and presentation of (batch) analysis results.
Creation and/or update of large databases of processed data
Proven experience as biosignal analyst, with emphasis on EEG analysis
Studies in biomedical sciences, neuroscience, or a similar discipline (BSc and up)
Experience with MATLAB/Python programming languages
Experience with EEGLAB or MNE Python is a plus
Experience with EEG data collection is a plus
Familiarity with brain-computer interface technology is desirable
Ability to work collaboratively in a multidisciplinary team.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Command (written and spoken) of English language is a plus
